1.content:
The Wand of Swapping: an ancient artifact whose origin is now lost. Some say the Goddesses made it, to better understand their creation; others blame a mad wizard. Wherever it came from, though, its powers are clear- its wielder has the ability to exchange the attributes- whether physical, mental, or otherwise- of any two beings, merely by willing it. Moreover, neither its victims nor anybody else will be aware of the change, only the wielder. All others will fail to notice any difference, or act like things have always been that way.

One day, this powerful artifact finds its way into the hands of one of Hyrule's residents. Who is it?
1.title: The Beginning

11123.content:
Link hurried back to Clock Town, all while wondering who he should try the Swap Wand on first. There were so many choices; the dancing couple; the kids calling themselves 'Bombers'; that Tingle guy; and so on.

When he finally arrived at the town, another thought came to him. If this wand was so powerful, could it perhaps be used to swap something between himself from another time? As the Hero of Time, he had travelled seven years forward in time when he saved Hyrule from Ganondorf and although he could no longer travel to that timeline, maybe the wand could swap something between his current young self and his adult self from that time...

It sounded a little strange, but Link hoped that that could be the case. Even though he'd had the body of an adult at that point, his mind had still been that of a child. Like any child his age, Link would have loved to find out more about what an adult was really like, but hadn't had the time to do it because of the crisis. But now that it was over, he might have another chance at experiencing adulthood from the point of view of a child.

After finding a secluded spot where no one would be able to see him, Link prepared to use the wand. But, as he thought about whether the should swap something with an inhabitant of Termina or with his adult self, his eyes fell upon the Fierce Deity Mask hanging from his belt, which gave him an idea for a third possibility; maybe he could use the Swap Wand to swap certain things between his different forms!

During his adventure in Termina, he had collected a number of different masks that allowed him to transform into other forms. Each of these forms had their own strengths and weaknesses, but if he could use the Swap Wand to give himself the best attributes of all of his forms, it would be easy for him to defeat any other dark force that might arise in the future.

After thinking it over carefully, Link decided to swap something between himself and...
11123.title: Go to Clock Town

Link had just finished listening to Sheik explain his quest, but he sees a wand on the ground. Curious, Link goes to pick it up. When he touches it, his mind was instantly filled with knowledge on what it really was. What appeared to be an ordinary stick at first, this was actually the legendary Swap Wand! With it, he could twist the very fabric of reality itself by swapping things between anyone he wanted! He smirked as he considered all the possibilities. Link now starts to think of the various people he could swap.

Who will he choose?

1121121.content: Thinking over his options, Link's mind flew to Malon, the young girl living on Lon Lon Ranch that he made friends with in the past. Perhaps you could try swapping something with her. Provided nothing bad had happened to her in the seven years between then and now, she should be a perfect test subject. The only question then was what. Link knew he had to save Hyrule, but right now the Swap Wand was simply too tempting. Perhaps he should just swap something small and get on with things. Then again, something big like a full body swap or a life swap would be very interesting, although it would probably distract him from the mission he had been set. In the end, Link decided to swap...

He was supposed to save Hyrule, he couldn't be messing around with this sort of stuff for too long, even if a life swap would make someone else the hero so he could mess around with his new toy. Thinking about what small things he could swap with Malon, the obvious thing was to swap a bod. One body part shouldn't be too distracting, right? Just something a little different. He could go for something simple like her hair or her face, or maybe something a little more crazy like her breasts or vagina. However, another thought occurred to Link. Perhaps the things he swapped didn't need to be body parts. Perhaps he could change part of his personality or life, perhaps even his clothes. Even swapping something small, there were still so many choices. He knew he needed to decide quickly and get on with his quest. Hyrule wasn't going to save itself.

choices: Link swaps with his old body
Link uses the wand on Ingo
1121121212.content:
The moment Link finished waving the wand, he suddenly felt very different. But what caught his eye first was not his body, but rather where he was. Instead of the Temple of Time, he appeared to be in a stable of some sort, although it seemed mostly empty save for himself and a pair of cows. Speaking of himself, Link looked down at his body, strands of red hair falling into his vision. He was unmistakably female, going by the lumps on his chest and his rather small waist. He seemed to be wearing a white and purple dress, a pair of brown boots with a slight heel to them, and a yellow shawl with a pin based on some sort of monster pinned to it. He ran a hand through his now-red hair, finding it to long and silky. The wand had definitely worked; he had swapped bodies with Malon.

Speaking of the wand, Link found it was still held in his hand (although it was really Malon's hand). He let out a sigh of relief, knowing he wasn't stuck and could switch back if he wanted to. It certainly have been inconvenient if it had stayed with his old body. However, thinking about his old body reminded him of what he really should be doing right now. He had a quest to fulfill, and he certainly couldn't do that if he was here in Malon's body. That said, maybe it would okay to just stay a little while, he was rather curious about what it would be like to actually be Malon.

Before he could actually decide on whether to swap back or not, the door to the stable opened, and Ingo stepped in, looking much more sharply dressed than Link last remembered of him. He immediately looking over at Link, and glared at him. Link wasn't entirely sure what to say or do in this situation, so he just stood there awkwardly. Ingo didn't seem to take kindly to this.

"Well? Why are you just standing around? Get back to work, girl!" he shout at Link, who he thought was actually Malon.

"Um," Link mumbled, finding it odd to hear Malon's voice coming out of his mouth instead of his own. Wasn't Malon's father the one in charge of the ranch? Why was Ingo bossing Malon around? Had something happened here in the seven years that passed in his absence?

"What are you even doing? Playing with sticks?" Ingo shouted, noticing the wand, or stick as he called it, in Link's hand. "Give me that." He stomped over towards Link, hand outstretched to snatch the wand from him.

Link knew he couldn't let Ingo get his hands on the wand. Regardless of what was going on here at Lon Lon Ranch, Link didn't want to lose the Swap Wand and end up stuck in Malon's body, and he certainly didn't want someone like Ingo acquiring his powers. The safest option was probably to just swap back into his own body and get out of this situation. Or perhaps there was a way of swapping back into his old life while keeping Malon's body, as he still wasn't sure he wanted to give it up yet. On the other hand, perhaps he should use the wand on Ingo. If Ingo was treating Malon like this, something had to be done. Maybe he could swap Ingo with one of the animals or something. It'd give him some enjoyment seeing Ingo like that, and probably help out Malon when he got out of her body.

Link was resting on the side of a tree. He had just returned from saving Labrynna and Holodrum from Trinrova's evil scheme, and thwarted the twisted version of Ganon they had resurrected. It had been a grand adventure, but right now Link was content to gaze into the sky and relax after a hard quest's work.

He adjusted himself against the trunk of the tree, and in doing so his hand slipped. He felt something on the grass. He grabbed it without looking, and immediately knowledge of the Swap Wand entered his mind. His eyes opened wide as he realized that with this item, he could switch whatever he wanted and reality would bend to accommodate it. He had used many magical items in his journey, but nothing like this.

choices: Find something else to go with the Swap Wand.
115312.content:
The first thing Link thought was that yes, he had used many magical items in his journey. He took the wand and quickly ran home to a small box in his room.

Inside the box were a variety of magical rings. Of those rings, four in particular captured his interest: The Octo Ring, the Moblin Ring, the Like Like Ring, and the Subrosian Ring. Just by wearing one of these rings, he could transform himself into the aforementioned creature. The forms were normally useless, leaving him unable to attack or defend, but with the Swap Wand, perhaps they could be improved.

Link also looked over the rest of his items. Perhaps he would find something else that was useful.
115312.title: He considered his inventory.

choices: Slow down and do this one person at a time.
1153121.content: Link nodded to himself. Yes, these four rings would do nicely. The question now was, who would he swap those forms with? The first person to enter his mind was Princess Zelda. And considering his recent adventures, the three oracles popped into his mind. Nayru, Oracle of Time. Din, Oracle of Seasons. And Farore, Oracle of Secrets. These four seemed a good start, but Link had met a lot of people, and wondered if he'd enjoy swapping with any of them better. He wasn't on any quests or anything; perhaps he should relax and take this one person at a time, he thought to himself.
1153121.title: Use the transformation rings.

choices: desire. He'd take them for everything they were worth.
11531211.content:
Having made his decision, Link suddenly found himself in a dilemma. He had been very good friends with all four of these people. And he was a hero. Perhaps he should use the Swap Wand in moderation. Perhaps smaller swaps would be amusing enough to him while leaving them intact.

But then, other thoughts started creeping into his head. He was the hero. He was the one who had saved all of them. Maybe he could be better than all of them put together. Perhaps he should swap with them for everything it was worth - bodies, powers, lives, clothes...

Moderation and desire warred in his mind. In the end, he chose-
11531211.title: Zelda, Nayru, Din, and Farore

Link shrunk considerably and the Swap Wand clattered onto the floor. Fortunately, he as able to slink towards it and grab it with his new appendages. Focusing, he waved his wand and became-

1153121121121.content:
Link woke up to find himself lying on a balcony. He looked around and noticed that the balcony was located outside Zelda's bedroom in Hyrule Castle. He then noticed that he had long, golden hair next to both sides of his face. He then looked down and noticed he had boobs and was wearing a purple and pink dress with pink gloves and a cape. Then he remembered: The Swap Wand. He saw it laying next to him. He had forgotten that he had used it to switch bodies with Zelda. To clarify, he went into Zelda's room and looked at himself in a mirror. The wand had worked. He was no longer Link. Instead, he was now Princess Zelda.

All the possibilities he now had rushed through his mind. He had Zelda's body. He could do whatever he wanted with it and Zelda couldn't stop him. He could also rule over Hyrule in any way he wanted. As a loving ruler, a tyrant, or something else. He could also just live out Zelda's life from then on and pretend nothing happened. But he also realized that Zelda would now be running amok in his old body, possibly causing trouble.

He had four options, possibly even more. He didn't know what he should do. But then he decided on something.
1153121121121.title: Through the Eyes of a Princess

11531211212.content: Picturing Nayru in his mind, Link swung the wand with his tiny Octorok arm. Instantly, his body began to change. He became taller (which isn't saying much considering how short heu had been with the Octo Ring on), and his body took on a more human shape. His hair grew longer, and his chest and hips filled out. The transformation is completed, leaving Link standing there looking exactly like Nayru, the Oracle of Ages. He slowly took a few deep breaths, feeling his new breasts rise and fall with each inhale and exhale. He noticed that after swapping with Nayru, he was now...
11531211212.title: Nayru

choices: Keep Nayru's body and try again
115312112121.content:
Link looked upon the body he'd obtained. He had the body of Nayru, Oracle of Ages, in all her feminine glory. He'd even obtained her clothes, her lovely blue dress that served to accentuate her beauty. However, as he marveled as his new form, he noticed a rather disappointing feature of the swap. While he had indeed obtained her body and clothes, that meant losing not only the body he'd previously had, but also the clothes it had been wearing. This meant he was no longer wearing the Octo Ring.

Link groaned at his failure, sounding rather odd coming out of Nayru's sing-songy voice. He'd hoped to swap while wearing the transformation rings so that his transformed body would be replaced with the one he swapped with. Then, he'd simply have to take the ring off, and he'd be himself again, only with a ring he could use to turn into a beautiful lady instead of a monster. Unfortunately, it hadn't played out that way. He'd gotten Nayru's body, and Nayru had gotten his, ring and all.

There had to be a way around this. Link would not let himself be defeated so easily. This plan would work. He would claim the bodies of the Oracles and Zelda for himself. Sure, he could simply swap with them one at a time, like how he had currently swapped with Nayru, but why have one body when he could have five? He deserved it after all he'd done. He grabbed the wand again in his feminine hand, ready to try again. There was just one question, though; should he swap back before trying again? Nayru had his body right now, a body that he wanted to keep, along with the Octo Ring, so it made sense to swap back, but at the same time, he still had the other three transformation rings. He could use one of those and try perfecting his idea, before eventually getting his own body back. Why should he have to give up Nayru's body already when he'd only just gotten it?
115312112121.title: Dressed in her clothes (with the Octo Ring gone)

choices: Stay in Nayru's body for now.
115312112122.content:
Link couldn't help but blush a little as he looked at Nayru's beautiful, naked body that he now possessed. Well, naked save for the ring on his finger. He couldn't help but laugh, a little giddy with the power he'd been given, and hearing Nayru's sing-song voice coming out of his mouth as he laughed only continued to fuel his power trip.

"So, if this works, then I should be able to..." Link mumbled to himself as he gripped the Octo Ring between his dainty feminine fingers. He quickly took it off, and found that his body morphed back into his own, clothes and everything. This only made Link's grin grow even wider. He put the ring back on again, and his clothes vanished as he returned to Nayru's form. "Perfect." This was exactly what he'd hoped for when he got out those rings. With these, he could have five different bodies to choose from whenever he wanted, four of them female, and he couldn't even need to use the wand to swap between them. And the best part was that no one besides him would know anything was wrong.

He eyes the other three rings still sitting in his ring box. He could go ahead and put the next one on, and claim his next body, but at the same time, he'd only just gotten Nayru's body. He could always spend a bit of time getting accustomed to it. The lack of clothes also bothered him a bit, as it would make it a bit difficult for him to walk around in public in any of his borrowed bodies. Maybe the Swap Wand could do something about that, provided he could make sure the ring stayed where it was.
115312112122.title: Completely naked, except for the ring

"Hmm" Link thought,"I could use this on Zelda to get back at her for making me do all of these chores!" He put down his broom and walked out of the room and into the castle courtyard. "She must be around here somewhere... Ah ha! There she is!" Zelda was in the corner of the courtyard, talking with her father, the king. Sneakily, Link moved towards the two, hiding behind rows of bushes along the way. Finally, when he was as near as possible to Zelda and her father, Link could overhear their conversation. "We can't just kick him out!" Said the king. "He is the destined Hero of Hyrule!" Zelda, getting more and more aggravated, said," But father! He's lazy, he doesn't do his chores, he's constantly trying to hit on me, and I have just had enough of him!" Link, appalled from what he had just heard, angrily muttered "Well excuse me, Princess!" And waved the Wand of Swap.

1153211221.content:
“You know, if I was the Prince, I bet no one would boss me around,” said Link as he waved the wand around.

It was then the the King walked around the corner. He grinned as he saw Link, “Son! I do hope this morning finds you well.”

Link smiled back, “I'm great, King.”

King Harkinian shook his head genially, “No, no, please call me father.”

“Oh, right. Sure thing, pops.”

The King chuckled, “Very well.” He stroked his chin, “But what are you doing with that broom? Surely Zelda is the one who does the chores?”

Link's eyes lit up. Oh wow, I can't wait to see that! he thought. “Yeah, I know. I was just... getting her the broom.”

“How helpful of you,” replied the King, “but I'm sure she can handle herself. Shall we go see her?”

Link's answer couldn't come fast enough. “Of course!”

Suddenly, Link notices the Swap Wand sitting on Zelda's counter next to her bed. At least he (now she) knows he has it now. Link thinks of all the possibilities he has now that he's the monarch of Hyrule, but suddenly, something else catches his mind: What about his body? Is Zelda in it? Is it acting on its own? Link's body becomes Ruto's, but he stays in the present
115332222122211.content:
As Link thought about what to use the Swap Wand for, he ended up striking upon the idea of taking a vacation from his life. Sure, he had been hailed as a hero after the defeat of Ganon, but now his duties were rarely any different from any other knight, just with the respect that came from being the hero of legend. Perhaps it would be nice to be someone else for a while, and take a break from being himself. Now it was just a question of who to swap with.

Princess Zelda was the first to come to mind. Although it would probably be weird being a girl, being a princess would probably be a nice break from being a knight. A different kinda of respect was imparted upon those of royalty than upon heroes. He wasn't sure what sort of administrative work or the like was required of a ruler, but he was sure he could handle it. There was only one problem; his conscience. Between the war against Cia and Ganon, and the peace that had followed, Link had really gotten to know Zelda, and thought of her as a friend, or perhaps even more. He would feel pretty bad about "borrowing" her body like that, even if the wand would make it so she wouldn't find out about it. Still, the life of a princess did seem pretty appealing. Perhaps there was another princess somewhere he could swap with?

After a bit of thought, Link remembered his allies from across the ages, who assisted him in the war against Cia and Ganon. In particular, he remembered Ruto, the princess of the Zoras, a race of fish-like people. Although Link did still consider her a trustworthy ally, he didn't know her as well as he did Zelda, and wasn't as close with her. As such, he didn't feel as much guilt about borrowing her body to take a vacation from being himself. This option was not without its own complication, however. Ruto from an entirely different time period, the Era of the Hero of Time. Although Cia's magic had called forth locations and people from across the ages, Link wasn't so sure the wand would work on Ruto now that she had returned to her own time. Still, there was no harm in trying. Link held the wand up, and waved it, thinking about swapping bodies with Princess Ruto.

As the wand weaved its magic, it would seem not even the fabric of time could stop it, but how exactly did it work?
115332222122211.title: A Fishy Situation

1153322221222112.content: Do Link's clothes change as well as his body, disappearing since Ruto doesn't wear clothes, or does he keep his clothes, having Ruto's body dressed in his hero's tunic?
1153322221222112.title: Link's body becomes Ruto's, but he stays in the...

choices: Link decides to find out who people see him as
Link decides to try using the wand again
11533222212221121.content:
After Link waved the wand, he felt incredibly different. Parts of his body felt like they had been bulged out or squished in, extra parts were hanging off his body, even his skin felt different as a breeze danced across it. He looked at the hand that was holding the wand, and noticed it seemed much daintier, with longer fingernails, and most importantly, it was covered in blue scales.

Looking down at himself, Link no longer saw his own body. Rather, he saw the scaly feminine body of Ruto, princess of the Zoras. His body was clearly female, as evidence by the wide hips, thin waist, void between his legs, and decent sized breasts on his chest, only being covered by a pair of fins growing out of his body. Said fins also grew out of his back, elbows, and hips. He now had webbed feet, and his head was rather oddly shaped. His ears had become fins, and the pair of purple earrings hanging from them was the only item of clothing that seemed to be anywhere on his body. And of course, his entire body was covered in light blue scales.

"Wow," Link mumbled, hearing Ruto's voice coming out his mouth instead of his own. "This is amazing." He rand his hand down his body, find the experience of feeling both his new feminine curves and his new scales at the same time to be rather odd. It was a rather drastic departure from his usual body.

However, it seemed Link's body was indeed the only thing that changed. Looking around, he found he was still standing in Hyrule Field, in the present era. "Well, that's disappointing." Link had hoped to borrow Ruto's body so he could take a vacation from being himself by living the life of a princess. If he was still in the present, then he wouldn't be able to rule over Ruto's kingdom. He couldn't help but wonder whether people would recognise him as Link or Ruto at the moment. Looking down, he saw Ruto, but Ruto didn't live in this time period, so maybe the wand just changed his body into Ruto while still having him be Link. This seemed to be something worth investigating. If people saw him as Ruto, despite still being in the present, then he might still get to experience some special privileges as a princess. He might not have his own kingdom to rule over, but he had a feeling Zelda would treat another visiting princess pretty well, especially one she'd fought alongside before. Of course, it could always be that he was still Link, and just looked like Ruto. That wouldn't really allow him to take a vacation from his own life, but at least he got an interesting experience by changing his body. Perhaps he should try the wand again. Sure, the body swap didn't exactly work as he'd hoped, but maybe he could try wording his swap differently to try and let him live out life as the princess of the Zoras.

1153322221222222222221.content:
Link considered his options. He knew plenty of people amongst the ranks of Hyrule's knights, but none really provided any sort of interesting things to swap. His friends who had helped him in the fight against Cia and Ganondorf could all provide interesting opportunities for swaps, but majority of them were now scattered across time, and those that weren't, he was too close friends with to risk testing something like this on them. What if the swap went wrong and he hurt them somehow? What if they were able to see the swaps, and got mad at him for using it on them? No, he couldn't bring himself to do that to them.

But then, who was left to swap with? Link paced around Hyrule Field, trying to think of someone to test out this magical artifact on. There had to be someone, he wasn't just going to give up and let this wand go to waste. He stopped his pacing for a moment as he noticed the small temple housing the Fairy Fountain near Hyrule Castle. Of course; the Great Fairy! Not only would swapping with her almost certainly provide an interesting experience, but he weren't close enough with her to feel bad about swapping with her, and there were multiple Great Fairies around the world, so if he messed something up with this one, there'd still be other Great Fairies to pick up the slack.

Now it was merely a question of what to swap. The most obvious thing would be her body. It took out the complication of trying to think of smaller individual things by just taking the big one, and it would certainly provide Link with an interesting experience. Although, he couldn't help but wonder exactly how it would work if he asked for her body and nothing else. Would his body transform right here, leaving him in his own clothes? Would his mind be placed in her body? And if he had her body, would people recognise him as Link, or would he be living the Great Fairy's life?
1153322221222222222221.title: Great Fairy

11533222212222222222211.content: Before we continue, is Link's mind put inside the Great Fairy's body, with him considered as being the Great Fairy (mind swap), or does Link's body just turn into the Great Fairy's, with him still being himself (body swap)?
11533222212222222222211.title: Link swaps bodies with the Great Fairy

choices: Link leaves things as is for now
115332222122222222222111.content:
After waving the wand, Link suddenly found himself floating above the ground, his body feeling bloated or shrunken in several different places. Looking down, it wasn't hard to see why; Link was no longer himself. He now possessed the body of the Great Fairy. He had her soft pale skin, her long pink hair and fingernails, her slim, feminine arms. He had her two large breasts on his chest, her slim waist and wide hips, her void between his legs. He had her tight, leafy top clinging to his chest, and her somewhat transparent pants, showing off her long shapely legs underneath. The Great Fairy's fountain seemed much smaller than it had last time he was hear, indicating he had her large size as well. Link had it all.

"Woah," he muttered, hearing the Great Fairy's voice speak instead of his own. It was surreal enough that he had a body different from his own, but it was clear that wasn't all that had changed. After all, he was floating off the ground right now, so he likely had all her powers. Looking around the fountain, several smaller fairies seemed to be flying around, aimlessly wandering or making idle conversation with each other. None of them seemed to show any sort of reaction to what had just happened. Link had wondered if he'd still be recognised as himself after a body swap, and it seemed he had his answer; the world saw him as one of the Great Fairies.

Link wasn't entirely sure what he wanted to do now. He no longer had the duties of a soldier or a hero, and the Great Fairy's powers were not often required by the citizens, generally being used in times of war or crisis, which meant Link now had plenty of time to do whatever he wanted. He had just undergone a huge change, perhaps he should stay like this for a while. He could test out the Great Fairy's power, or perhaps just explore his new body a bit. However, he did still have the wand, now looking rather grasped between his large, feminine fingers. As big as a change as this was for him, he couldn't imagine the Great Fairy's life was very interesting, seeing as it was rare for people to visit the fountain. Maybe he could swap again, into someone else's body, or perhaps something different to occupy his time and make things even more interesting.
115332222122222222222111.title: Link the Great Fairy

choices: Human Size (The body has been shrunken)
115332222122222222222112.content:
Link had only just finished waving the wand when he suddenly felt very different. Most of his body felt slimmer and less muscular, while his chest, hips, and butt felt like they'd inflated. He felt a certain emptiness between his legs, and something long and heavy pulling down on his head. He let out a gasp at all the sudden changes, and almost gasped again when he noticed how feminine it sounded. Without a doubt, the Swap Wand had granted his request, and given him the body of the Great Fairy.

However, was the Great Fairy's body still it's usual size, or had it been shrunk down to a normal human size?
115332222122222222222112.title: Getting a GREAT Body

choices: Use the wand to get a new outfit
1153322221222222222221121.content:
Link noticed he seemed to be much bigger than he usually was. That was to be expected, the Great Fairy was much larger than he was, after all. What he didn't expect, however, was the breeze he was feeling all over his body. He looked down, only for his face to turn deep red with embarrassment. He had expected to see the Great Fairy's voluptuous female body when he looked down, but he hadn't expected it to be completely naked! Link held one arm in front of his breasts, and the other in front of his crotch, trying to cover up his privates, even if there wasn't anyone around at the moment to see him.

How had this happened? It wasn't like the Great Fairy normally paraded around naked, so why, when swapping into her body, had he wound up without clothes. The answer was actually rather simple, as Link figured out when he looked at the area around his feet. There, sitting around his pink-painted toenails, were scraps of green, white, and brown fabric that used to be his usual tunic, pants, and boots. It seemed that when swapping into the Great Fairy's body, he had kept his own clothes, which for some reason hadn't adjusted their size to match his new body. As such, the clothes simply split apart due to being unable to contain a body that was over twice his size. This left him in a rather unfortunate predicament. He was now in the Great Fairy's body, but without any clothes. With how big the Great Fairy's body was, it would be rather unlikely that he'd be able to get back to his room unseen, and even then, his other clothes probably hadn't changed size either. Even if he swapped back into his own body, his clothes were already torn, so there was no real sense in swapping back already. Even though the Great Fairy's body had caused this predicament, he didn't really want to give it up just yet. It'd be boring to swap back so soon.

But what was there to do then? Perhaps he could improvise an outfit somehow? The outfit the Great Fairies usually wore seemed like it was pretty much just made of leaves, maybe he could put together something like that? On the other hand, he did still have the swap wand. Maybe he could use it to swap clothes with someone else, making sure to specify that the clothing should adjust to the size of his new body.
1153322221222222222221121.title: Exposed and At Large

11533222212222222222211212.content:
Link decided that the safer option would be to use the wand. If he did that, any changes would be seen as normal, whereas people would probably find it weird if he suddenly showed up wearing an outfit made of leaves. Now it was a question of who to swap with. The obvious choice was the Great Fairy herself, seeing as Link already had her body. Of course, there were other people he knew whose clothes he could borrow. For some reason, the idea of causing a little chaos and mixing things around seemed very appealing to him right now. Perhaps the wand was being a bad influence on him, enticing him into using it. Right now, however, he was more concerned with sorting out his clothesless situation than however the wand might be influencing.

Whose clothes does Link try to take?

As fun as causing a little chaos by swapping might be, right now Link just wanted to cover up and not be seen walking around naked. He didn't know whether requesting a simple clothes swap would adjust the clothing to fit him or not, so it would be smarter to swap with the Great Fairy, seeing as her clothes should fit his body, which was actually her's, perfectly. If the clothes didn't adjust, and he tried to swap with someone else, he'd just end up shredding their outfit too as the wand attempted to place it on his large body. It wasn't like the clothes would be doing the Great Fairy much good right now anyway; if he'd shredded his clothes by being too large for them, then the Great Fairy's clothes must be way too big for her now that she had his body. So, holding the wand in his large feminine hand, he waved it, thinking about taking the Great Fairy's outfit, from her top that seemed to be composed of only leaves, to her pants that were mostly transparent. It wasn't optimal, but at least it'd cover him up.

Does the outfit adjust because of the difference in sizes between Link and the Great Fairy's bodies?

choices: Link swaps back with the Great Fairy before getting new clothes
Link doesn't swap back with the Great Fairy before getting new clothes
1153322221222222222221121212.content:
A swarm of fabric seemed to materialise around Link after he waved the wand, but something was definitely still wrong. He didn't have the Great Fairy's tight-fitting top pressed against his chest, nor her somewhat loose pants flowing around his legs. The clothes were here, alright, but not in the way Link had hoped.

"Seriously!?" Link nearly shouted, grabbing a hold of the pants's waistline to prevent it from falling around his ankles. It seemed that a simple clothing swap did, in fact, adjust the size of the clothes involved to match the new wearer, which had some annoyingly unintended results on this occasion. Even though Link had the body these clothes were made for, after the first swap, they were far too big for their owner. In trying to swap clothes, the Great Fairy's outfit had grown, so that it would be just as ill-fitting on Link's current giant body as they had been on the Great Fairy a few moments ago. His legs were swimming in the fabric of the pants, and he was sure any attempt at walking would cause him to trip. The top was no longer as tight as it should be, threatening to fall of his shoulders if he moved even a little, and the cleavage window was now large enough to expose his entire chest, leaving the Great Fairy's breasts just as uncovered as they'd been before the clothes swap.

Link let out a loud, feminine-sounding sigh. At the very least, he now knew that trying to swap clothes would result in the outfit adjusting to match the size of the wearer, meaning that despite having the Great Fairy's giant body, he could swap with anyone he wanted, and their clothes would fit him just fine. That seemed like a very good option right now, seeing how poorly the Great Fairy's clothes were fitting him at the moment. However, he wondered if he should swap back with the Great Fairy first. If he did that, whoever he swapped with would have him clothing, but far too small for their body, essentially forcing them to go naked, and the Great Fairy would be back in her incredibly oversized clothing. On the other hand, if he didn't swap back, the Great Fairy would be the one left naked, while whoever's clothes Link took would be the one wearing this metaphorical fabric ocean.
1153322221222222222221121212.title: Correct Clothing, Incorrect Size

choices: Link just heads back to his patrol
1153322221222222222221122.content:
Link looked down at himself, only to find his view of his body obscured by two lumps on his chest, pushing out his tunic. He ran his hands down his body, feeling the new feminine curves he'd obtained, and the emptiness between his legs. It was all strangely exiting, how different it was. He also found it a little odd that despite gaining the Great Fairy's body, he was still a regular-sized for a Hylian, rather than being as giant as the Great Fairy normally was. Additionally, he was still wearing his own clothes, and he couldn't detect any traces of make up on his face. He could only assume that the same was true for the Great Fairy, and that she'd have his body, but still be giant, and still be wearing her own clothes and make up. Link shuddered to think what his body would look like wearing the Great Fairy's clothes, even if it wasn't his body at the moment.

Before he could explore his body further, he heard a voice calling out to him. "Hey, Link!" He turned around, quickly hiding the remote behind his back. One of the Great Fairy's long pink ponytails swung around and practically hit him in the face as he did so. As it turned out, the person calling to him was Impa, a general in Hyrule's army, and an adviser to princess Zelda. "What are you doing out here?" she asked as she approached.

Link assumed she was referring to the fact that he had left his patrol. He wasn't about to tell her exactly what he fact, he didn't want to share this knowledge with others quite yet, so instead, he told a bit of a white lie. "I thought I saw something out here, but it turned out to be nothing," Link replied, doing his best not to show any sort of reaction to the fact that he was speaking with the Great Fairy's voice instead of his own.

"Well, shouldn't you be heading back to your patrol, then?"

"Of course. I was just heading back now."

Impa still seemed a little suspicious, but she seemed to let it go, heading back towards the castle, with Link following behind. As boring as his patrol usually was, he had a feeling this wand was going to make it a lot more interesting. Speaking of the wand, as Link walked, he couldn't help but notice how much his chest bounced with each step. It was somewhat distracting. It was probably due to the size of the Great Fairy's assets combined with the fact that he was still wearing clothes meant for a man. Perhaps he could use the wand to do something about that.
1153322221222222222221122.title: Pink-Haired Hero

choices: Link swaps heads with the Great Fairy
Link thinks of something else to swap
11533222212222222222212.content: Link decided he wasn't ready for the full experience like that, especially with so many unknowns. Perhaps, something a little simpler, but with a similar effect? Link thought that perhaps he could swap heads with the Great Fairy. Sure, there was still the unknown of whether Link's head would be placed on the Great Fairy's body, or if Link would keep his body and simply have his head become the Great Fairy's, but in either case, it should still leave him living his own life. If the knowledge he had gained about the wand was correct, everyone besides him should think the change was normal, so he should have to worry about people freaking out.
11533222212222222222212.title: Head of the Fairies?

choices: The Great Fairy's head atop his shoulders
The Great Fairy's body below his neck
115332222122222222222121.content: Link decided that that seemed like and interesting idea, and so he waved the wand in front of him, thinking about swapping heads with the Great Fairy who resided near Hyrule Castle. And all of a sudden, it just happened. No magical lights or fanfares, it just happened in an instant. After a quick examination, Link found that the Swap Wand had given him...
115332222122222222222121.title: Link swaps heads with the Great Fairy

choices: The Great Fairy's head stays the same size.
The Great Fairy's head adjusts its size.
1153322221222222222221211.content: Before we continue, does the Great Fairy's head stay the same size, looking comically large on Link's body, or does it adjust to the size of Link's head?
1153322221222222222221211.title: The Great Fairy's head atop his shoulders

choices: Link performs a swap with the great fairy.
Link keeps it, and decides what to do next.
11533222212222222222212111.content:
Link blinked, feeling very confused. Everything felt the same, except he seemed to be...taller? And it felt like a lead weight had been strapped to his head, and it threatened to send him to the ground. Reaching his arms up to stead himself, he expected to find his own head atop his shoulders but instead, hit a wall of sorts...something huge was on his neck that extended past his shoulders!

Link was pretty sure he knew what what had happened, but he didn't want to confirm his suspicions. He couldn't put it off forever, though. Tentatively, he reached a hand around to his 'face', and where he would've expected to feel his hand on his head, all he felt was something small touching his chin, the skin of which felt much softer than his own. Sliding his hand up the smooth surface, his fingers caught on huge, plush lips, and Link finally let out a gasp, eyes widening at how feminine the gasp sounded.

He had headswapped with the great fairy alright, except the outcome wasn't as he expected. Her head stood on his shoulders, just as beautiful as ever but outrageously oversized! Not to mention unfitting, considering that from the neck down the rest of his body was the same as ever. Looking down at himself, he was unable to get a good angle on his own body, only really seeing his undersized arms as they brushed across his now womanly head. He couldn't even reach the top of his head, arms stopping short just shy of his eyes.

Carefully, Link took a step forward, and nearly fell to the ground as the weight of his head shifted around uneasily. Not only did his head weigh a ton, but the great fairy had long locks of hair that were intended to hang down the full length of her body...so naturally it fell to the ground, dragging several feet behind link while also needlessly weighing him down.

If he held it up with his arms, he could move around easily, but he'd have to get used to normal movement or people will probably get suspicious. After all, what kind of sword fighter fights with their hands on their head?

Link felt ridiculous, and he probably looked ridiculous too, though he at least felt safe in the knowledge that nobody else would see anything wrong with the way he looked. What about the great fairy? She must look ridiculous with her undersized head, not to mention having the face of a guy! She couldn't see anything wrong with the way she looked either, but Link still felt a little bad about it.

He wondered, though...the Swap Wand was powerful, and rather vague in its capabilities. Could Link swap the size of the great fairys head with the size of his old head? That'd make things bearable at least. Then again, it might cause more problems then its worth, and maybe holding on to his new giant, ladylike head would be fun? Maybe?!
11533222212222222222212111.title: The Great Fairy's head stays the same size.

choices: Link goes all out, takes the rest of the Great Fairy's body.
Link tackles the problem rationally, fixing the head size itself(?)
115332222122222222222121111.content:
Link decided that he would swap something with the great fairy in an attempt to make him feel less ridiculous. Swapping himself completely back to normal was an option, but although he wouldn't say it out loud, he actually didn't mind the strangeness that came with the swapping. As far as he knew, there was no real consequences to swapping, since it could all be undone. And it was... fun, albeit really weird.

What Link really wanted to do was fix the giant head problem, and he realized there were a few ways to do that. On one hand, he could go all out and take the Fairy's body aswell. As if having the head of a woman wasn't bad enough, Link would be going full woman, and the idea was strangely inviting in a scary sort of way. Plus, he'd be giant! Sort of. If people still treated Link like Link, then he'd certainly be advantaged if he ever needed to fight. Although fitting inside the castle would be awkward.

The other option, the more reasonable option, was to tackle the 'giant head' problem directly. Just swap his head size with the great fairys head size, right? Then her head would fit squarely on his shoulders, and the great fairy would have that matched her huge body. Though, Link was tentative to choose this option. Mostly because it was boring, but he had a bad feeling that he'd word the swap correctly in his mind, and cause some effect he didn't anticipate. That's silly though, right? It's just an extremely powerful magic artifact that inexplicably swapped things around whilst changing reality so that it was normal... What could possibly go wrong.
115332222122222222222121111.title: Link performs another swap with the great fairy.

choices: "I want to swap the size of the Great Fairys head with the size of my old head."
"I want to swap sizes with my old head." (Oops.)
1153322221222222222221211112.content:
This was the obvious solution, Link thought. Nothing could go wrong, certainly.

Unless he worded his request incorrectly.

Link threw caution to the wind as a command for the Swap Wand entered his mind's eye. The Wand took it literally, and in an imperceptible blink, something changed.

But what was Link's command?
1153322221222222222221211112.title: Nothing could go wrong, if you used it correctly..

choices: The wand had shrunk down to his size.
The wand was still normal sized, which was pretty big for him now.
11533222212222222222212111122.content:
Link waved the wand, thinking to himself, "I want to swap sizes with my old head."

Unfortunately for him, the wand took his poorly-worded very literally, just as it had done with the head swap. after he had waved the wand, Link suddenly found himself to be much smaller, but was still being thrown off balance by his giant head.

"Hey, what gives?" Link said aloud, before covering his mouth as he heard the Great Fairy's voice come out instead of his own. Although, covering his mouth was quite hard to do considering how large it was in comparison to his hand at the moment. Looking around, Link saw he was definitely much closer to the ground, his chin just barely poking above the grass. Despite the shrinking, his head still remained far too big for his body, and thus this hadn't solved any problems.

It took Link a moment to realise what had happened, and why. Although he had meant to swap the size of his head with his old one, he had only specified the swapping sizes part, not that he wanted to limit it to the Great Fairy's head which he had. And so, his entire body, head included, was now only as tall as his old head had been. The meant the Great Fairy now probably had a head as tall as he usually was, plus the added height of his giant head, making her new male head even larger than her old one.

Although his head was technically now a more manageable size, his body was also much smaller, completely negating that. He needed to swap again, at the very least to regain his usual height. Unfortunately, during the shock that came from shrinking, Link had accidentally dropped the wand, and now went looking for it amongst the much taller grass. He eventually found it, and noticed that...
11533222212222222222212111122.title: "I want to swap sizes with my old head."

choices: "I want to swap my size back with my old head." (Reversing the swap)
"I want to swap back with my old head." (Oops)
115332222122222222222121111222.content: When Link found the wand, he noticed it seemed bigger than it had before. Of course, in reality the wand had remained the same size, he'd just shrunken. Link was both grateful for this revelation, and annoyed by it at the same time. On one hand, the wand remaining the same size had made it pretty easy to spot in the grass. On the other hand, it was now rather big compared to the tiny body underneath his head. He managed to pick it up, a difficult feat to accomplish without his head causing him to topple over, and found it to be rather heavy with his new size. Of course, this merely strengthened Link's resolve to swap back even further. And so, he gathered up his strength, and lifted the wand aloft, waving it as he thought...
115332222122222222222121111222.title: The wand was still normal sized

choices: Link stays as himself while trying to reverse the swaps
Link swaps with someone else before trying to reverse the swaps
1153322221222222222221211112222.content:
Once the wand was waved, and the swap occurred, Link knew he had screwed up again. Instead of getting back to his regular size, albeit with the Great Fairy's large head upon his body, his body had remained tiny, as was evidenced by the large wand in his hands. His line of sight did rise up further off the ground, however, coupled with the large weight on his shoulders multiplying even further. He reached up to try and touch his face, as he'd done when he first swapped with the Great Fairy, but found that he was barely able to even get his arm around to reach the front of the large mass that sat atop his neck.

He realised what had happened. Another poorly thought out swap. Instead of reversing the previous swap, giving Link his regular size back, he'd reversed the first swap, giving him his regular head back, albeit with some rather large alterations. He now had his own body back fully, but his head was about the size the Great Fairy's head usually was, and his body was tiny! He was struggling to even stay standing with his massive head being pushed down by gravity. Speaking of the Great Fairy, although Link couldn't see her, he knew she was now mostly normal, save for having a head too small for her body.

Link was starting to believe this wand was capable of more harm than good. It had started out with a simple test, a bit of curiosity, but now a handful of poorly worded swaps had resulted in him becoming a freak, barely able to stand with how large his head was, and how tiny his body was. Unfortunately, although the wand was the cause of this, it was also his only way out of this. He'd probably have the reverse all the swaps one by one, first the head, then the size, and then maybe the head again if he wasn't ready to mess around again yet. However, after seeing how badly a small mistake could screw things up, Link was admittedly a little afraid to try again. Perhaps it would be safer for him to work on this from an outside perspective, where he wouldn't have to feel the repercussions of his mistakes first hand? He could try swapping into someone else's body, and then while he was them, he could work on fixing his own body without experiencing every change himself.
1153322221222222222221211112222.title: "I want to swap back with my old head."

choices: Link swaps his legs so he can stay standing
Link doesn't swap, and just keeps practicing instead
115332222122222222222121112.content:
He probably looked silly and ridiculous, and this was probably weird, but for some reason, the idea of having the Great Fairy's head atop his shoulders was interesting and exciting to him, huge difference in size and all. He didn't know why, but he knew that, for the time being at least, he wanted to keep this. A smile started to spread across his heavily made up face, not understanding why the strangeness was giving him a sense of joy, but also not really caring.

Wondering what to do next, Link took another step forward, only to almost fall flat on his gigantic face. Moving around with a head this big was going to take some practice. Holding his head up, Link took a couple of steps forward, finding it to be fairly easy so long as he held it with his hands. That wasn't really an option, though. The Swap Wand would have made it normal for him to have a head this big, so people would question why he was always holding it up with his hands, probably. Not to mention, if a battle broke out, Link would have a tough time fighting if both his hands were busy holding his head.

He slowly let go of his head, and took a very small step. He felt his balance wobble, but for the most part, he was able to stay upright. He took another step, this time managing to hold his head steady. Then another, bigger this time. And another, and another, until... Link stepped a little bit further than he was ready for, and toppled over onto the ground. He sighed, noting how feminine it sounded. There had to be a quicker way to do this. He still had the wand, after all. Couldn't that do something.

The obvious solution would be to change the size of his head, but that was out of the question, since Link wanted to keep the Great Fairy's head, while also keeping it at its normal size. He thought perhaps he could swap skills with someone to make this easier for him, but since he had created this rather unique situation himself, he couldn't think of anyone he could steal a "walking with a giant head" skill from. The only other option, save for just practicing, was to find some sort of counterbalance. Something that would keep him standing even if his head toppled one way or another. He considered his options, wondering if he knew of anyone who's legs he could borrow to help him stay standing.
115332222122222222222121112.title: Link keeps it, and decides what to do next.

choices: Link swaps with the Great Fairy again
Link swaps with one of the giant boss monsters
1153322221222222222221211121.content:
Link didn't want to swap away the giant female head he had gotten himself, and practicing walking with it was taking too long, so he decided another swap might be the best solution. He just needed something that would let him keep his feet on the ground despite his head wobbling. Or perhaps "his feet" wasn't the most accurate term, as his feet was what they were considering swapping away. With larger feet, or stronger legs, he might have a better chance to keeping his balance. He figured he might as well go for the feet first, seeing as how he could always just add the legs on top of that if it didn't work.

Now the problem was who to swap with. Most people he knew were pretty normal sized, and borrowing their legs or feet wouldn't really help him. First to come to mind was the most obvious choice; the Great Fairy herself. He had taken her large head, so her feet and legs would be just as large proportionately. The only other things he could think of that were large enough, or had strong enough legs, were some of the monsters he'd faced, like King Dodongo or The Imprisoned. Swapping with one of them would certainly be interesting, although Link wasn't sure swapping with The Imprisoned would actually work, seeing as it was from another era of Hyrule's history.
1153322221222222222221211121.title: Link swaps his legs so he can stay standing

choices: Link practices with his giant head and feet
11533222212222222222212111211.content:
Decided to just keep swapping with the same Great Fairy for the time being, Link waved the wand, and in an instant, he could feel the grass beneath his feet, which felt much heavier. Although he couldn't clearly see his body with how large his head was, he was still able to see his new feet. The skin was as soft and pale as that of his current head, and the toenails were longer, and painted a bright pink, matching your hair. In addition, considering you could actually see this, his were no longer wearing boots.

Link tried lifting up one of his legs. It felt a lot heavier with the Great Fairy's giant foot stuck to the end of it. He had a feeling it would make his movements much slower. Still, with these large feet extending out in front of him, perhaps it would be enough to let him keep his balance. He tried taking a step. It was slow, as he did his best to lift his heavy foot into the air, but he managed to stay standing. Then he took another, and another. After a couple of these, he felt his head start to wobble again, and tried leaning forward. Normally the weight of his head going forwards would have caused him to topple over, but with his new feet, he managed to stay upright. This was exactly what Link had been hoping for.

It wasn't a perfect solution, however. Even though he was now able to walk without his head making him fall over, his large feet now slowed his movements, his regular legs not strong enough to pick them up any faster. Now Link faced another dilemma, one rather similar to his initial head problem; should he just practice and try to get good with these feet, or should he find a quicker solution by swapping again? He could always try taking the Great Fairy's legs as well. Then he would have legs proportionate to his feet and should have no problem picking them up to walk, although he wondered whether this would still keep the balance he'd received or not.
11533222212222222222212111211.title: From Head to Toe

choices: Link stays as is for now
115332222122222222222121112111.content:
Link ultimately decided against swapping his legs as well. Although it might give him the strength to lift up his giant feet quicker than he'd been doing right now, he felt it wasn't entirely necessary, at least for now. Sure, he was walking a bit slower than he used to be able to, but for the time being, Hyrule was in a time of peace, so there probably wouldn't be many occasions where he really need to rush somewhere fast. Right now, the Great Fairy's feet were doing what they needed to do, and that was keep him standing despite his large head. He didn't mind that it resulted in him walking a bit slower for the time being, and if it bothered him that much in the long run, he could probably swap them back with the Great Fairy once he was used to her giant head, and was able to keep his balance without the aid of her feet. For now, he decided to just keep the Great Fairy's head and feet, and work with that.

With that being decided, Link returned to practicing walking around with his oddly proportioned body. It still took a bit of effort to lift up his large, feminine feet, but he was slowly getting used to it, figuring out how fast he could move, and how much pressure he had to apply to do so. Whenever his head threatened to throw him off balance, his large feet managed to keep him from falling, although he did still wobble quite a bit. His legs eventually started to get tired, but by now, he was starting to get faster, slowly approaching his old walking pace, albeit with a lot more effort being put in in order to reach that speed.

"This is working pretty well," Link said to himself, hearing the Great Fairy's voice come out of his mouth instead of his own. He was rather pleased with the progress he was making, still finding the oddness of the situation strangely appealing.

"Argh!"

That is, until he happened to step on a rather sharp branch that had been laying on the ground. He rested his back against a tree and propped his foot up on his toes, pulling the branch off and rubbing the spot where it had poked him. That was one disadvantage of this swap; the lack of shoes, combined with the Great Fairy's soft, sensitive skin made hurting his feet a much greater possibility. As he placed his foot back down and stood in place, Link began to realise just how tired his legs were right now.

"Maybe I should take a break." Link decided to head home for now, and rest for a bit. He headed back towards the castle, taking a slower pace than he'd done while practicing, and making sure to look out for any sharp branches or stones. He still didn't really understand why he found the strangeness caused by the wand so satisfying, but seeing as how he could swap back at any time, there didn't seem to be any real consequence to messing around as much as he pleased. Speaking of the wand, Link pondered whether to use it again or not. He had been content with sticking with just the head and feet before practicing, but that was just in terms of swapping to help himself move easier. Right now, he had the large head and feet of the Great Fairy, but everything else in between was normal. Perhaps he could try swapping something else with the Great Fairy again. Then again, why limit himself to just swapping with her? There were plenty of other people who he could try swapping with. So long as he had the wand, the world was his oyster.
115332222122222222222121112111.title: Link practices with his giant head and feet

choices: He swaps more with the Great Fairy, he has quite a few of her parts already.
He swaps back to normal for now (and/or swaps with someone else as well).
115332222122222222222121112112.content:
Link felt that swapping his legs for the Great Fairy's would be best to solve this dilemma. He once again waved the wand, and felt the swap happen again. His legs became taller and more thick. After a moment, his view was now a lot higher, thanks his new legs. Link bent down and rubbed his hands along the smooth, shapely legs of the Great Fairy.

Link tried walking again, finding it easier to lift his new feet since he also had the legs to accompany them. His movements were still a little slow, due to how his body's parts were now quite disproportionate, but now he was able to move more normally. He could now run again, much to Link's surprise. Although when he ran, the rushing wind blew against his bare, hairless legs; this caused him to shudder a bit. The Great Fairy's head also wobbled as he moved, but Link could easily keep his balance by holding his large head in place combined with his new legs.

This situation certainly was becoming quite interesting to Link. He maintained a firm hold on the wand as he held his head in place. This brought his attention back to the wand, so he stopped walking for now. Link stared at the wand and then down to the Great Fairy's legs and feet he now had. As intriguing as this was, he didn't quite appreciate being so disproportionate, with most of his body being smaller than his head and legs. This also brought up the slight issue of his appearance. Not only did he look funny, his apparel also was mismatched, with his legs and feet being bare while the remainder of his body whole his usual outfit.As fun as the wand was, Link pondered what to do next.
115332222122222222222121112112.title: Link tried another swap

11533222212222222222212111212.content: Link decided he'd taken enough from the Great Fairy by taking her head, and he wanted to borrow something from someone else, or something else, to act as his counterbalance for his head. Of course, the only things he knew of with feet and legs that would be big or strong enough to help keep his balance with this giant head would be some of the giant monsters he'd faced on his journey. In particular, King Dodongo and The Imprisoned came to mind. With King Dodongo's large, clawed feet, he could probably grip the ground better if he felt himself starting to wobble, and The Imprisoned was much larger than either the Great Fairy or King Dodongo, and its feet seemed to have no trouble holding it up, despite how much of its body seemed to lean to the front. Of course, after the war with Cia and Ganon, Link wasn't sure how many, if any, King Dodongos still remained in the world, and The Imprisoned came from another era in history altogether. Would the wand even work on either of them. Still, both options seemed like an interesting, albeit weird, idea, and Link was willing to try it. But first, he needed to decide which monster to swap with.
11533222212222222222212111212.title: Link swaps with one of the giant boss monsters

choices: meeting the Great Fairy, who had his head
1153322221222222222221211122.content: Link decided that practice makes perfect, so he kept his body from the neck down intact and continued balancing with the Great Fairy's giant head perched atop his shoulders. He held the fairy's head up high and walked around, occasionally tripping up every now and then. But that lessened as he eventually got the hang of it. After performing a flawless five-minute walk, Link gave himself a thumbs up before...
1153322221222222222221211122.title: Link doesn't swap, and just keeps practicin...

choices: meet with his faithful steed, Epona
11533222212222222222212111223.content: Link takes his giant female Great Fairy head to...
11533222212222222222212111223.title: going somewhere else

11533222212222222222212112.content:
After waving the wand, Link didn't really feel too different. He was still definitely male, and he was still dressed in his tunic. Having an idea about what had happened, Link reached a hand up to his head, feeling the slim nose and plump lips that now sat upon his face. "I guess that explains that," Link said, a little surprised to hear the Great Fairy's voice coming out of his mouth. When he had waved the wand, thinking of swapping heads with the Great Fairy, it had taken it literally, giving him the Great Fairy's head instead of putting his head on the Great Fairy's body.

Without any mirrors around, Link was unable to see what he looked like, only being able to feel the differences in his facial structure, but he assumed he looked pretty ridiculous, with the Great Fairy's female head on his male body. The only thing on his new head that he could see clearly were the long locks of pink hair, which the wind was blowing around. This swap seemed fairly unintrusive, letting him experience something a little different without causing problems for him.

"It's not what I was expecting, but..." He trailed off mid sentence. While he didn't really mind trying out the Great Fairy's head for a while, hearing her voice whenever he spoke was a bit off-putting. He looked down at the wand in his hand. If he wanted, he could easily swap his head back. Maybe he could even just switch voices to get his own voice back while keeping this head for now.
11533222212222222222212112.title: The Great Fairy's head adjusts its size.

115332222122222222222121122.content: Link decided he wasn't done with the Great Fairy yet. Swapping heads had been a good test of the wand's capabilities, but it was just a little too freaky to hear the Great Fairy's voice coming out whenever he talked. He saw two options right now; he could try to swap voices with the Great Fairy, taking back his own voice while keeping her head, or he could swap their heads back, undoing his previous swap. The second option would put him back to square one, but now that he had tried the wand out a little, he didn't feel as worried about using it on his friends, so there'd be plenty of new opportunities to swap again.
115332222122222222222121122.title: Use the wand again

choices: Minds (Link has his own head, but the Great Fairy's body)
1153322221222222222221211222.content:
Link decided he might as well just go ahead and put things back to normal now that he was more confident in using the wand, and then he could start messing around with other people. Waving the wand in front of him, thinking about getting his head back.

Of course, the way he thought about it wasn't as clear cut as his previous thought of "swapping heads with the Great Fairy". After the wand had been waved, Link found that he and the Great Fairy had swapped...
1153322221222222222221211222.title: Swap Heads

choices: Link gets back to his body
Something goes wrong with the swap
11533222212222222222212112222.content:
In a flash, Link could feel his head had returned, with his familiar facial structure and his shorter hair. However, that feeling had been entirely dwarfed but the feeling from the rest of his body. Without even looking at his body, he could see he wasn't in Hyrule Field anymore, and was instead inside the Fairy Fountain. In addition, he seemed to be floating above the ground, and the whole temple seemed smaller than usual.

Link was almost afraid to look down, but he knew he couldn't put it off forever. Lowering his gaze, Link found a pair of large breasts hanging from his chest, just barely being covered by a top made of leaves. It was just as he'd feared. Link had his own head back, but that was all he had of himself. He had the Great Fairy's body below his neck, and seemed to be as large as she normally was. In addition, considering he was floating off the ground, he probably had her powers as well, and that, combined with him now being in the Fairy Fountain instead of out in Hyrule Field, made him guess that the world probably didn't even see him as Link anymore. As far as everyone else was concerned, he was probably just an ordinary Great Fairy, who just happened to have the head of a man.

He had definitely messed this one up pretty badly. From now on, he knew he needed to be much more careful with how he worded these swaps before waving the wand. Right now, though, he wanted to get back to being himself. He had no intention staying as a Great Fairy. The first step would be getting back into his own body, which still had the head of the Great Fairy atop its neck. So, after thinking over his wording, he waved the wand, hoping to be back in his body.
11533222212222222222212112222.title: Link gets his head back, but...

choices: Link's head stays the same size
1153322221222222222221212.content: Before we continue, does Link's head stay the same size, looking tiny on the Great Fairy's body, or does it adjust to the size of the Great Fairy's head?
1153322221222222222221212.title: The Great Fairy's body below his neck

choices: Stay like this and practice with this body
11533222212222222222212121.content:

This actually made Link pause. If Epona were to keep her own mind while in his body, there was a high risk of the Swap Wand being discovered by someone else. After all, even the most dense Hylian would be able to figure out that something was wrong, if they saw who they thought to be Link acting just like a horse would! A female horse, at that!

Suddering at the mental image of his own body being 'humped' by a stallion, Link decided to take one final precaution. Entering Epona's stall again, he picked up the rope that Epona was tied up with and tied it around his own waist. Link figured that this would work out in both scenarios.
If he and Epona swapped physical bodies, but kept their own lives, then Epona could use her new hands to untie him and then tie herself up instead. If it was just their minds that would be swapped between their bodies, then Epona would already be tied up and not be able to run away with his body. Perhaps he could even teach her how to be able to walk on two legs, though it might be hard if he had her horse body.

As he picked up the Wand once more, Link felt confident that he had ensured that Epona wouldn't be able to do something awkward with his body, while he tried out hers. With a smile on his face, Link thought about swapping bodies with Epona and waved the Wand.

What kind of body-swap happens between them?

1153322221222222222222123111.content:
The moment Link finished waving the wand, the changes were obvious. He was bent over forwards, standing on all fours, but it felt more comfortable that way, and he wasn't sure he'd be able to stand on two legs even if he wanted to. His body was much larger and more muscular, his head looking rather small attached to it, and everything except his head seemed to be covered in a fine coat of brown hair, save for his hands and feet, where the hair was white. Speaking of hands and feet, he didn't seem to have and fingers or toes anymore, as his hands and feet were now hooves instead. He had a thick, white mane running down his long neck, and he could feel a hairy tail sticking out of his tailbone. And to top it all off, there was a certain something missing from between his strong, equine legs. To say he felt different didn't even begin to describe it. When he had decided to swap with Epona, he hadn't really considered how different he and Epona were, and how it would feel to swap like this. Since Link didn't have hands anymore, the wand was instead held in his mouth. It wasn't exactly the most optimal situation, but he supposed it was better than just losing the wand altogether.

Link felt a hand running through his mane, reminding him that he wasn't the only one that had been changed, even if he was the only one who would know anything was different. Looking over to the side, finding it a bit odd to look around with his long, equine neck, Link saw his old body with Epona's large horse head sitting atop its neck. Her head looked huge on his body, making him realise how silly and small his head looked on her body. It was oddly comforting, feeling Epona running her fingers through his mane, her hand running down his neck, even if those fingers used to be Link's and that mane used to be Epona's. Epona seemed to be pretty content with this situation as well. While she was distracted with petting him, Link looked around for any evidence of how reality had changed due to the swap. Was Epona considered a hero now while he was her steed? Was he still the hero, despite having the body of a horse, and just carried Epona around with him for some reason? It didn't take him long to notice that one of the two of them was tied to a pole in the stable to prevent them from breaking out, and the one tied up was likely the one considered to be the steed. The one tied up was...
1153322221222222222222123111.title: Horsing Around

choices: Link gets to his room, so he can hide the wand
Someone calls Link's name, and he accidentally waves the wand as he looks around
11533222212222222222221231112.content:
Link noticed that the rope that usually kept Epona tied up in her stable was now tied around his old body's belt, indicating that Epona was likely still considered the steed that was kept in the stables, while Link was the hero who had a room in the castle. It was an amusing thought, that despite being a horse, save for his head, he still lived the life of a Hylian, while Epona, who was now mostly Hylian, was still considered a horse. Despite how freaked out he had been at the initial changes, Link was more intrigued by this new reality now. The lack of hands was a bit inconvenient, but he was pretty sure he could handle it for now. It's not like he was going to keep this permanently.

For now, though, he wanted to go for a bit of a run to try out Epona's body. "Well, I'm gonna go now, Epona," he said, finding it a little difficult to speak with the wand still held in his mouth. Epona tilted her head in confusing, noticing the wand. "Uh, don't worry about it," Link reassured, hoping Epona wouldn't get too curious. Thankfully, Epona simply nodded, before opening up the gate of her stall so that Link could leave, seeing as he no longer had hands to open it himself. Link cautiously took a step forward, not sure how walking on all fours would work. He eventually got out of the stall, however, and Epona closed it behind him. As he walked out of the stables, he found that walking seemed to be a lot easier if he didn't think too hard about it, and just let Epona's body go on autopilot.

Before heading out of the castle to test out Epona's body, he decided to make a stop at his room first. Without hands, the only way he had of carrying the wand was in his mouth, which wasn't exactly the easiest thing to do. He didn't want to run the risk of it falling out while he was running around, so he decided it would be better to hide it in his room, and then come back for it later when he wanted to swap again. As he trotted through the halls of the castle, he found it somewhat amusing that no one seemed to find it odd that he had Epona's body, save for his head. People were still treating him as normal, save for stepping further to the side when he walked past, due to his larger horse body.

Link thinks of other ways to swap with Epona. He thought that something a bit untraditional might be better and starts to think hard about it. Then he got an idea; he could try and swap his own personality with that of his loyal steed! That might be the unusual swapping method he was looking for. But first he would need to think of the pros and cons of doing so.

On the other hand, he could end up REALLY embarassing himself, if he suddenly thought like a horse in every way. A FEMALE horse at that! He might try to mate with a large stallion! And as for Epona; well she might think she was him, but she would not be able to hold a sword or fight or anything like that.

Then there was the worst case scenario: He could end up swapping his ENTIRE personality with Epona, so that he wouldn't remember that he was a Hyrulian, but think that he had always been a horse and Epona would end up with HIS whole personality and memories, thinking she had always been him!!! Then they might be stuck forever as a Hyrulian with a horse personality and a horse with a Hyrulian personality, with the odds of getting back to normal being very low!

Still, he had to make a choice, so he decided to...
