That Means that although Link hasn't changed physically, he will think that it's normal for him to have Epona's body and so he freaks out over having his own body. ( And vice versa with Epona ).
115332222122222222222212322.title: Something even wierder

choices: Go with the original plan; try to walk over to Epona to calm her down
Link decides to use the Swap Wand to try and switch them back to 'normal'
1153322221222222222222123221.content:
Unbeknownst to Link, the Swap Wand actually had a mind of it's own. A mischievous one at that. And since Link was wondering what to swap with Epona, well, that was just too good an oppertunity to pass up. Activating itself, it hit both Hyrulian and horse with it's magic. All that was left to now, was to just enjoy the show.

Link shook his head to make the stars in front of his eyes, disappear. Somehow, the Swap Wand had activated itself, without him doing anything! Link shooked his head faster. He really wanted to know, what the Wand had swapped between him and Epona.

Speaking of Epona, he could hear her making quite a racket, but he was still too disoriented to be aware of anything else. However, he could make out that she sounded distressed, judging by her whinnying.

Link slowly but surely got up. However, he still felt dizzy, so he placed a hand on his head to steady himself...

What a second... A hand?! Epona whinnying?!?!

Link suddenly became fully awake; all traces of confusion and dizzyness instantly gone. Slowly, Link lowered his limb and lifted the other one, so they were both in his line of sight. He fell on his backside at the sight.

He didn't just imagine it. Hands! He had hands! Somehow, he now had arms and hands, instead of fore-legs and hooves!

With a growing sense of dread, Link moved his gaze downwards. He was deeply shocked at what he saw.

He didn't just have arms and hands; he also only had two legs, with feet at the end of them! Using his new hands, Link clumsily felt his head. His muzzle was gone, replaced with a nose and a mouth; he had pointy ears and there was no sign of his mane, exept for a large clump on top of his head.

There were no other trace of his fur; instead, his new body was clad in some uncomfortable garments; a green tunic over a shirt of chainmail, sand-colored trousers, (along with the obligatory bulge... you know what I mean), a pair of brown boots on his new feet, and some kind of fingerless gloves on his new hands. Link saw that there were also a big sword and a shield, a blue scarf around his neck, and he could feel that there were some kind of headwear on his new head.

By this point, Link was close to freaking out, completely.

'What's going on?!?' thought Link. 'Why am I like this? What has happened to my body?' Link just stared at his new form for a moment. 'What did that Swap Wand do? I... Hey... wait a minute. Isn't this..." Link looked over his new body, one more time.

'This body... these clothes... I recognise them.' He looked himself over a third time, just to be sure.

'By the Triforce! I was right! I have Epona's body!!!' The realisation hit Link like a ton of bricks; he was currently in the body of his loyal steed, wearing all of her clothes, too!

'Wait...' thought Link, as he widened his, or rather Epona's, eyes in another realisation. 'If I have Epona's body, then...' Link lifted his -Epona's- head upwards, to look inside Epona's stall. Even though he had prepared for it, it was still a shock for him to see.

His own body was inside Epona's stall; his big, muscular, brown-furred body, with the white-furred mane and tail, the hooves with the white fur around them, the muzzle and the friendly eyes and wearing the bridle, saddle and saddle-rug!

Link watched in slight disbelief, as his own body whinnyed, stomped, stumbled and twisted, like there was no tomorrow. Clearly, Epona was inside his body and freaking out a lot more than he was.

Still thrashing about, Epona send Link a look that clearly said: 'What's going on? Why am I in your body?'

Link sent back an expression that said: 'I have no idea.' However, Link secretly thought: 'So, the Swap Wand swapped our bodies, like I originally planned. That's good; I thought it would do something wierd.'

Actually, the Swap Wand HAD done something wierd; it had not swapped their bodies, it had swapped their perceptions on whose body belonged to whom. The truth was, that both Link and Epona were in their normal bodies all along, but thanks to the Wand, they both thought that Link's body really belonged to Epona and vice versa. (Not that either of them were aware of this.)

Link started to worry; if Epona kept on thrashing around like that, then both she, and his body, might end up getting hurt. He had to calm Epona down, and fast.

Link tried to whinney to calm her down, it had worked before. But he couldn't. Epona's body's vocal cords weren't designed to be able to whinney, resulting in Link giving off an odd whistle/buzzing noise.

'Well, that didn't work,' thought Link. 'I guess I'll have to do it by hoof... or by hand, as the case may be.'

Awkwardly, Link moved Epona's body, to stand up. Being used to his own four-legged body, Link tried to stand like he usually did in his own body. But because he was now in Epona's body, he ended up in a weird position.

'Okay, this is not going to work,' thought Link. With both his new hands and feet planted flat on the ground, his -Epona's- body ended up having the front-end closer to the ground than his back-end, causing his -Epona's- butt to stick up in the air.

Add in the fact that both Epona's sword and shield were quite cumbersome when he stood like that, as well as the fact that her chainmail shirt weighted his new torso down conciderably, and even Link had to admit that he would not be able to walk like he was used to.

'I guess I have no choice,' thought Link. 'I'll have to walk like Epona if I want to reach her.' Link smirked a little. 'I've seen her walk on two legs lots of time. That shouldn't be too hard to do, since I'm now in her body.'

As it turns out, Link was wrong. It was a LOT harder, than he had ever thought.

At first, Link tried to simply push his new front-end up, so he could stand on two legs. But since he was used to four legs and not two, he ended up falling over backwards, right on his -Epona's- behind.

Groaning in pain, Link then attempted to stand on two legs again, but got the same result; this time falling flat on his -Epona's- stomach.

'Okay,' thought Link, 'So maybe it isn't as easy as I thought, to walk on two legs.'

Looking around for something he could use for support, Link's choice fell on one of the wooden columns supporting the roof.

Reluctantly, Link got Epona's body up on all fours again. He didn't want to, it felt so strange in Epona's body, but it was the only way he could get over to the column.

Slowly, clumsily and very awkwardly, Link walked on all fours in Epona's body, eventually reaching the column.

'Well, here goes nothing,' thought Link. Placing Epona's hands on the column to support himself, Link tried once more to stand on only two legs. This time he actually managed to stand up on two legs, but since he wasn't used to standing like that, his -Epona's- legs were very shaky and wobbley. In fact, it was only because he held on to the column, that he prevented himself from fallimg over again.

'Come on, Link,' he thought to himself. 'If you can defeat powerful monsters using nothing but your speed, your wit and your hooves, you can certainly learn how to stand up in Epona's body.' He looked down at his -Epona's- legs, as they wobbled like gelatine in an earthquake.

'Although this IS a lot harder that I thought it would be. How does Epona make it look so easy?' While Link still had no idea how to properly use Epona's mouth, he did manage to let out a sigh-like noise. 'Well, I'm not getting anywhere by just thinking about things.'

Concentrating hard, Link tried to make his new legs stop shaking, eventually succeding. Then he attempted to stand up, without support from the column. That didn't go so well, since his sense of balance was used to four legs and not two. The first time he tried, he almost fell down on his -Epona's- back again and he had to quickly grab hold of the column to prevent it.

On his ninth try, he finally managed to stand up, without any support, although he did have to sway with Epona"s torso and had to swing her arms out to either side of him, before he found his balance.

'I did it! I'm standing up on only two legs!' Link thought in triumph.

'But, man, does this feel weird,' thought Link, as he looked down at Epona's body. He still wasn't quite steady on Epona's feet yet, they were still a little wobbley. 'I'm amazed that she can even move around like this. This whole body feels so strange.' Link wasn't just thinking about the two legs.

During the whole ordeal, Link had gotten new and odd impressions from Epona's body. The most prominent of these feelings, was that he was now wearing clothes. He had no use for those things in his normal body; all he needed was his bridle, saddle and saddle-rug.

But because he was now in the body of his horse, that meant he also had to wear her clothes. That he now had hands and feet instead of hooves was bad enough, but when they were trapped inside constricting gloves and boots, that was at least twice as unpleasant.

He couldn't even see the point of clothes in the first place. He just didn't get why anyone, horse or otherwise, would want to cover up their whole body with such constricting things.

The other odd thing, was a bit below the belt. Litterally. Since he had Epona's body, he also had the 'package' between her legs. Every time he had moved, he had felt the 'package' gently rub against her pants. He had already decided that he wouldn't touch it; he didn't think it was ethical, him being in the body of his horse and all.

As he stood there on Epona's shaky legs, Link thought about what to do next.

11533222212222222222222.title: Feathery Destroyer of Worlds

115332222122222222222221.content:
Link grinned, thinking about all the fun he could have with this wand. But what to do first? There were so many people he could swap with, and so many things he could swap with them, he was having trouble choosing. "Hm," he thought aloud, "Maybe I should just use it on the first person I see, or something." That plan would make the outcome a little unpredictable, but exciting nevertheless.

He turned around to head back into Hyrule Castle, searching for some of his friends, when suddenly a stray Cucco crossed his path, clucking along as it pecked at the grass. "Well, that's not what exactly what I was planning." Link decided to not count this in his little "first person he saw" plan. After all, he was looking for people, not animals. He couldn't help but chuckle, thinking about how weird it would be to swap something with a Cucco.

However, while lost in his thoughts, the Cucco had walked up to him, started pecking at the wand. By the time Link looked at the Cucco again, it had taken the wand in its beak, and was trying to pull it out of his hand. "Hey! Let go of that!" He yanked the wand out of the Cucco's beak, holding it up out of the Cucco's reach. However, in pulling the wand away, Link had inadvertently made a movement with it that could be interpreted as "waving" the wand, all while he still had muddled thoughts in his head about how weird it would be to swap with the Cucco. Within mere moments, something had been exchanged between Link and the Cucco, but what had they swapped?
115332222122222222222221.title: Cucco

1153322221222222222222211.content: Before we continue, was the Cucco Link swapped with a male Cucco, or a female Cucco?
1153322221222222222222211.title: Bodies

choices: Link manages to wave the wand
11533222212222222222222112.content:
After yanking the wand out of the Cucco's beak, Link suddenly found himself a lot shorter and smaller.Everything looked so much bigger, and his body felt all weird, but he wasn't entirely sure why. This is, until he noticed what appeared to be his own body. His body was squatting low to the grow, pecking at the grass with it's hands tucked under its armpits. It wore a very blank expression on its face. It was a very surreal experience for Link, seeing his body from an outside perspective, not being controlled by him. He had a feeling he knew what happened, but he was afraid to look down and confirm it.

Realising he couldn't put it off forever, Link looked down at himself, and he was met with a small, round body, covered in white feathers. He had scrawny yellow legs, with four toes on each feet, three pointing forwards and one pointing backwards. He had long, feathery wings in the place of his arms, tucked up flat against his body. Instead of a mouth and nose, he had a hard yellow beak. But what probably freaking him out the most was not all the parts of his Hylian anatomy that he was missing, but rather the part of his male anatomy. He felt a distinct void between his legs. Sure, a Cucco's privates weren't usually dangling out on display, but even without looking, Link knew the parts he possessed were definitely female now. Link wanted to scream, but all that seemed to come out of his mouth was a clucking noise, new new avian vocal chords unable to make the sounds necessary for speech.

Link was a bit ashamed of his mistake. In his haste to get the wand away from the Cucco, he had ended up accidentally swapping bodies with it! Even though the wand should make it so everyone thinks all this is normal, he couldn't help but feel incredible embarrassed by the fact that he had the body of a female Cucco, while his body was busy acting like a farm animal. Remembering the wand, Link frantically looked around for it so he could reverse this swap, or at least make it better somehow. Thankfully, the wand still rested at his feet, but now Link was faced with the problem of how to actually use it. With his new birdy body, Link no longer had hands, and he doubted his wings would be much use in this situation. Perhaps he could pick it up with his feet, or in his beak? There had to be some way, he wasn't going to live out the rest of his life as a hen. Trying to imitate the way the Cucco had been pecking at the grass before, Link bent down and grabbed the wand with his beak. It would probably be a bit difficult to wave the wand like this without it falling out of his mouth, but it was better than nothing. The sooner he was out of this body, the better.
11533222212222222222222112.title: Link the Hen

choices: Got back to his normal body!
Was interupted by Zelda and Swaped to her body by mistake
115332222122222222222221121.content: Somehow he/she was able to start waving the wand and...
115332222122222222222221121.title: Link manages to wave the wand

1153322221222222222222211212.content:
As Link started to wave the wand, he heard a voice calling out to him.

"There you are, Link."

From what he could tell from the voice, it was princess Zelda. He wasn't entirely sure why she'd be looking for him, but this was a rather inconvenient turn of events. He quickly tried to wave the wand to swap bodies with the Cucco, but unfortunately, his thoughts began to get a bit muddled, and the outcome wasn't exactly what Link had expected.

He suddenly found himself standing tall as a Hylian again, but he didn't even need to look at himself to know something was wrong. He could feel a weight hanging from his chest, and the same void between his legs as he'd felt in the Cucco's body. This was not his body. Looking down and confirming his suspicions, Link found that he was instead in Zelda's body. Even though he'd failed to get his own body back, this was at least an improvement from being a Cucco. He was actually somewhat interested in how these two bodies kind of stacked up. Both of these bodies were female, but in the Cucco's body, the difference in species was the overwhelming part, while in Zelda's body, the difference in gender was the most prominent difference. From her soft skin and long her, to the aforementioned private parts, being Zelda felt rather different to being Link.

Of course, now that Link was human again, swapping everything back to normal should be much easier, due to the fact that he actually had hands. The wand seemed to have magically stayed with him, and now rested in his feminine hand rather than his mouth. Of course, it would be easier, if the Cucco sitting outside the castle hadn't noticed him and started waddling over to him. This was, of course, no ordinary Cucco, but rather, Zelda in the Cucco's body. Now Link started to stress out again. What if his thoughts got jumbled in his rush to swap back, and he messed up again? What if he was too slow and Zelda found out about the wand or something? Perhaps it would be safer to just play along with this reality for now and try to swap back once you had cleared your mind.
1153322221222222222222211212.title: The Princess and the Cucco

11533222212222222222222112122.content:
Link shook his head, feeling Zelda's long, blonde hair swishing around as he did so. To try and swap back while he was still stressed out and his thoughts were muddled up would likely result in him messing up once again. Being in Zelda's body was nowhere near as bad as being stuck as a Cucco, so there wasn't as much of a rush to swap back. He didn't want Zelda to find out about the wand, though, so he wanted to put it away somewhere before she got too close to him. Zelda's dress unfortunately lacked any pockets, however. There was still somewhere for Link to hide it, but he was already blushing just thinking about it. Trying to put his embarrassment aside, Link shifted part of his armour to the side, and pushed the wand down into his cleavage, before repositioning the armour back on top. It was a bit uncomfortable with it stuck down there, and Link was still a bit embarrassed about it, but at least it was secure enough that it wouldn't fall out, and no one would find out about his little secret just yet.

With that sorted out, Link crouched down lower to the ground as the Zelda-Cucco approached. She seemed to be clucking happily to see him. Link could only guess why Zelda had been looking for him, but now that Zelda was the Cucco, he guessed their roles were reversed, and he was probably looking for her. Or at least, he hoped so, because otherwise he'd have no idea what Zelda wanted from him, what with Zelda being unable to speak now.

Taking a wild guess, Link said, "Come one, let's get you back to the castle." He knew he should have expected to hear Zelda's voice when he spoke, but it was still a bit off-putting. Suddenly, Zelda jumped up towards him. It caught him a little off guard, but he managed to catch her in time. For a second, Link thought Zelda might have have seen him hide the wand, and was trying to get at it by jumping at his chest, but that didn't seem to be the case. Zelda was content to just be carried, resting against his chest. With that sorted out, Link stood back up and headed back towards Zelda's room in the castle, the Zelda-Cucco in his arms, wobbling a little in Zelda's heels.

As he walked through the castle, Link found it interesting that no one found it odd that he was walking around carrying a Cucco, and that they still referred to him as Link despite the fact that he looked like Zelda. He eventually made it to Zelda's room, only to find Impa pacing around in front of the door. She seemed to perk up when she saw him approaching.

"You found her!" she exclaimed as Link got close.

Link had no idea what she was talking about, and simply replied with, "Yeah, I did."

He handed Zelda over to Impa, who began petting Zelda's feathery body. "Princess, you know you shouldn't wander off like that." Zelda made a clucking noise, but Link was unable to tell what she was trying to say. "Thank you for looking for her, Link."

"No problem."

With that, Impa took Zelda back into her room, and Link was free to do whatever he wanted. Now that that was done, he should be fine to go off and use the wand without stressing over things... hopefully. With the wand still nestled between his breasts, Link headed back to his room so he could concentrate. He assumed that with how powerful the wand was, he didn't need to actually need to see his targets in order to make the swap. He closed the door to his room and sat down on the bed, before fishing the wand out of his cleavage. Having Zelda's body had certainly been an interesting experience, even if it was an unintended one. In the walk to Zelda's castle, he had actually sort of gotten used to Zelda's body, and he wasn't sure if he wanted to give it up yet. At the very least, he wasn't sure he wanted his own body back just yet. He could do whatever he wanted with this wand, why should he be boring and just go back to normal so soon?

Link laughed a little at his own thoughts. After going through the trouble of finding somewhere quiet where he could focus so he could get back to normal, and now he didn't want to go back to normal yet. At the very least, he didn't think it was fair to leave Zelda stuck as a Cucco, so he waved the wand, thinking about swapping the bodies of Zelda and the Cucco. That way, even if Zelda didn't have her body back, at least she was back to being a Hylian, and was able to speak normally. He didn't know if it worked, since he couldn't see either of them, but he just assumed it did. Now there was the question of what to do next. Link didn't want to go back to normal yet, but he didn't know if he wanted to just stay in Zelda's body either. The wand was right here if he wanted a new body, or he could swap something completely different, but perhaps it would be a good idea to just stay like this for a while before he messed around with reality even more.
11533222212222222222222112122.title: Play it safe

115332222122222222222221121221.content: Will Link switch with someone else, or will he continue to switch things with Zelda?
115332222122222222222221121221.title: Use the wand again

choices: It was Zelda, wanting to take him back to his room in the castle.
It was Linkle, wanting to take him back to her farm.
115332222122222222222221122.content: Suddenly, Link heard a female voice calling out his name. "Link! Liiiink! Where are you?" As much as Link wanted his body back, he didn't want to risk someone else finding about the wand and taking it from him. So, instead of trying to awkwardly wave the wand in his beak, he lowered his head and tucked the wand under his wing. After making sure it couldn't be seen, and it was secure enough that it wouldn't fall out, Link looked around for the source of the voice.
115332222122222222222221122.title: Someone comes to get Link

choices: Try to use the wand with a little wave
Rest up for now and use the wand later
1153322221222222222222211221.content:
"There you are, Link." It was Princess Zelda, who, rather than freaking out or laughing at Link's body pecking at the grass like a Cucco, walked right up to Link's current body and took him in her arms, lifting him off the ground. Link squirmed a bit in her arms,not used to being so much smaller, and so easily lifted like that. "Shhh, calm down, Link," Zelda said, running her hand down Link's feathery neck. "I know you long for adventure, but until another war breaks out, it's safe for you to be here at the castle. Come on." And with that, Zelda started walking back towards the castle, taking Link with her. Link watched as the Cucco with his body disappeared into the distance. As far as he knew, the wand didn't need you to actually be able to see the person you were swapping with, so the Cucco wandering off with his body shouldn't be too much of a problem. He just hoped it didn't go out and hurt itself somehow, as he feared those injuries would then be given back to him when he got his body back. He didn't even want to think about what might happen if the Cucco died while still in his body.

As Zelda continued to make her way towards the castle, still holding Link's fat, feathery body in her arms, Link pondered about what Zelda had said. Sure, reality had changed so that he had always been a Cucco, and if one of his friends was a Cucco, he probably wouldn't want them wandering into danger, but "until another war breaks out"? What did Zelda mean by that? Had Link still been the hero that defeated Ganon despite being a Cucco? It was an amusing thought, that the King of Darkness had been defeated by a mere farm animal. Or at least, it would have been amusing if Link wasn't stuck in the body of that farm animal. So despite being the hero that defeated Ganon, it was still too dangerous for a Cucco like him to be wandering around outside the castle? Link found that rather strange, but he supposed that was just the way reality restructured itself to accommodate the swap. He figured it probably wouldn't have been as drastic a rewrite if he had swapped with another person like he had meant to, instead of an animal.

Once they arrived at the castle, Zelda headed straight to Link's room. After Ganon had been defeated, Link was hailed as a hero, and given his own room in the castle to stay in, so he would be close at hand should tragedy strike again. However, when Zelda opened the door, it was clear a couple things had changed. A lot of it was the same; most of his furniture was still there, and most of his weapons were still hung up on his weapon rack, save for the sword and shield he had with him when he swapped with the Cucco. However, in place of his bed, there was now a large nest made of straw, and instead of his wardrobe, there was a large bag of chicken feed and a canister of water. The floor looked a bit messier, with bits of straw strewn around here and there. He assumed the bed had changed because a nest was a more appropriate bed for a bird, and his wardrobe had changed because, being a Cucco, he no longer wore clothes.

Zelda laid Link down on the nest and told him, "I'll come get you if I need you, but for now, try not to wander off too far, okay?" Link tried to protest, but once again, he could only make clucking noises instead of words. Zelda seemed to take this as a sign that Link understood what she was trying to tell him, and with a smile, she got up and left the room, shutting the door behind him. Now that he was finally alone, Link lifted up his wing, the Swap Wand falling out from underneath it. Now it was back to the problem of trying to pick up and wave the wand using his beak.

Or at least, it would have been back to that problem, if it hadn't been for a much more pressing matter building up inside of him. Link wasn't entirely sure how to describe it. It was almost like he had to go to the toilet, but not quite. Instinctively, Link sat down, settling into the nest, and readied himself for what was coming. Whatever was building up inside of him was ready to come up. A large lump was forcing itself through his butthole, and into the nest. With a bit of force, and a satisfying plop, it finally ejected itself from his body. Link was quick to get up and see what it was. It was just as he had suspected; Link had just laid an egg. Link was a bit disgusted by this. It was bad enough being an animal, and one of the opposite sex at that, but now he was laying eggs? That was just gross. Link would have grabbed the wand and swapped immediately, if not for the fact that he felt the same feeling building within him again; he wasn't done laying yet. He begrudgingly sat down on the straw, and went back to work pushing the eggs out of his butt.

By the time he was done, Link had laid five eggs, and he was completely exhausted. He had never experienced anything like that in his life. For some reason, he felt somewhat proud, looking at the products of his labor. But at the same time, it was weird to think that he had pushed those eggs out of his own body. Although, "his own body" was a somewhat relative term right now. His actual body was probably wandering about in a field somewhere, pecking at grass and bugs. Link let out the closest thing to a sigh that he could manage with this body. The hero of legend, the one who saved Hyrule by defeating Ganon, reduced to nothing more than a pampered farm animal in the castle. He slowly waddled over the where the Swap Wand had fallen in the nest, but found he barely even had the strength to pick it up right now. Laying those eggs had really taken it out of it.

Link grumbled to himself as he sat back down on the nest. As much as he didn't want to admit it, the straw actually provided pretty comfortable seating for his new feathery behind. He looked around the room again. If not for the nest and the chicken feed, it almost seemed like the room of a normal person, like his old room. He wondered how he was even supposed to use the weapons he had sitting on the rack. Probably in the same way he wielded the Master Sword to defeat Ganon with it, which was another thing he had no idea how he'd done. The wand had made it so he'd done it, but apparently it didn't bother itself with little details like how.

Link glanced at the wand again. He'd prefer to be back to normal sooner rather than later. He didn't want to get too comfortable with the idea of being a Cucco. However, he was still too exhausted to hold the wand steady. Maybe it would work with just a little wave? The first swap had happened thanks to a big motion, a sweeping arc from his hips all the way up to above his head. All he'd probably be able to manage right now was a little wiggle. Maybe if he swapped something smaller, then a smaller wave would work? Of course, the end goal was to get his body back, but perhaps he could do something a bit smaller to make the wait easier on him. Then again, perhaps it was better to just wait until he had regained his energy and could hold the swap wand in his beak properly. That chicken feed in the corner was starting to look very tempting
1153322221222222222222211221.title: Cucco in the Castle

11533222212222222222222112211.content: Link stared down at the Swap Wand sitting in the straw. He was going to give it another go, even if you could only manage to wiggle the wand a little. But what should he try to swap? Of course, he wanted his body back, but maybe a swap that big wouldn't work with a wave that was too small. Alternately, if a small wave was enough to manage a small swap, he'd like his voice back. Having his own voice would certainly make being stuck as a Cucco a bit more tolerable, if only because it'd mean he could actually talk to people instead of just making clucking noises.
11533222212222222222222112211.title: Try to use the wand with a little wave

choices: Somehow he is back to his body!
He swaped into something smaller like a smaller animal or insect
He swaped into one of his/her Eggs or something else...
115332222122222222222221122111.content: It is a tall order, but he attempted to maybe swap back to his body and...
115332222122222222222221122111.title: Try to swap bodies

choices: Someone comes in before he can fall asleep
Link wakes up feeling refreshed after his nap
115332222122222222222221122112.content:
Link decided that he'd probably have a better chance with only a small wave if he only tried for a small swap. As much as he wanted his body back, and he didn't really want to get too used to having this body, the wand wouldn't be going anywhere, so he could swap back into his own body once he had regained his energy. Plus, it wasn't like the his actual body was going to need its voice at the moment, since it currently had the mind of a Cucco.

He bent down again, and grabbed the wand in his beak. He could feel it slipping, not being able to grip it tight enough out of exhaustion, and quickly moved his head around a bit to wave the wand, thinking only of swapping voices with his old body. Before too long, the wand slipped out of his beak, falling back down onto the straw. Link was almost afraid to try speaking, not knowing whether the swap had actually worked or not.

"Did it work?" he asked allowed, before cheering in excitement that it had actually worked. He could talk again. Sure, his voice was coming out of the body of a female Cucco, but he was happy to have at least a little bit of himself. He was so happy, in fact, that he didn't even think to try swapping bodies with the small wave of the wand he was currently capable of doing. For now, he was content with just having his voice back, and waiting until he had regained his strength.

Speaking of regaining his strength, Link felt his stomach rumble. He looked over at the bag of chicken feed, some of which have been put into a bowl laying on the floor in front of hit. "Well... better than nothing, I guess." Link slowly waddled over to where the feed was, really feeling the exhaustion that the egg laying had brought on. He wondered if that was normal for Cuccos, or if he was just exhausted because it was his first time doing it. The feed didn't look to appetizing to his Hylian mind, just as he slowly started to peck at it, his Cucco body really seemed to enjoy it. He ended up eating more of it than he expected he would, feeling a bit bloated afterwords.

As he waddled back to his nest, thinking a nap might help him regain his energy, he wondered about the changes to reality again. If he was still the hero who defeated Ganon, then did he still have the Triforce of Courage? He held out his left wing in front of him and focused. Sure enough, a trio of yellow triangles, one filled in while the other two just outlines, glowed amongst his feathers. He was grateful that that at least had transferred over to his new avian body.

Before he settled down in the straw, Link looked at the Swap Wand again. What if someone came in to collect his eggs or something while he was napping? What if they saw the wand? What if they took it? Link couldn't take that risk. He had to hide it. But where? He knew he'd have trouble picking it up, otherwise he'd already be back in his own body, but he couldn't just leave it out there in the open. Instead, Link opted to bury it in the nest, pushing aside some straw with his feel to make a little hole, and pushing the wand into it, before covering up the hole again with more straw. That should stop anyone who came in from finding the wand, unless they specifically went digging through his nest for some reason. Link just hoped the hole wouldn't bee too difficult for him to find once he had had his nap. He didn't want to go building his strength back up, only to waste it all on digging through his nest trying to find the wand again.

Regardless, for now, the wand was safe, Link had his voice back, and he was done laying eggs for now, and that was good enough for him. He settled down in the straw, ready to take his first, and hopefully only, nap in the body of a Cucco.
115332222122222222222221122112.title: Try to swap voices

1153322221222222222222211221121.content: Who comes to see Link?
1153322221222222222222211221121.title: Someone comes in before he can fall asleep

choices: Zelda just wanted to make sure you were okay
Zelda urgently needed you for something
11533222212222222222222112211211.content:
Just as Link was starting to nod off, he was startled awake by a knock at the door, causing his feathers to poof up a little out of surprise. As much as he wanted to just rest up and then swap back, he figured he couldn't just ignore whoever it was. He would have called out, telling whoever it was to come in, but the door had already opened, revealing Zelda's face behind the door.

"Link, are you there?" she asked, looking around the room. Apparently she hadn't spotted his white, fluffy body amongst the straw.

Hoping that the wand had worked its magic properly, and that it would be considered normal for him to be able to talk, Link called out to her. "Over here, Zelda."

"Oh, I didn't see you there. Is everything alright?" Link frowned, or at least he would have if he had a mouth instead of a beak. Was it normal for Zelda to check on him so frequently in this reality? He wasn't really sure how much time had passed between the egg laying and the eating, but he didn't think it had been that long.

"Yeah, I'm fine, just a little tired."

Zelda's eyes went wide as she noticed the eggs sitting next to Link in the nest. "Well no wonder! Five eggs in one sitting? You must be exhausted! I'll have someone come by to get those soon." Link let out a sigh of relief, now knowing that he apparently didn't normally lay that many eggs at once. Not that he planned on staying a Cucco long enough to have to start laying again, but if something went wrong and he was stuck like this for a while longer, it was good to know he wouldn't be doing five at a time every single time.

"So, did you need something?" Link asked. He didn't want to be rude, but the sooner he had his nap, the sooner he'd be able to regain his energy, and the sooner he'd be able to swap back into his own body. So, if he made sure Zelda got right to the point, that would hopefully speed things along.
11533222212222222222222112211211.title: Zelda

choices: Someone comes to collect his eggs
Link falls asleep before his eggs are collected
115332222122222222222221122112111.content:
"Oh, no, just making sure you were okay," Zelda said. "I know you don't like it when I drag you back to the castle like that, so I wanted to apologise. You probably know this already, but we're just doing what we think is best for you."

"It's alright, I'm fine. Don't worry about it." Link wondered what Zelda meant by "we". Were these more people than just her making sure the hero Cucco stayed safe? Was Impa keeping a lookout to make sure he didn't leave the castle or something?

"Well, alright then. I'll let you rest now. Someone will be by soon to get your eggs." With that, Zelda waved goodbye, and left, closing the door behind him.

Once again, Link was alone. Link was already sick of what the Swap Wand had done to reality. He was a fat, feathered, female bird, and had just laid a bunch of eggs against his will. He was still the hero of legend, meaning he probably knew how to defend himself, but people still felt the need to protect him and keep him out of harm's way. He hadn't been planning on going anywhere with this body anyway, but being confined to the castle meant people like Zelda constantly checking up on him. And now, he just wanted to get some rest, but he knew someone would be coming to get the eggs he had laid. He wasn't sure he'd be able to get to sleep with the thought that someone would be coming in here while he was asleep. What if they found the wand? Then again, he'd hidden it fairly well, hadn't he? Just to be safe. Link waddled over to where the wand was buried, and sat down on the straw it was buried underneath. That sound prevent anyone finding it while he was asleep, and help him find it again when he woke up.
115332222122222222222221122112111.title: Zelda just wanted to make sure he was okay

choices: Someone enters the room while he's digging
1153322221222222222222211221121112.content:
Link had wanted to stay awake until whoever was collecting his eggs came, just to make doubly sure the Swap Wand wasn't found, but exhaustion got the better of him, and he slowly found his eyelids closing, as he drifted off to sleep.

When Link woke up, it seemed to be fairly late in the afternoon. Considering it was was around midday when he went to sleep, Link must have been more tired than he thought. However, now he was feeling refreshed and full of energy. He was also feeling strangely comfortable with his current body. Maybe a bit of rest had gotten him used to it or something, but regardless, this was kind of what Link had been afraid of. He didn't want to get too comfortable with this body, else he might not want to swap back, and right now, he didn't see any benefit to staying in the body of a female Cucco. Still, he didn't hate it as much as he did before his nap. In fact, Link was even considering turning back into a Cucco every now and then just for the fun of it.

But that was for another time, because right now, Link wanted his real body back. He stood up, noticing the eggs that were next to him in the nest had vanished. Whoever was coming to get them must have done so while he was asleep. Redirecting his attention towards the straw he was standing on, Link started digging around with his feet to find the Swap Wand.
1153322221222222222222211221121112.title: Link falls asleep before his eggs are collected

choices: It's Zelda, and she notices the wand you've dug up!
It's Impa, the castle is under attack!
11533222212222222222222112211211122.content: Link had almost unearthed the wand, starting to see parts of it amongst the straw, when suddenly he heard his door open. He looked up, to see who it was.
11533222212222222222222112211211122.title: Someone enters the room while he's digging

choices: Link swaps Zelda with something (or both)
115332222122222222222221122112111221.content:
"Link? Are you awake?" Zelda asked, before she noticed Link standing in the nest. He wondered what she wanted this time. "Oh there you... Hey, is that one of my batons?"

In shock, Link realised she was referring to the Swap Wand, which he had just unearthed. During the war against Cia and Ganon, Zelda had come across a strange baton-like weapon, capable of summoning gusts of wind. Although the Swap Wand did much more than that, Link had to admit that the wand did look very similar to Zelda's batons. "No, it's not," Link tried to explain. "It's um, it's just something I found outside the castle." He didn't want to give too much away. He had found the swap wand himself, and although he would consider Zelda a friend, he wanted this power to be his and his alone.

Zelda, however, didn't buy his vague explanation for a second. "Link, you shouldn't take things that don't belong to you. Give that here." She walked towards him, hand outstretched to take the Swap Wand. Link was desperate now. He had to do something to stop Zelda from getting the wand. If she got it, he'd probably be stuck as a Cucco for the rest of his life while Zelda got to have fun with the wand herself, Link left oblivious to all the changes. Funnily enough, the wand was what he wanted to protect, but it was also his only way out of this, or at least, the only way Link could think of.

He figured that now he had his energy back, he was wave the wand pretty well in his beak, but that left the question of what to swap. Maybe if he swapped himself with something, he could get out of here, stopping Zelda from taking the wand from him. His old body was definitely an option. Of course, this would assume that swapping bodies with someone would actually put him over where that body was, rather than just transforming his body right here in the room. Alternatively, he could swap Zelda with something. Maybe he could make her not want to take the wand from him somehow, or make her unable to take the wand. Perhaps he could even swap with her himself. As Zelda approached, Link realised the time for thinking was over; now was the time for action. Link quickly bent down, grabbed the wand in his beak, and with a twist of his neck, swung the wand around in front of him.
115332222122222222222221122112111221.title: It's Zelda, and she notices the wand!

choices: The wand swaps Link and Zelda's bodies
1153322221222222222222211221121112212.content: Thinking it was his best bet, Link thought about swapping Zelda with something. He didn't care what the wand did, at long as it made it so she couldn't take the wand from him. He really hoped the wand would work with such a vague request.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212.title: Link swaps Zelda with something (or both)

choices: "Link, I said give me that!" (Link is still Link, but with Zelda's body)
"So, was there something you needed?" (Link has Zelda's life as well)
11533222212222222222222112211211122121.content:
After waving the wand, Link suddenly felt much taller, closer to his original height. Although, despite being about as tall as his old body, pretty much everything else felt different. He had long blonde hair flowing down his back, and his skin felt much softer. His limbs were much slimmer, his waist thinner, and his hips wider. He was wearing a dress, along with several pieces of gold armor. And most importantly, he still had a void between his legs, but now he also had a pair of breasts hanging from his chest. Link had no doubt in his mind about what had happened; he had swapped bodies with Zelda. That had, after all, been his last idea before waving the wand and thinking about stopping Zelda. He had already been a female while in the Cucco's body, but being a female Hylian, one of his friends no less, felt a lot different, and made him rather uncomfortable.

Speaking of Zelda, Link could only assume that the Cucco sitting on the ground in front of him was the same Cucco who's body he had been in, now inhabited by Zelda. Despite her avian body, she would probably still have his old voice, and she should think this was all normal. He briefly wondered how exactly the swap had played out. It was obvious he had Zelda's body, and Zelda had that of a Cucco, but until Zelda spoke, there was no real way of telling whose life he was living. When he swapped with the Cucco, he gained the Cucco's body, but kept his own life, a fact that had been made obvious by the way the Cucco had been acting in his body before Zelda whisked him away back to the castle. But considering he wanted the wand to make it so Zelda couldn't, or wouldn't want to, take the wand from him, it would be just as advantageous, if not more so, for him to have been put into the life of Zelda. After all, Zelda wanted to take it off him because she thought it was one of her batons, so if he actually was Zelda now, she wouldn't have a reason to take it from him.

He heard his own voice, coming out of Zelda's Cucco body, interrupting his thoughts. She said...
11533222212222222222222112211211122121.title: The wand swaps Link and Zelda's bodies.

choices: Link swaps his voice/Link swaps Zelda's body
Link plays around wih the wand/his new body
115332222122222222222221122112111221211.content:
"Link, I said give me that!" Link heard his own voice shout, although it wasn't him doing the shouting. His voice was still coming out of the body of the Cucco, which now belonged to Zelda. It would seem that, just like with the Cucco, the wand had merely swapped Link and Zelda's bodies, leaving them in their own lives. At the very least, Link found that with his added height from having a Hylian body again, he could easily keep the wand out of Zelda's reach. Now it was just a matter of convincing her that it wasn't one of her batons.

"Zelda, this isn't one of your batons, I promise," Link said, trying to not be too off-put by the fact that Zelda's voice was coming out of his mouth instead of his own. He supposed it was a normal side effect of the body swap, considering he had the Cucco's voice when the swapped with it before, but it was still a bit unsettling to hear his words come out in a female voice. "I found it myself, just like how you found your batons."

Zelda narrowed her eyes at Link, staring up at him from her now shorter stature. "Promise?"

Link put a hand on his chest, flinching a little as it touched one of his breasts. "Cross my heart."

Zelda sighed. "Alright, I guess I believe you. I should probably be heading back to my room anyway. Just, stay out of trouble, Link."

"I will," he replied, as she waddled her little Cucco body out the door. Since she didn't have any arms, the door was left open, but Link shut it behind her to make sure he had some privacy.

He turned to where the nest had been before, only to find it had now been replaced with a bed, looking something like a cross between his old, simpler bed, and Zelda's more elaborate, royal one. The floor was now also devoid of straw, and his wardrobe was back in the place of the feed bag, although opening it up, Link found it now contained Zelda's dresses rather than his own clothes. Reality had once again been restructured, this time so it was normal for the hero of legend to have a woman's body, and for the princess of Hyrule to be a talking Cucco. He wondered whether he was still considered a man, despite his body. No one had mentioned anything about his gender from what he could recall while he was in the Cucco's body, so he really had nothing to go off.

Link sat down on his bed, thinking about how much reality was messed up right now. His old body as probably out in a field somewhere, eating bugs and grass, while having the voice of a Cucco. Then there was Zelda, who, despite being the princess of Hyrule, had the body of a Cucco, and Link's old voice. And Link himself still had his own life as the hero of legend, but he now had Zelda's body. This wand was clearly powerful and not the be taken lightly, something Link knew all too well after finding himself in two female bodies of different species.

That said, while it would now be very easy for him to go ahead and take his own body back, he wasn't sure he wanted to yet. He had just landed in Zelda's body, and while it had initially made him uncomfortable to have a female body of his own race, he was now more curious than anything. What was it really like to be a woman? Even if he was still still considered a man thanks to still being in his own life (something Link made a mental note to check later), just having Zelda's body was an interesting experience in itself, one that he wasn't willing to give up so easily. After all, he had spent a few hours in the Cucco's body, and had experienced eating chicken feed and laying eggs, why should he give up Zelda's body after only a few minutes. Not to mention, if a fight broke out, Zelda's body should still be strong enough to use most, if not all of his weapons.

"Looks like I'll be holding onto you for a little longer," Link said, looking down at the female body he now possessed. He frowned slightly. Despite his eagerness to keep Zelda's body for a while, it was still a little unsettling to hear her voice instead of his. As a Cucco, it hadn't bothered him as much, since he wasn't able to talk at all with the Cucco's voice. But with Zelda's voice, it just felt strange.

There was also the matter of what to do with Zelda. Although Link was putting off getting his own body back, he didn't know if he should leave Zelda as a Cucco. Sure, she, and everyone else besides him, thought it was normal, but he still thought it was a bit weird for the princess, and one of his best friends, to be a talking Cucco with his voice. Perhaps he could at least give her his old body, and give the Cucco its body back?

Then again, so long as he held the wand, anything he did with it would be reversible, so why should he waste time fixing things now? He could be playing around with reality and messing things up even more. Or better yet, playing around with his new body. Just to get used to it, of course.
115332222122222222222221122112111221211.title: The Regal Hero and the Feathered Princess

choices: Link plays around with Zelda's body
Link plays around with the wand
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
"Reality can wait," Link muttered to himself, a smirk on his feminine face. With the Swap Wand, the world was practically his plaything. He could put it back to normal any time he wanted, so long as he made sure he still had hands, so why waste time doing it now? There was plenty of other fun stuff he could be doing.

"Hm, but what to do first?" Links eyes darted back and forth between the wand in his hand, and the breasts hanging from his chest. He'd be lying to himself if he said he didn't find Zelda attractive, and the thought of playing around with her body was very tempting. But on the other hand, now that he wouldn't have any problems with waving it, the wand's power seemed almost intoxicating, begging him to do more, to mess around with reality even further.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link plays around wih the wand/his new body

choices: Link thinks of someone else to swap with
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Link settled on using the wand more. Zelda's body was nice and all, but it was nothing compared to the power to rewrite reality.

"Ah, but who to swap with?" Link was aware of the fact that he himself didn't actually need to be involved in the swaps, and that he could swap two other people around, but after swapping with Zelda, the power seemed to have gone to his head a little, and he was getting a little giddy just thinking about what else he could do to himself.

The obvious choice would be to swap with Zelda again. She was still fresh in his mind, and he could think of a few things that could be interesting to swap with her. Of course, there were still plenty of other people Link knew that could provide interesting swaps, especially now that he wasn't concerned about messing up his friends.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link plays around with the wand

choices: Link thinks of something else to swap
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Link's grin grew wider, thinking about what he could do to Zelda, before stopping for a moment and realising how crazy his thoughts had become. The power of the wand had bewitched him, he had wanted nothing more than to swap for the sake of swapping, playing with the wand's reality-warping powers. He took a moment to clear his mind. He was still eager to use the wand, yes, but he had calmed down a bit, and wouldn't let it control him.

With his mind cleared, Link thought about what he might swap with the newly Cuccofied Zelda. The first thing that sprung to mind was her life. After all, he had the body and wardrobe of the princess of Hyrule already, why not try out actually being royalty for a while? And if anything too serious came up that he didn't know how to deal with, he could just swap out back into his own life, or into someone else's. Of course, that was just one possible swap he could do of many.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link swaps with Zelda again

choices: Link gets treated like a Cucco again
Link wants to swap something else
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Link shook his head, feeling Zelda's long hair move around as he did so. Even if they wouldn't be able to tell that anything was wrong, he didn't particularly want to live one of his friends' lives. It just felt wrong. Sure, he had 'borrowed' Zelda's body, but taking her life too was taking things to another level.

Link pondered about how he might be able to change his own life, since he wouldn't be taking someone else's. His life had changed quite when he became a Cucco. He wasn't really aloud to leave the castle, he slept in a nest, laid eggs, ate chicken feed, and was had Zelda checking on him rather frequently. He also realised that as a Cucco, he wasn't expected to go on regular patrols like he usually was, rather being kept safe inside the castle until some sort of emergency. Aside from Zelda's checkups, it wasn't actually too bad, something he hadn't realised because of how much he was in a hurry to get back to normal. Although he didn't particularly want to become an animal again, and lose his hands, perhaps there was a way to swap things around so that he'd be treated like one. For instance, he might be able to change people's perception of him and Zelda, so that despite their bodies, people would believe Zelda was a Hylian, and he was a Cucco. It seemed complicated, but Link was curious as to whether something like this would work.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link thinks of something else to swap

1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Link decided to test out whether this would actually work. The simplest way to be treated like a Cucco would have just been to swap lives with a Cucco, such as the one who's body Zelda now had, but right now, he wanted to keep his own life, but be treated as if he were a Cucco. This would also make Zelda be treated like a Hylian again, despite still having the body of a Cucco. It took him a while to figure out exactly how to word the swap, but eventually settled on swapping "how people perceived what species he was" with Zelda, hoping it would make people think he was a Cucco, without actually turning him into one.

With the wand waved, Link looked around his room to see if it had worked. His room now resembled what it had been while he had the Cucco's body, except the nest was bigger, to fit Zelda's body, and the feedbag was next to the wardrobe rather than replacing it, since he was still wearing Zelda's clothes. Most importantly, though, despite the Cuccofied changes to the room, Link still had Zelda's body. The swap had worked, hopefully like Link had envisioned. He was still a Hylian, but considering he now had a nest instead of a bed in his room, he assumed the rest of the world saw him as a Cucco.

"Well, that was easier than I expected," Link said to himself. After his nap, he was feeling a little peckish again, and looked over that the chicken feed sitting next to his wardrobe. As a Cucco, his mind had been reluctant to eat it, but his body had enjoyed it. Now, though, he still had the body of a Hylian, despite what everyone else would now think. Would he still be able to eat the chicken feed like this? "Only one way to find out." Link knelt down in front of the bag, took out some of the feed, and put it in his mouth.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link gets treated like a Cucco again

1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
To Link's surprise, the feed tasted just as good in Zelda's body as it had in the Cucco's body. He wasn't sure if this was just normally what chicken feed tasted like, or if his tastebuds had been changed to facilitate him being treated like a Cucco. He ate enough to not feel hungry, which only amounted to a small snack this time.

"Hm, what now?" Link wondered aloud. "I have Zelda's body, and people think I'm a Cucco, so I don't have to do anything unless there's an emergency." He looked down at the Swap Wand again, thinking he might be able to do another interesting swap, when suddenly he felt a familiar feeling building inside of him. "What? But... But I'm not a Cucco!"

Despite his anatomy not matching what was about to happen, Link knew what was going on, and squatted down in his nest. He pushed, just as he had when he was a Cucco, and squeezed and egg out of his behind. However, unlike last time, Link was wearing clothes, something he hadn't payed attention to until the egg was already out, and sitting inside his panties, pressing up against his bottom. Before he had a chance to get it out, another egg started to make its way out, leaving Link with no choice but to continue with it. Thankfully, once the second egg was out, that seemed to be the end of it. He pulled down the shorts and panties that Zelda wore under her dress, spying the eggs resting inside his underwear, remarkably unharmed. Link supposed that if people thought he was a Cucco, that meant he needed to be able to do Cucco things, like eating chicken feed and laying eggs. He took the eggs out of his panties, laying them in the nest, feeling strangely disappointed that he'd only laid two this time, before pulling his shorts back up. He'd have to remember to pull his shorts down next time he had to lay, provided he kept reality like this long enough for this to happen again.

He sat down in the nest, alongside his eggs. He wasn't as tired as when his Cucco body had laid five eggs, but he still needed to take seat for a while. He looked down at the Swap Wand again. Although he hadn't expected to still be laying eggs while still in Zelda's body, he was still amazed at what the wand was capable of. He wondered whether he should try out another swap, or if he should just stick with what he had for now. There were plenty of other interesting things he could do, but it might also be good to not go too overboard with the swaps.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: It tasted good (Some Physical Changes)

choices: Link thinks of something else to swap
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Again, Link decided against his idea. Although the idea of being treated like a Cucco while still being a Hylian was fascinating, he was a little worried about how much would be included in that. Would there be any other changes made to facilitate the change? Would Zelda's Hylian body be able to survive just eating chicken feed? Would he still lay eggs? There were too many unknowns, and he wasn't prepared to risk it right now.

Next, Link thought about perhaps swapping some body parts, since he had only considered options to do with lives before. He knew he didn't want the Cucco body back, for now at least, since it would hamper his ability to use the wand, but what if he kept his hands, or more accurately Zelda's hands. What if he only swapped his lower body with Zelda's? Would his new parts change size to fit? How would it feel to be half Hylian, half Cucco, and all female? Link felt the giddiness rising inside of him again, but quickly calmed down before it got out of hand.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link wants to swap something else

choices: About the same height (Parts change size)
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content: Link decided that becoming a Hylian/Cucco hybrid, and a female one at that, seemed like a fun enough idea. And so, he waved the wand, thinking about swapping the lower half of his body with Zelda, who still have the body of a Cucco. When the swap had been completely, Link found himself...
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: Link becomes half Cucco

choices: Link needs to go to the toilet
Link needs to lay an egg again
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.content:
Link could feel the change had definitely been made, but was pleasantly surprised that he was still more or less the same height he had been before the swap. The Cucco parts must have grown to accommodate being attached to Zelda's Hylian body. He could only assume that Zelda's original legs, which were now back with the original Zelda, had shrunken down to a size appropriate for her Cucco body.

Link looked over his new body. From the waist up, he still had Zelda's beautiful body, but halfway down his waist, fluffy white feathers began to form. From there, his body buldged out from where his hips should be, his pelvic area extending down to where the middle of his thighs used to be, to compensate for his shorter Cucco legs. His thighs were still covered in feathers, but from the knees down, his thin legs were covered in nothing but leathery yellow skin, leading down to his four-toed avian feet. The proportions definitely felt a bit different from Zelda's legs. A Cucco's legs were much shorter on its body than a Hylian's, so by taking the Cucco's entire lower half, rather than just the legs, Link's pelvic area was now much larger than it usually was, and his legs were shorter. His feathery parts bulged out at the sides, and even at the front a little, but they extended out at the back more than anything. In fact, his tail feathers had lifted his dress up so far that would have been rather indecent if he'd still had the parts of a Hylian. speaking of the dress, Link noticed that while he still had all the clothes worn on his upper body, the dress included, the shorts, panties, and boots he'd been wearing were now gone, presumably being worn by Zelda. He figured it was better this way, not complicating things by modifying all the clothing to fit his new parts.

Running a hand along his feathery behind, Link smiled. It was such an odd feeling, having the top half of Zelda's body, and the bottom half of a Cucco, and he kind of like it. He decided to keep his new parts for now, at least until the novelty of it wore off. Looking around his room, he noticed it hadn't changed too much. He still had a bed, which still looked like a cross between his old bed and Zelda's, and he still had a wardrobe, although the pants and boots were gone from it, along with the panties that had been in his drawers. Reality had once again readjusted, making it normal for him to have to lower body of a Cucco. It was all so exciting, and Link would have explored further, if not for a familiar feeling building up in his pelvic area.
1153322221222222222222211221121112212112.title: About the same height (Parts change size)

11533222212222222222222122221.title: Lives

choices: Link swaps back with the Cucco
Link lets the Cucco live his life for a while
115332222122222222222221222211.content:
As Link yanked the wand away, he suddenly found himself in a squatting position on the ground, feeling a breeze all over his body. Looking down, it wasn't hard to realise why; he was completely naked. Even stranger, however, was that the Cucco standing in front of him seemed to be wearing a miniature replica of his tunic, adjusted to fit its avian body. It didn't take Link long to realise what had happened; he must have accidentally waved the wand and triggered a swap between himself and the Cucco. Well, that wasn't what he had intended to use it for, but the wand was still in his hand, so it should be pretty easy to swap back.

Before he could do so, however, the Cucco spoke. "Wow, this is different," it said, in a scratchy voice that sounded vaguely female. Link was shocked to hear the Cucco actually speaking.

He tried to reply with, "You can talk?" but all that came out was an awkward clucking sound. That shocked Link even more. Why couldn't he speak anymore?

"Well, I guess I'm a Hylian then. This should be fun." The Cucco turned around and started heading towards the castle. Link was more than a little alarmed by this turn of events. It seemed that despite him clearly being a Hylian, and the Cucco still being a bird, the Cucco was wearing his clothes and talking, while he was naked and stuck making clucking noises. Despite their bodies, they seemed to be stuck with the abilities of each other, and he had a bad feeling that the rest of the world would see him as a Cucco, despite clearly being a Hylian.

Link squawked angrily at the Cucco before it left, and it turned back around to face him. "Oh come on," it said, "Can't you just let me be you for a while? Being a Cucco's not that bad." Link squawked again to voice his disapproval of that idea. "Look, with that wand, you can be whoever you want. I'm not even gonna take the wand off you, you can keep it. Just let me be a Hylian for a while, please?"

Link was a little confused as to how the Cucco knew about the wand and what was going on, but then he remembered how he learned about what the remote could do the moment he picked it up. The Cucco had probably learnt about when it was pecking around at the wand, and it was aware of the swap due to holding onto it with its beak when he accidentally waved it.

Link did still have the wand, and he could swap back as soon as he wanted, but perhaps he should just let this Cucco live his life for a little while. What's the worst that could happen? Not to mention, he'd seen what happens when you mess with Cuccos before, and it wasn't pretty. If he swapped back now, there was always the chance this Cucco could call their friends and overwhelm him, stealing the wand for themselves.
115332222122222222222221222211.title: A Fowl Situation

1153322221222222222222212222112.content:
Link knew better than to mess with Cuccos. Even though the consequence of not messing with them was temporarily losing the right to be himself, he wasn't ready to be on the receiving end of a Cucco attack right now. For all he knew, they'd take the wand from him, and he'd lose his life again, and possibly more. For now, he'd just have to accept that he'd be living someone else's life for a while, while a Cucco filled in for him. He reluctantly nodded, agreeing to the Cucco's terms.

The Cucco seemed pleased by this. "Goodie! Thanks a bunch. Well, if you plan on staying a Cucco for a while, I live in a village not too far from here. There's a girl there that takes care of me and the other hens, feeding us and collecting our eggs, but she lets us roam free if we want." Link gulped at the mention of "me and the other hens". It was bad enough that he was considered a Cucco right now, but apparently he was also a female one. "Well, you know where to find me if you need me. See ya!" And with that, the Cucco waddled off, heading into the castle.

Link felt more than a little vulnerable. He was currently squatting naked in a field, but as far as the rest of the world was concerned, he was just a normal, female Cucco. He wasn't really sure not to do now. He could try living as a Cucco for a while, or he could swap lives with someone else he knew. As he thought it over, he wandered absentmindedly towards the only village he knew of nearby Hyrule Castle; the village where Linkle lived. On one hand, it would be very strange to be treated as an animal for any length of time, especially one of the opposite gender. He couldn't help but wonder if any modifications had been made to his body to allow him to function as a female Cucco, such as gaining the ability to lay eggs or something. It would still be a little awkward to live someone else's life, but it would probably be less awkward than being treated like an animal. But on the other hand, swapping into someone else's life would force them to live the life of Cucco for as long as you were them. They wouldn't realise anything was wrong, of course, but it still felt a little bad to force someone into that role. As you approach Linkle's village, you decide that for now, you're going to...
1153322221222222222222212222112.title: The Hero of Feathers

11533222212222222222222122221122.content:
Though Link felt a little guilty about forcing someone else to live the life of a Cucco, Link didn't exactly want to be forced to live the life of an animal himself, especially a female one. No, he'd borrow someone else's life for the time being, until the Cucco decided it had gotten sick of being him. He hoped it wouldn't be long, and that she'd want to go back to being a Cucco before long, but until then, he'd just have to made do.

Now came the question of who to swap with. Whoever he swapped with you be stuck as a Cucco for the time being, but they wouldn't notice that they'd swapped, since they weren't holding the wand, so it would probably be fine. In fact, that gave him an idea. While the Cucco had been aware of the swap, thanks to her having the wand in her beak, she wouldn't be aware if he made another swap. He could try swapping back with her, but considering she'd already touched the wand, giving her knowledge of how it worked, she might be able to work out what he'd done, and then he'd have to suffer the consequences of going against her. Instead, he thought that perhaps he'd swap with someone he was close to, someone who's life he'd be able to use to spy on his old life, and make sure the Cucco wasn't screwing anything up. That way he'd be able to stop her if she did anything terribly out of character for him, but she wouldn't even know he was there thanks to the wand's power.

Unfortunately, Link could only think of two real candidates for such an espionage mission. The first was Impa, captain of the guard. Link had been on rather good terms with her ever since he'd been discovered as the legendary hero who would save Hyrule. While she was a woman, her armour wasn't particularly feminine, nor was the way she acted. However, between overseeing new recruits and taking care of Zelda, she didn't have much free time. On the other hand, there was Zelda herself. The two of them had grown quite close as the overcame the ordeal that was Ganon's onslaught. She did have some royal duties to attend to, but in Link's experience, she seemed to have more free time than Impa. However, unlike Impa, Zelda tended to dress and act in a rather feminine manner, rarely being seen wearing anything other than dresses and high heels. Link knew that if he swapped with her, that was what would be expected of him.

It was a tough choice, and each had their own pros and cons. Of course, this was just an idea. He didn't have to keep an eye on the Cucco if he didn't want to. He could always just swap with someone else and hope she didn't mess up his life while she was in it.
11533222212222222222222122221122.title: Swap into someone else's life

115332222122222222222222.content: Does Link use the Swap Wand on Proxi?
115332222122222222222222.title: Fairy Companion

1153322221222222222222222.content: Does Link swap with Cia?
1153322221222222222222222.title: Black Sorceress

11533222212222222222222221.content: For some reason, the first person to come to Link's mind when thinking about who to swap with was the recently departed Cia, the sorceress who had plunged Hyrule into darkness in the first place. He wasn't entirely sure why she came to mind, but he didn't think she'd really be a good choice to swap with for one big reason; she was dead. However, as Cia and Lana had proved, it was certainly possible for magic to cross the bounds of time. Perhaps the wand could do the same, allowing him to swap with his companions from different time periods, or allowing him to swap with Cia from a time when she was still alive. Despite initially deciding that Cia was a bad choice to try out the wand, Link was now intrigued, and felt the need to test whether the wand's magic could cross the ages. Sure, he could have tested it on one of his companions from across time, but he was so focused on swapping with Cia now that he hadn't even considered it. Now it was just a question of what to swap. The most obvious thing was her body. He wasn't sure he wanted to be a woman, but it would certainly be an easy (and obvious) test to try. Of course, there was no rush, he had plenty of time to think of other swaps to try.
11533222212222222222222221.title: Swapping with Cia

115332222122222222222222211.content: Before we continue, will this swap put Link in Cia's body in the past, or will it turn his body into Cia's in the present?
115332222122222222222222211.title: Swap bodies with Cia

choices: Play along or use the wand
1153322221222222222222222111.content:
As Link waved the wand, the world seemed to collapse around him, and everything became a blur as reality rewrote itself.

Once Link could see straight again, it was very clear something had changed. It seemed as though he was peering through the holes of a mask, but he wasn't looking at Hyrule Field anymore, but rather at the Valley of Seers. He was no longer alone, instead looking over a group of other warriors. But most importantly, he could feel a big difference in his body. From the large weights hanging from his chest, to the thin waist and wide hips, and even to the wind hitting his body thanks to his more revealing outfit, Link could tell he wasn't himself anymore. He had switched bodies with Cia! Thankfully he wasn't stranded here, however, as he could still feel the wand in his hand.

"No! Link, run!" he heard a voice shout. It didn't take him long to realise the voice wasn't calling to him. The group in from of him, who he now recognised as Lana, Impa, Zelda (disguised as Sheik), and his old body, turned and ran in the opposite direction from him. Link wasn't entirely sure what was happening, until he was the completed Triforce floating in front of him. He must have swapped with Cia at the point where she disrupted time, calling forth locations from other eras. It was one of his most vivid memories of Cia, after all.

"Cia..." he heard another voice say, this time speaking to him. "The time to call the fragments of my spirit is NOW." Link recognised that voice; it was Ganondorf. He wanted Link to use the Triforce to call forth the fragments of his spirit from across the ages. He couldn't allow that to happen! If he was Cia now, he could put a stop to this! However, before he did anything, Link stopped to think about what doing this would mean. He was currently in the past, in Cia's body, thanks to the wand. If he changed what Cia had done in the past, would that not affect the future? If he stopped Cia from resurrecting Ganondorf, would things be different when he swapped back with his body in the present? Perhaps it would be safer to simply play along and do as Cia did. Even safer, though, would probably be to not interfere at all, and simply use the Swap Wand to get out of here, either going back to the present, or at least to a less influential role here in the past.
1153322221222222222222222111.title: Into the past

choices: Play along, pretend to be Cia
11533222212222222222222221112.content: Link was admittedly a bit afraid of altering the timeline. Changing what happened here in the past could potentially change what the present was like back when he returned to his own body. That only left him with two options; playing along, or using the wand again. If he played along, and simply did what Cia had done in the past, there should be no issues with the timeline being altered. However, playing along also meant obeying Ganon, and Link wasn't sure he wanted to do that, regardless of who the world thought he was right now. Not to mention, he didn't know what was happening to his body right now. Was past Cia in his body in the present? Was his body acting as if it was still him? Was it merely unconscious? On the other hand, using the wand again could put things right, allowing him to return to the present, and stop messing around with the timeline. From there, he could continue mess around with the wand in a safer way, one that didn't have the possibility of altering the course of the timeline. However, he was still a bit worried. When he swapped with Cia, Cia was already dead and gone in his time, so the wand sent him back in time to when Cia was alive. Now the he was Cia, if he wanted to swap back into his own body, there were two options to choose from; his own body in the present, and the version of him here in the past. If he messed up and swapped with past Link, then past Link might screw things up with the timeline by not obeying Ganon. Was that a risk he was willing to take right now, at such a pivotal moment in history?
11533222212222222222222221112.title: Play along or use the wand

11533222212222222222222222.content: Does Link swap with Medli?
