1153322221222222222222222222.title: Phantom Princess

choices: Link swaps bodies with Toon Zelda
11533222212222222222222222221.content:
As Link pondered who he should use the wand on, he couldn't help but wonder exactly what the limitations on its magic were. On his quest to stop Cia and Ganon, he'd met many allies from various points in Hyrule's history. Would the wand work on them, even though they weren't in this time period anymore? With that in mind, he decided to narrow down his options to his allies from other time periods.

Unfortunately, that still left him with quite a few options to choose from. However, as he deliberated over which one to test the wand on, one in particular came to mind. It was another princess of Hyrule, also named Zelda, however she had fallen victim to a curse which forced her spirit out of her body, essentially turning her into a ghost. As such, she possessed a cursed suit of armor known as a Phantom in order to aim the group when fighting. Would the wand work on someone like her? Perhaps compounding the two tests wasn't the smartest idea, but now Link was curious.

Of course, now that he had a target in mind, he still needed to decide what he should swap. The most obvious thing would be to swap bodies, but how would something like that work on someone who was a ghost and didn't have a body? Would it put her in his body while he turned into a ghost? Would she gain his male body, while he gained her female spectral form? Would it give him a Phantom's body instead of Zelda's? Would he swap with her at a point in time when she still had a body, since her ghostly self wasn't in this time period anymore? Link's curiosity continued to grow, but perhaps compounding three tests atop one another wasn't the smartest idea.
11533222212222222222222222221.title: Toon Zelda

115332222122222222222222222211.content: Link let his curiosity get the better of him, and so, he waved the wand through the air, thinking about swapping bodies with the Zelda from another era. After the wand had worked its magic, Link found he...

1153322221222222222222222222111.title: Link the Ghost

11533222212222222222222222221112.content:
Looking down, Link saw the young female body he recognised as belonging to the Zelda from another point in history, except he'd never seen it from this angle before. Without a doubt, he'd swapped bodies with the other Zelda. His body seemed to be slightly translucent, and his feet dangled in the air as he floated just a bit above the ground. He supposed he should probably find it strange that he was a girl now, or that he was wearing a dress, but the more overwhelming change was the fact that he no longer had a body.

Being body-less gave him an idea, however. The other Zelda was able to possess that Phantom armour, so perhaps he'd be able to possess other people while in this form. Sure, he could always swap bodies with people using the wand, but the idea of controlling someone from the inside instead of forcing them out of their own body seemed more interesting to him, somehow.

Speaking of the wand, Link was glad to find it was still held in his dainty, spectral hand. How he were able to hold on to physical objects as a ghost, he had no idea. Looking up from his newly gained body, Link found that he was...

choices: 100 years before the events of the game
1153322222221.content: When does this take place?
1153322222221.title: Breath of the Wild

11533222222211.content:
"Oh no," Link murmured. Link, the royal knight and bodyguard of the Hyrulean princess Zelda, had fallen asleep while watching over her, and Zelda was nowhere to be found. This happened sometimes; Zelda would sneak out while Link was asleep, as she didn't want to constantly be followed. She seems to be warming up to him, though, so it's been starting to happen less often.

Link, remembering how Zelda had wanted to go investigate some inactive Sheikah shrines not too far from the castle, ran towards the castle stables to get his horse and go out to find her. However, Link suddenly tripped on something while on his way there. Checking to see what it was, he found a wand of some kind. Curious as to why such a thing was lying around, he picked it up...

And suddenly, a slew of information popped into his head, as if the wand itself had given this to him. This was known as the Swap Wand: a wand whose wielder can exchange physical, mental, or or other kinds of attributes with another.

Link was immediately intrigued by what he could do with such a thing. Perhaps he could switch something with Zelda to find out where she is? Or maybe switch with Zelda or someone else to take a break from the stress he's been keeping within himself of having to hold up to the expectations of everyone as the Hero? Link thought over who to use this on...
11533222222211.title: 100 Years Ago

115332222222111.content: Link decided to swap something with the princess. However, what will it be?
115332222222111.title: Zelda

1153322222221111.content:
Link thought it would be best to just switch bodies with Zelda. Why bother searching for her when he can find out exactly where she is with this? Hopefully, she wouldn't mind him doing this. Keeping watch of her is his job, after all. Though knowing Zelda, she would probably be very upset with him for this.

But that doesn't matter so long as he's sure Zelda is safe.

Link then waved the wand, wishing to switch bodies with the princess of Hyrule...


Where was Zelda located?
1153322222221111.title: Body Swap

11533222222211111.content: Where in the castle is she?
11533222222211111.title: In the Castle

115332222222111112.content: Was Zelda in her study?
115332222222111112.title: Her Study?

1153322222221111121.content:
Link suddenly found himself in what appeared to be Princess Zelda's Study, sitting in a chair and having dropped a pen while writing into a journal. What was being written in the journal didn't matter as much as this sudden change in location, though. Before even beginning to look around, Link could already tell he simply felt different. He felt slimmer, heavier near his chest, and a foreign sense of emptiness in between his legs. Link was breathing from his mouth, and he could even tell that the faint whisper of his voice while breathing was different.

Link then began to look around. He noticed his hair was now longer than what it had been before, (as Link did have shoulder-length hair, but kept it in a short ponytail at all times) and felt it reaching down towards his tailbone. He then looked down at himself and saw that he was wearing what appeared to be Zelda's formal dress, and that he had two mounds on his chest that he never had before.

Link didn't even need to look at the rest of himself or the room he was in to know what had happened. The wand had worked, and he had switched bodies with Princess Zelda.

"I can't believe this is real..." Link muttered to himself, surprisingly but at the same time unsurprisingly in Zelda's voice. He lacked Zelda's more refined and noble way of speaking, however, so hearing Zelda's voice in a more common accent felt very unnatural to him.

Link stood up from his chair, and walked towards Zelda's room across from the study to see himself in a mirror, looking at the rest of his new body along the way. Seeing the rest of the dress, his new, slender arms and feet, and even feeling larger hips and a larger rear than previously had. Link also noticed that he was carrying the Swap Wand in his hand, something that he didn't catch before. Was he holding it the whole time? Does the Swap Wand follow him when he switches to someone else's body?

As soon as he entered Zelda's room, he went towards the mirror, finally seeing Zelda's reflection mimic every movement he made. This out-of-body experience he was having now was something very few, if no one before him, could ever relate to.

Link started to think while he watched as Zelda's reflection copy everything he was doing. He was just switching with her to find out where she was, so it was probably best to switch back into his own body now. However, was the princess now. He has such a beautiful body, and he can practically get anything he wanted. Maybe it would be nice to stay in Zelda's body a while longer? He feels he deserves a break anyways.

But at the same time, the Calamity Ganon could appear any moment, and Zelda still hasn't awakened her powers. This would only be a waste of time and possibly detriment the whole plan to defeat it. Was it worth taking the risk?

Link thought deeply on this as he gently stroked his new long, soft hair...
1153322222221111121.title: Becoming the Princess of Hyrule

choices: Abuse his new position as princess
11533222222211111211.content:
"I don't see how a few hours would hurt," Link thought. This was a once in a lifetime opportunity. He can't just let being the princess of an entire kingdom go to waste! Just a few hours of messing around should be fine, whether it be doing something with Zelda's body, or using his new position as princess in order to do things he wouldn't otherwise be allowed to do.

What will it be?
11533222222211111211.title: Stay in Zelda's Body

115332222222111112111.content:
Link decided to go with doing something with his new body. Zelda was such a beautiful young woman. She was an epitome of beauty. Getting to experience having this beauty for himself would certainly be fun. Besides, he's obviously never been a girl before.

But what exactly will he do with his body?

1153322222221121.content: Link thought about what to swap with Mipha. There were so many possibilities. He could swap bodies, and become a Zora for a while, though he wasn't sure if he was comfortable with being a different race at this point. Maybe he could switch lives, so people though he was Mipha, but he didn't change. Or maybe he could try something abstract, like personal information or belongings. Maybe even something mental, like personality. What does he do?

1153322222221122.title: Urbosa?

11533222222212.title: During the Game?

choices: Link focused on Mipha or Daruk
Link thought about Revali or Urbosa
115332222222121.content:
Link had done it. He had completed all of the trails and the 4 divine beasts had been cleans of the evils of Calamity Gannon. He was ready to go to the castle and finally help Princess Zelda and defeat calamity Gannon once and for all.

"Or am I?" Link reluctantly said to himself alone atop a mountain as he gazed down on the vast world he had explored. He had visited so many trials, defeated so many monsters, and helps everyone that he could. But why did he do it? He told himself that he did it all to help as many people as he could, he told himself he needed to visit every shrine to become as strong as possible. "But am I strong enough?" Link again asked himself. He knew the fate of all of Hyrule rested on his schoulders but that was also the case 100 years ago and he had failed. Had he really become strong enough to finally defeat evil once and for all?

Link knew he couldn't stand on the mountain forever, so with doubt in his mind and heart he took his first step towards Hyrule castle and the end of his adventure.

Fate however seemed to have something else in mind, another trail of sorts? A tool that could help defeat Gannon? Or something that could spell Link's end. That was for Link to determine as he saw what he first thought to be a shooting star shoot down and land mere feet away. Briefly forgetting his destiny, Link ran to the small crater where a small baton like object was waiting. Summoning up his significant amount of courage, Link reached down and picked up the wand and all of the sudden a rush of information filled his mind telling him what this object was and how it.

"With this, I can do it. I can without a doubt have the power to defeat the Gannon. But who could I possibly swap with in order to become strong enough?"

Strong. There were many people he had met in his journey he would call strong. Most of them in spirit, but Link felt he would need more than emotional support to win the day. And then Link got an idea. He knew strong people, in fact he felt he had strong people along within him on this journey as he defeated each Divine Beast.

Mipha, the Zora with a huge heart and healing powers that saved him more times than he could count.
Daruk, the Goron who's powerful shield protected him from lethal blows regularly.
Revali, the Rito who's wings gave him flight to survey the land and attack foes from above.
Urbosa, the Gerudo who could summon lightning at the snap of a finger to go along with impressive physical abilities.

Link had access to all of these power's, but he was just borrowing them and could only use them so many times. Perhaps if he swapped something with one of his friends and master even just one of these powers he believed he could be strong enough to potentially win the day. So Link closed his eyes and concentrated on one of his long lost friends and waved the wand.
115332222222121.title: Link wants to use the Swap Wand to become stronger

1153322222221211.content:
Link thought back again to 100 year ago. He had gone in thinking he could just charge in and save the world with just courage, will, and a blade alone. Link felt he knew better now, he wanted to take a more defensive approach. Link quickly said to his friends he felt were listening, "I'm sorry Revali, Urbosa. You're power and friendship helped me so much but I don't think you can help me now." Thinking about his friends caused a tear to slide down Link's face. But now was not the time for tears, he had more preparations to make. So Link began to weight the pros and cons of using the Swap Wand on Mipha or Daruk.

Mipha was strong of spirit and heart but not as much in braun. But with her healing arts at Link's side he had already charged into otherwise losing battles many times and been victorious. And Link felt if he used the Swap Wand on her spirit the resided with him he would be able to heal himself so quickly and frequently he could never fall in battle. He could just stand and fight over and over again healing himself until he won.

But if he chose Daruk he would had the power to stand up to the biggest and baddest of Ganon's army. With Daruk's abilities he could get his with the eye lasers of every mechanical creature in Hyrule and he could probably laugh it off much like Daruk would do. And his physical strength wasn't something to take lightly either.

Link knew he might only be able to swap abilities and powers with one of them and Link finally made his choice as he waved the Swap Wand in the air.
1153322222221211.title: Link wants to Swap for Defense over Offense

choices: Link thinks he should take more aspects from others to become stronger
Link can't waist any more time he'll have to beat Ganon with his new body
11533222222212111.content:
Focusing on the abilities, powers, and everything that made Mipha so amazing to him, Link thought of her as he waved the swap wand in the air.

And everything that Link cared about and admired in Mipha became his in a few mere moments. But it wasn't just her powers like Link had thought about when he first thought of the swap. He admired so much about her, how strong she was when people needed someone to look up to, her willingness to go into battle with her Lightscale Trident in hand, her ability to be a Zora that all other Zora would admire. Everything he cared about in Mipha is what he thought of and so that is what he swapped.

Link no longer felt like himself. His entire body felt like it had shifted and had become something else. His skin had become sleek yet slightly scaly upon close inspection. Then his skin began to change colors, it became a light green that matched the tunic he was wearing with streaks of red and blue that reminded him of Mipha's skin the the outfit she would wear. He felt the back of his head that now had a weight to it and sure enough he had the same tail like protrusion that the Zora had. Link realized swapping such vague ideas with Mipha had turned him into a Zora. And as he crossed his arms across his chest he realized that wasn't the only thing he'd swapped. Link felt something odd and looked down his tunic and saw two bumps there that certainly weren't there before.

Link was in a bit of shock as he looked at the drastic changes to his body but deep down he could feel something within him. A power that he had briefly felt thanks to Mipha but now he felt he could control it at will. Link pulled out the Master Sword from his bag and raised it, but feeling like it didn't feel quite right put it away and instead pulled out Mipha's old trident. Link looked at his foot, or Zora fin (he wasn't sure what was the anatomically correct term), took a deep breath, and stabbed down. The sharp trident immediately pierced the skin. Link winced but it wasn't any worse than most of the injuries he'd suffered on this long journey. He pulled out the trident and held out his hand to the fresh would. Link channeled the powers he now felt within and with a soft green glow the wound was gone and he felt better than ever. What's more he felt like he could heal 1000 injuries and still have the power for more.

"This thing is more powerful than I'd imagined, I should be more careful when using it." Link said thinking of how he could change himself back. So Link raised the Swap Wand once again ready the change back when a thought crossed his mind.
11533222222212111.title: Link gains Mipha's Grace and becomes like her

choices: Zora Link invites Prince Sidon to fight Ganon
Link pushes forward to fight Ganon alone
115332222222121112.content:
Feeling a little embarised and self conscious Link raised the wand into the air wondering how to change himself again so that he could be more comfortable, but as he did the sky turned red as once again the blood moon rose for what felt like the 100th time.

Link lowered the wand, "No, I've spent too much time delaying this fight. I must go forth, no matter the body, no matter the weapons, no matter the powers. Calamity Ganon has ruled over Hyrule for too long."

Finally feeling ready to face off against the great evil, took out his glider and jumped from the top of the mountain. Even though he had done this countless times throughout the adventure, Link never got tired to the feel of the wind flowing through his hair. Although that wasn't the case anymore. The wind caused the tail like extension on the back of his head to flop against his back like a constant thumping. He felt the wind against the scales on his body, it made a weird dry sensation that wasn't very comfortable. Link looked down and saw the Zora village. Seeing it below and all that water tempted Link a lot. He wanted to know what the water would feel like on his new Zora body, it would just feel natural and right.

But alas, going down for a dip was not what he needed to be doing. He had a mission to complete. He couldn't let down all the people he'd met on his journey. As the faces of everyone he'd met rushed through his head it stopped on one person. One person who had fought along his side against a Divine Beast for his people and showed a willingness to fight into he heart of darkness itself.

Prince Sidon. The Zora prince who's smile and optimism was infectious, Link was smiling now thinking about him. Link wasn't planning to bring anyone with him to Hyrule castle, but Sidon was on the way and had shown himself to be more than callable in battle. And then on top of that, Link had Mipha's healing powers and he was certain that he had more than enough power to heal himself and another front line fighter like Sidon.

As Link flew over the Zora village he came to a decision.
115332222222121112.title: Link goes forward with his new female Zora body

choices: Ganon can not stand up to Link and Sidon's partnership
Turns out Ganon had his own Swap Wand and has a surprise for Link
1153322222221211121.content:
Link couldn't explain it, as he pictures Sidon's smiling face Link knew he wanted Sidon with him on this journey. He knew he had the power to protect him from harm. On top of that he knew Sidon was capable and deserved to be in this fight. Link didn't want to go in alone, and with Sidon he wouldn't have to. Link let go of the glider directly above the Zora palace and then brought it out again at the last second before he could turn into a heaping of Zora stew. Link ran up to the throne where the King Dorephan was sitting with Sidon standing at his side.

"Prince Sidon, I know you may not recognize me like this but I am actually..." Link started ready to explain why he was now a green female Zora, but the prince cut him off.

"How could I forget the beautiful face of the hero who saved the Zora, freed the Divine Beast, and will soon defeat calamity Ganon.

Link was stunned for a second as he felt his green scales turn a shade of red. I really underestimated the power of that wand. Link thought as he pushed a lot of thoughts out of his hand and got to the point. "Prince Sidon it is time for the final battle and I want you at my side. Will you join me?" Link said offering his hand to the prince.

The Prince didn't even hesitate. With incredible speed Sidon stepped forward, got down on his knees and took Link's hand. "I had dreamed this day would come, but did not feel it was my place to ask. Thank you for taking me with you to the end. I will never let you down." And much to Link's surprise Sidon actually kissed his hand and stood back up with his fist in the air and his usual huge smile across his face. "Well what are we waiting for? Let's go!"

"Ah, yes, right." Link said a little flustered, but now was not the time to ask question, it was the time for action. So with some fanfare from the Zora, Link and Prince Sidon left the Zora village and made their way the Hyrule castle for a final confrontation.
1153322222221211121.title: Zora Link invites Prince Sidon to fight Ganon

115332222222122.content: Does this take place after Link and Zelda seal away Calamity Ganon?
115332222222122.title: After the Game?

1153322222221221.content:
Link stared up at Hyrule Castle, and the clear skies that surrounded it. For what was probably the first time in 100 years, Hyrule was peaceful. Thanks to the combined efforts of himself, Zelda, and the Champions, Ganon had finally been defeated. There was still much to do, of course, as the castle and much of Hyrule was still in ruins, but they could rest easy knowing the biggest threat had been done away with.

Even though it looked like a warzone, with the castle in ruins and dead Guardians scattered everywhere, Link still liked coming out here to look at the castle, as a reminder of all they'd managed to accomplish. However, he had other things to do, so he couldn't sit here staring for too long. As he turned around, to head back the way he came, though, he noticed something he hadn't previously seen on his previous trips to the castle. Something glinted from the bottom of the dried up fountain. It seemed to be some kind of... magic wand? Link had encountered many weapons on his travels through Hyrule, but none like this. He reached in to pick it up.

As soon as his fingers touched the wand, his mind was suddenly filled with knowledge about what it was, and what it could do. This was the Swap Wand, a magical implement capable of exchanging anything between two people, so long as the user simply waved it and thought about what they wanted to swap. In addition, it rewrote the fabric of reality so that only the person holding the wand would be aware of any changes being made. To think that a thing so powerful existed, and that it was now his, Link was speechless.

Almost immediately, Link wanted to try out the wand. It wasn't like there was some sort of world-ending calamity that required his attention anymore, he could afford to have a bit of fun with this. 1153322222221221221.content:
Link ultimately decided to swap not with Zelda, but with Paya, the granddaughter of the Sheikah Elder Impa. While he had gotten to know Zelda quite well, even after his memories had been erased by the Shrine of Resurrection, he didn't really know Paya all too well. She seemed incredibly shy around him, and even after Calamity Ganon had been defeated, she always seemed so busy. Perhaps this wand could help him get to know her better.

But how exactly could he do that? What could he swap that could allow him to get to know her better? He wasn't too concerned about doing something that might frighten or upset her, as the wand would make it so only he was aware of what had changed, but he wasn't sure what the wand could really do for him in this situation. Maybe he should just try a body swap? It might be a bit awkward to get used to at first, with him being a man and Paya being a woman, but he thought he might be able to learn a bit by just going through Paya's daily routine himself.
1153322222221221221.title: Paya

choices: Go do something else as Paya
11533222222212212211.content:
Link ended up deciding to just go for the most obvious choice, and try a body swap. Bracing himself for the change, Link closed his eyes, and waved the wand in front of him, thinking about swapping bodies with Paya. Without even opening his eyes, he could immediately tell something was different. He was now kneeling, rather than standing, and he could no longer feel the wind on his face. His head felt weighed down, as if his hair had suddenly become heavier. His chest felt like something was hanging from it, and the tight pants he suddenly found himself wearing alerted him that a certain part of his anatomy seemed to be missing. There was no doubt; the wand had certainly worked.

Daring to open his eyes, Link saw he was now inside the second floor of Impa's house in Kakariko Village, and from the silver locks of hair swinging around at the edge of his vision as he looked around, he certainly no longer had his own body. Looking down at himself, Link found he was now wearing the traditional Sheikah garb that Paya typically wore, with its blue dress-like garment and red and white coat over the top, the tight white pants and brown shoes, and even her blue gloves and the pair of red sticks stuck up in her hair. Speaking of which, Link realised that the reason his head felt heavier was because Paya's silvery hair was much longer than his, resting on his back with a bit tied up on top of his head. He could tell that the belt around his waist pulled in further than it would have on his own body, and the tight pants he was sat flat against his crotch without a bulge in sight. He definitely no longer had his own body, and instead, now sat in the body of Paya, Impa's granddaughter.

Diverting his attention away from his new body, Link noticed exactly where he was. He was kneeling in front of a small desk which sat in the corner of the room. In one hand, he held a quill for writing, and in the other, he held the swap wand. He was thankful that it traveled around with him as he swapped, he didn't know what he'd do if it instead decided to stay with his body, and leave him stuck as Paya. However, since he was holding the quill, he assumed he must have swapped with Paya while she was in the middle of writing something. Looking at the desk, he recognised the book in front of him; it was Paya's diary. He'd seen it there before, but Paya had forbid him from reading itl it was personal, after all. However now that he was Paya, perhaps it would be okay to take a peek? It was his diary now, after all, and apparently she'd been in the middle of writing an entry when he swapped into her. Still, perhaps that was invading her privacy a little too much. That seemed like a silly thing to think, considering he'd literally taken her body, but reading her private thoughts seemed like it might be a little too much. Maybe he should leave it and just go about his business, doing Paya's chores or whatever it was she needed to do today. It was rather tempting, though.

1153322222221221222221.content:
For some odd reason, one of the potential candidates to pop into Link's head when thinking about who to test the Swap Wand on was the Great Fairies scattered around Hyrule. Their power had supposedly diminished before he came along and gave them his rupees. After that, they were able to power up his armour, provided he had the correct materials.

They had proved helpful during his quest, but only after he had emptied his wallet for them. Were such magical beings really powered by money, or were they just greedy and wanted his money before they'd offer to help him? Perhaps he could find out, and maybe even get his money back, if he tried swapping with one of them. It was worth a try at least. It also helped that he was a bit curious about what the rest of their bodies looked like, considering he'd only ever seen them from the waist up.

But which one to swap with? There were four of them, after all. Cotera, near Kakariko Village, Kaysa, in the Tabatha Frontier, Mija, near Tarrey Town, and Tera, in the Gerudo desert. Any one would be as good as any of the others, probably.
1153322222221221222221.title: Great Fairy

115332222222122122222122.content:
Link ultimately decided to swap with Tera, the Great Fairy whose fountain was located out in the Gerudo Desert. She was the eldest of the four sisters, and the one he'd given the most money too, so he likely stood to gain the most from swapping with her, either in terms of money or in terms of magical power.

But what to swap? He was sure the wand was capable of swapping a great many things, but maybe it would be wisest to start with something simple. Simply swapping bodies with the Great Fairy seemed like a simple enough test. It would get him practically everything he wanted out of the swap; a chance to test out the Great Fairy's powers, the possibility of getting his money back, and maybe the opportunity to see what the Great Fairies looked like below the waist.

He was a little hesitant to try this swap, however. While this swap would give him everything there possibly was to gain when swapping with Tera, she and the other Great Fairies were obviously female, and, being a man, Link was a bit hesitant to try and hop into one of their somewhat voluptuous bodies. Perhaps there was something else he could try swapping first instead...
115332222222122122222122.title: Tera

1153322222221221222221221.content:
Hesitant as he was, Link decided to take the plunge. He held the wand up, closed his eyes, and waved the wand, thinking about swapping bodies with Tera, the eldest of the Great Fairies.

Within a flash, everything felt different. Obviously, his body was different, but even his surroundings had changed. He slowly opened his eyes to find... he was underwater. Panicking for a moment, Link frantically looked around for where the surface was. Thankfully, it didn't seem too far away, although it did seem to be just a small opening, and Link quickly pushed himself through the water towards it, doing his best to ignore the odd sensations his body was sending him, and the white hair falling into his line of sight.

He burst out of the water, gripping the edge of the ring he'd surfaced from as he coughed the water out of his lungs. He had no idea how or why the Great Fairies were able to stay underwater as long as they did. Tera's body was probably able to handle it, but he hadn't been prepared to suddenly be underwater, and hadn't had time to figure it out before he panicked. As he coughed though, he noticed he really didn't sound a lot like himself. His voice was much higher pitched and feminine. He blinked the water out of his eyes, and looked around. As he'd expected, he was out at the Gerudo Great Skeleton, where Tera's fountain had been, but everything looked a lot smaller now.

No longer able to ignore the sensations his body was giving him, Link looked down at himself. Although, he supposed "himself" wasn't exactly the best word to describe it. No one besides him would describe this large, feminine body, with its outfit that barely covered anything wrapped just a little too tightly around it as "himself". Droplets of water that clung to his body sparkled in the sunlight alongside the various trinkets that adorned his body. He raised his hands into view, noting how feminine they looked, with their long purple nails. He couldn't see all of it, but he could feel Tera's large silver curls piled atop his head, spilling over on the right side of his head. He could fake makeup thickly caked on his eyelids and long eyelashes, and on his plump lips. He moved around a little in the fountain, feeling how the various parts of his body moved and jiggled. It was odd to say the least.

"Well, I suppose it worked," Link said aloud, hearing Tera's voice escape his mouth instead of his own. Thankfully, he still held the wand in his hand, although it looked much smaller now that he had one of the Great Fairies' bodies, holding it between two fingers instead of in his whole hand. To say he felt uncomfortable right now would be an understatement, but this is what he had wanted. He was now one of the four Great Fairies of Hyrule, and in accordance with that, he had her body and her powers. Now he could see if she had really needed all those rupees in order to use her powers, and if not, then he could possibly get his rupees back. Of course, as he looked down at the two orbs of flesh hanging from his chest, there was another thing immediately available for him to explore and experiment with.
1153322222221221222221221.title: Body Swap

11533222222212212222212211.content: While Tera's body was tempting for his male mind, that wasn't why Link was here. He had swapped with Tera in order to gain access to her powers, and test out whether she really needed all those rupees he'd given her. There was only one problem; Link had no idea how to use her magic. It was probably second nature to her and her sisters, but Link had only just become one of them, and didn't actually know how they did it. Could he even do it out here by himself? He'd only ever seen them use there magic to power up his armour, but surely there was more they could do than that, right? Maybe he just needed some time to figure it out.
11533222222212212222212211.title: Try out Tera's powers

115332222222122122222122112.content:
All of a sudden, Link heard a voice that didn't belong to him (or Tera, for that matter).

"Wow! It really is real!"

Link diverted his attention from his body to look at the source of the voice; a young Gerudo woman approaching the fountain. He hadn't been expect this, that someone would actually be able to brave the desert and find the fountain out here in the middle of nowhere. Perhaps if he'd chosen one of the fairies closer to civilisation, but not this one. The Gerudo ran up to the base of the fountain, her awe at meeting one of the Great Fairies evident on her face.

She kneeled at at the base of the fountain, lowering her head, and said, "O Great Fairy, please, bestow upon me your blessings."

Link had no idea what she was talking about. As far as he knew, the closest thing to a "blessing" the Great Fairies gave was powering up armour. Perhaps this woman simply didn't know how the Great Fairies worked, since he hadn't had a chance to explain it to her before she ran up here?

Regardless, Link was somewhat worried now. He had taken on the role of the Great Fairy, but hadn't been prepared for her duties. Perhaps he could just wing it? He'd just explain what service the Great Fairies actually performed, and then if the Gerudo woman actually wanted her clothes powered up, he'd figure it out from there. How hard could it be, right? But what if he messed up? Would that cause people to lose faith in the Great Fairies' abilities, and thus, have them close up their fountains again until he came by and emptied his wallets for them? Link wasn't sure he wanted to take that risk. After all, if he couldn't imitate Tera, he could just become someone else, thanks to the wand held between his fingers.
115332222222122122222122112.title: Someone arrives at the fountain

1153322222221221222221221122.content: Link decided not to risk it. For the Great Fairies' sake (and for his wallet's sake), it was better to let the real Tera handle this, while he used the wand to become someone else. The most logical choice would have been to simply swap back into his own body and try doing something else while he was there, but in his panic at someone suddenly finding him in Tera's body, that option somehow slipped Link's mind. Instead, his first thought was to swap with this Gerudo woman, which would allow him to observe Tera in action and perhaps figure out how she performed her magic, or at least be nearby to swap back after she was done. However, at this point, he really just wanted to be out of here, and to let Tera handle the situation, so practically any body would be more preferable to this one. perhaps he could just wish to be out of here and be someone else, and the wand could handle the who for him.
1153322222221221222221221122.title: Use the Swap Wand

11533222222212212222212211222.content: Who does link swap with?
11533222222212212222212211222.title: Swap at random

1153322222221221222221222.content:
Deciding he wasn't quite ready for a body swap, Link instead came up with the idea of swapping lives with Tera. Provided the wand could actually do something along those lines, he assumed it would cause the world to see him as Tera, and she as him, but without giving him her body. Although he'd miss out on the chance to see what a Great Fairy's whole body looked like, this was a good alternative that would allow him to investigate the Great Fairies' powers, and possibly reclaim his wealth.

It would still be rather odd to be seen by the world as a Great Fairy, but it was only for a little while. He'd just test out the wand's capabilities, try out Tera's powers, see if he could potentially get his rupees back, and then switch back into his own life. It was a simple enough plan. It also kind of helped that Tera's fountain was out in the middle of the desert where few were likely to find it, which meant he probably wouldn't have to interact with anyone while they thought he was Tera. There was always a chance, though...
1153322222221221222221222.title: More Choices

11533222222212212222212222.content:
Link ultimately decided against swapping bodies or lives with Tera. As intrigued as he was by the idea of becoming the Great Fairy, and testing out her powers and such, he wasn't sure he was ready for the world to see him as someone else. It was weird enough that he could rewrite reality as he saw fit thanks to the wand, but for the time being, he decided to mess around with the wand while still appearing to be Link to the rest of the world.

Regardless of his plan to become one of the Great Fairies falling through, Link decided that since he'd already set his sights Tera, he might as well keep her as his target. But if not her body or her life, what should be swap with her? He still wanted to be himself, but he wanted to see what absurdities this wand could create. Perhaps if he only swapped specific body parts, rather than the whole body. That could certainly create some interesting situations, albeit with it being seen as normal to the rest of the world, and he's still technically be himself.
11533222222212212222212222.title: More Choices

choices: Link swaps his hair with Tera
115332222222122122222122221.content: Picturing how the Great Fairies looked in his mind, and how different parts of them would look on his own body, Link was already starting to chuckle, and he knew he'd made the right decision. But that only led to another decision; what body part to swap? Practically any part he chose could lead to some interesting results, thanks to how different he was to Tera. Thinking about her body, there were certain... assets that stuck out in his male mind, but he thought that might seem a little perverted to choose for his first ever swap with the remote. But what else stood out about her? Perhaps her hair? Link's hair was a little longer than average, but he always kept it in a rather simple style, just pulling it back into a small ponytail. Tera, on the other hand, had her hair up in what seemed to Link to be a rather elaborate, with a mountain of silver curls piled atop her head. That would certainly be a stark contrast from what he was used to, but without it being too obtrusive and awkward.
115332222222122122222122221.title: Body Part Swap

1153322222221221222221222211.content: Before we continue, does Tera's hair adjust to the size of Link's body, or does it stay the same size it was on Tera?
1153322222221221222221222211.title: Link swaps his hair with Tera

11533222222212212222212222112.content:
Link waved the wand in front of him, thinking about swapping hairstyles with the Great Fairy Tera. It was a silly idea, but he felt that since he could now rewrite reality as he saw fit, and anyone besides him would treat it as if it were normal, why not allow himself to be a bit silly?

Once the wand was waved, Link suddenly lost his balance, a weight on his head threatening to pull him over. Thankfully, he was able to steady himself on the fountain that he'd found the wand in. He knew Tera had more hair than he did, and thus her hair would be heavier than his, but he hadn't expected just how much heavier it would be. As he let go of the fountain and stood up proper again, however, he noticed a large silver curl hanging from his head. That was to be expected, however, said curl had only reached Tera's shoulders, whereas right now, the curl dangled all the way down to his hips. That, he had not expected.

He didn't have any sort of mirror or something with which to see his reflection, and Zelda had taken back the Sheikah Slate after Ganon's defeat, but thanks to the sun in the sky, Link was at least able to see his shadow. His shadow seemed to show a large bulbous mass, almost as tall as he was, sitting upon his head. That explained why it seemed to be so heavy at first; not only had he gained Tera's hairstyle, but it had retained its original size, appearing massive on his normal-sized body due to Tera being giant compared to him. That only ended up making the situation that much more silly.

Taking a few steps away from the fountain, Link found the weight wasn't as bad as he'd initially thought. Even with the large tiara Tera wore in her hair, he's still worn armour heavier than this. If anything the size was more of a problem than the weight. It was just that he hadn't been expecting it to be that heavy, so it had caught him off guard. He could see himself being able to go about his business like this without it interfering too much.

Of course, that brought up the question of what to do next. Link had only swapped his hairstyle on a whim, wanting to test out the remote on Tera, and picking something silly to use it for. Now the test was complete, he had her hairstyle, but what was he going to do with it? He had mused that it probably wouldn't interfere with him too much, so he could just sort of keep it for now. He wondered if anyone would treat him any differently like this, even though the swap should be treated as normal by everyone besides him. Then again, it was rather silly, so maybe he should just swap back. Of course, now that he'd used the wand once, and gotten a taste of its powers, he found himself wanting to try it out again. After all, he could bend reality to his will, why wouldn't he want to keep using it?
11533222222212212222212222112.title: A Fairy Hairy Situation

115332222222122122222122221122.content:
Link ultimately decided he wasn't satisfied just staying like this, and held up the wand again. Now he had a choice to make; to swap back, or to try another swap.

If he swapped back, he'd be back to normal, and this silly, humongous hairstyle would be back where it belonged. That also kind of set up him back up as a blank canvas again, ready to try out other swaps without this one getting in the way, if he so wished.

If he swapped again, he'd still have this humongous hairstyle atop his head, but the possibilities were practically endless for whatever else he could do to his body if he wanted. Every besides him already saw it as normal for him to have this much hair, so was it really necessary to swap back first?
115332222222122122222122221122.title: Use the wand again

1153322222221221222221222211222.content:
Toying with his new silver curls, Link ultimately decided to not bother with swapping back. The rest of the world saw this as normal, so as long as it wasn't getting in his was and hampering his day to day life, he didn't particularly care, and it could stick around for now. He'd just have to remember that Tera now possessed his original hairstyle, in case he wanted it back at some point.

He did still want to use the wand again, though, but rather than swapping back, he wanted to try a new swap. Performing another swap while keeping the first one would kind of making him more jumbled up, but as previously stated, everyone else saw it as normal, so what did it matter? He'd found this wand himself, and he was going to have fun with it.

But now that trailed him back to his original dilemma, back past even the question of what to swap; who to swap with. The most obvious choice was to target Tera again, whose hair he was currently running a hand through. He'd swapped with her before, and he could always do it again. Of course, with him having met so many people throughout his journey through Hyrule, why limit himself to swapping with just one person?
1153322222221221222221222211222.title: New Swap

1153322222221221222222.content: Does Link use the Swap Wand on Riju's personal guard, Buliara?
1153322222221221222222.title: Buliara?

11533222222212212222221.content:
As Link thought about potential uses for the Swap Wand, he remembered the trouble he'd had trying to get into Gerudo Town when trying to deal with Vah Naboris. Only women were allowed inside, so he'd needed to dress up as a girl to get in. Even after Naboris had been calmed, and Riju, the chief of the Gerudo, had recognised him as a hero, he still needed to crossdress to be allowed in; no exceptions were made. He'd always had to be careful about what he did while in town, the make sure no one found out that under his outfit, he was actually a man. Perhaps, with this wand, he could do something about that.

He thought about swapping with Riju and making an exception to allow himself into the town sans disguise, but decided against it. Even with her position as chief, people would probably question her decision to allow a man into the town, and she'd probably overturn the decision once he swapped back. However, in thinking about swapping with Riju, he realised there was a much more direct approach that would allow him to enter; he'd just use the wand to become a girl himself. Then he should have no problem getting inside.

He briefly considered swapping with Riju, but decided against it. To get the desired result, he'd either need to swap bodies or genders, and both held complications when dealing with Riju, either depriving Gerudo town of it's chief by making her into a man, or putting someone inexperienced in her place. Instead, he opted to try swapping with Buliara, Gerudo captain of the guard. While Link had no experience as a ruler, he did have experience as a knight, and was confident that he wouldn't be messing up anything by swapping with Buliara. There were probably less important Gerudo he could swap with, but since he could actually remember Buliara's name, he figured he might as well go with her.

Now it was just a question of what to swap. If he wanted to get into Gerudo Town, swapping bodies or genders would probably be the best option. Swapping bodies would making him into Buliara, captain of the guard and a member of the Gerudo, who obviously wouldn't have any troubled getting into Gerudo Town. Of course, that option meant that he'd have to pretend to be someone else, and his usual self still wouldn't be allowed into the town. Gender swap would make him into a woman, which would mean he would be allowed into the town regardless of the fact that he was still Hylian. Of course, that would also make Buliara a man, making her not allowed in town. He knew that there was supposed to only be one male Gerudo born every 100 years, so he hoped making Buliara into a man wouldn't mess with anything.

Of course, just because he wanted to be able to get into Gerudo Town, didn't mean he needed to limit himself to those options. So long as he didn't lose the wand, there'd be plenty of time to do whatever swaps he wanted, and no one would be the wiser.
11533222222212212222221.title: Buliara

115332222222122122222211.content: Which swap does Link choose?
115332222222122122222211.title: Body Swap/Gender Swap

choices: Link tries to lie his way out of it
Link tells Riju the truth about the wand
1153322222221221222222111.content:
Link ultimately decided to swap bodies with Buliara. He wasn't sure whether or not Gerudo genetics would interfere with a gender swap, what with only one male being born every 100 years, and didn't really want to risk it. This way, he'd not only be allowed in town, he'd also be a local, and one treated with respect. Now decided, Link waved the wand, thinking about swapping bodies with Buliara.

In an instant, Link found he was no longer standing in front of Hyrule Castle, but rather inside Riju's throne room in Gerudo Town. That wasn't all that had changed, of course. He'd been in here before, but now the room looked smaller than before, and the hands being held out in front of him were of a much darker hue than what he was used to. His body felt very different, as was to be expected, and so he looked down at himself.

As he saw from his hands, his skin tone was much darker than it had been in his own body, and he was almost twice as tall as he used to be, with much more muscle mass. That would have been odd enough, but there was also all the differences that could be attributed to hopping over the gender fence. His hair was much longer, pulled into a ponytail that trailed down his back. His hips were wider, and despite the loose pants Buliara wore, he could tell his genitals were missing. A pair of breasts stuck out on his muscular chest. His lips were much larger, as was his nose, while his eyelashes were longer.

There was no doubt, the wand had certainly worked, and he was now in the body of Buliara. Speaking of the wand, Link noticed it was still between his hands, which now rested on the pommel of Buliara's sword.

"Is something wrong, Buliara?" Link heard a voice beside him. He looked over to his right, to see Riju, sitting on the throne next to him. She must have noticed that he was looking down at himself, behaving oddly.

"Oh, um, no. No, everything fine," he said, trying to remain calm, and failing miserably. He had been caught off guard when he heard Buliara's voice come out of his mouth instead of his own, but he supposed he should have expected it.

"Hm, if you say so." Link hoped Riju would drop the issue, and go back to... whatever it was she did while he wasn't here, but instead she seemed to notice something else. "Oh? What have you got there?"

"Huh? Where?"

"There, in your hand." Riju pointed at the Swap Wand, resting in Link's hands.

Now was now slightly panicked, and unsure of what to do. He wasn't sure he wanted other people finding out about the wand yet, not when he'd only just had a chance to try it out himself, and he definitely wasn't sure he wanted Riju to know that he wasn't Buliara. She seemed to trust him, even if Buliara didn't, but if she found out that the supposed hero of Hyrule was doing unscrupulous things like stealing other people's bodies, things might take a turn for the worst. He could try and lie his way out of this, but he'd never been particularly good with words. Then again, maybe Riju would be okay with this. Although she was the chief of the Gerudo, she did seem to be a bit more easygoing and trusting than some, perhaps she'd be willing to have a bit of fun with the wand and such, provided there was a way to make sure someone else was aware of the swaps as well.
1153322222221221222222111.title: Body Swap

choices: Riju is furious at Link's actions
11533222222212212222221112.content:
Deciding that he wasn't a good enough liar to come up with a believable explanation, let alone convince Riju that he was really Buliara, Link opted to tell Riju the truth. Hopefully she'd be understanding, or find it amusing or something. He could only imagine how much trouble he'd be in if this were the other way around, and he'd swapped with Riju and Buliara was interrogating him, so he hoped Riju would be more merciful.

"Well, you see, it's called the Swap Wand. It's a magic wand that allows me to exchange things between people, without anyone besides me noticing," Link explained, still somewhat apprehensive about letting someone else know about the wand.

"Really? What sort of things?"

"Oh, you know, possessions, powers, body parts, anything, really."

"...Seriously? And it actually works?" Riju's face was a mix of disbelief and bewilderment as Link nodded in response. "Amazing..." Link figured Riju must have really trusted Buliara if she believed him without needing to see it actually working. "Where did you even find something so powerful?"

"Just outside Hyrule Castle."

"What? When did you visit Hyrule Castle? I haven't noticed you leaving Gerudo Town lately."

"Well... actually... I'm not Buliara."

Riju's expression morphed into a mix of shock and fear, but she stood her ground regardless of what she may be feeling at the moment. "Then who...?"

"I'm Link, the Hylian Champion. I found the wand and tested it out by swapping bodies with Buliara. ...Please don't be mad at me." Link could practically hear the gears turning in Riju's head as she took in this new information, and he dreaded her response.
11533222222212212222221112.title: Link tells Riju the truth about the wand

choices: Takes the Wand, leaving Link stuck as a Gerudo
115332222222122122222211122.content: "How dare you? You break the rules of our town and turn yourself into my personal bodyguard? I don't care if you're the hero, you must be punished for this. And I know just the way to do it".
115332222222122122222211122.title: Riju is furious at Link's actions

1153322222221221222222111222.content: Does she swap something with Link?
1153322222221221222222111222.title: Other

choices: Link now had the body of Patricia the Sand Seal
Link is given the body of a newborn Gerudo girl
11533222222212212222221112222.content:
Riju looked at Link with a fiercness he had never seen from the young ruler of the Gerudo. "Guards!" She called out and a small platoon of fierce Gerudo warriors entered the throne room, Riju pointed at Link and said, "This is not Buliara, this is an imposter who has used magic to transform into her. Take her to a cell!" If the Gerudo thought it was odd they were being order to put Link as Buliara behind bars they did not show it. Without hesitation they manhandled Link who did not wish to cause more trouble by fighting back, and took him to an underground cell. Link used his massive limbs and curled up into a fetal position. He felt horrible now for what he did, taking Bulara's body and betraying Riju's trust. But he wasn't planning on keeping her body forever, he just let himself be curious and now he was paying for it.

About an hour later, Riju stood outside of Link's cell. "Stand up disgraceful hero, I don't like seeing Buliara looking like this."

Link stood up and went to the bars, "I'm so sorry about what I did, but if you give me back the wand I will swap back and I promise you will never see me again."

Riju pulled out the wand and looked between it and Link, "That is what I want to do. That is what I will do." Link couldn't help it, he began to smile, but that smile faded when Riju continued, "But, that is not what will happen today. Not exactly." Riju continued, "It seems that even thought Buliara had your body and doesn't seemed to even remember even being a Gerudo she is loyal. She is currently outside of the city patrolling with your body. When I went to see her I offered some clothes to disguise her so that she could enter town but she turned them down not wanting to dishonor Gerudo traditions by letting a voe walk in the city."

"I will give Buliara the pleasure of walking into this city again amongs her own people as she should." With that Riju waved the swap wand in the air and Link felt himself shrink down to his normal height. He was still in a Gerudo prison but he was himself again. "Thank you Riju."

"Don't thank me yet. You will still be punished for what you've done. It is only because you saved us from the divine beast and calamity Ganon that you will not be executed for what you've done. Instead you will walk free, but on one condition." Riju again held the wand up for Link to see, "You will walk free with a body that I choose for you, and that body will be this." Riju once again waved the wand and Link felt his body begin to undergo a massive change. It didn't take Link long to figure out what Riju was swapping him with.
11533222222212212222221112222.title: Link is given a different body as punishment

choices: End of the Week: Link is turned back. There's only one problem...
115332222222122122222211122221.content:
Everything about Link's body felt wrong. The first thing he noticed was a lack of legs. All he could feel was a nub where they used to be. That was when Link realized what he had become. He was a sand seal. Tusks came out around his mouth, his hands were flippers, and his legs were now a tail.
"Sorry". Link heard Riju's voice, "You must stay like this for a week, serving the Gerudo of this town. Only then will I turn you back. You will be given the Wand, but if you ever try something like that again, we will know". Link sighed, it was going to be a long week.
115332222222122122222211122221.title: Link now had the body of Patricia the Sand Seal

choices: He had his own body, but he was still a Gerudo
1153322222221221222222111222211.content:
"We'll Link, it seems it's finally time to change you back". Link celebrated, clapping his flippers together. It had been a hard week, especially since the Swap hadn't given him the seal's swimming or prophecy abilities. Just it's useless Body.
"But there is one thing we should tell you. We have looked into the Wand and discovered a way to inflict a permanent change. So you never forget what you have done. You'll find out about that soon. For now, I will fulfill my promise". Link felt his body return to a more humanoid shape. But something was wrong. Link soon discovered what it was.
1153322222221221222222111222211.title: End of the Week: Link is turned back. There'...

115332222222122122222211122222.content: "Well, perhaps walk isn't quite the right word, but this will give you the chance to reflect on your actions." Link looks around in confusion, his eyes struggling to focus on the sound of bawling. "Even if this does mean that we have two babies to take care of, I'm sure seeing your body treated like the infant inside it will be properly humbling." After a few moments he looked from the arms that held him and saw that his body was indeed the source of the crying, as another gerudo woman went to pick 'him' up and carry him away. "Now, where to begin?"
115332222222122122222211122222.title: Link is given the body of a newborn Gerudo girl

choices: Swap Bodies and lives with Riju and become the great chief of the Gerudo
Either face your possible punishment or leg it as Link-ara
115332222222122122222212.content:
As he continued to muse his two less desirable options , Link suddenly had a revelation: He could just swap lives with Buliara instead. Congratulating himself on his seeming brilliance, he flicked the wand and felt a sudden, unpleasant jolt as if he were being knocked off a galloping horse...

When he regained consciousness, he was standing upright. Link could feel heavy armour tightly wrapping around parts of his body, his legs were clad in some baggy thin trousers, other parts were exposed to the dry, hot breeze of the desert. However this breeze seemed to harm him less, as if he were just tuning it out like an annoying sound or the bobbing of a horse. Link became aware of his hands, now tighly wrapped around the end of a greatsword's hilt, he continued to take in the sensations from around himself...

"Buliara? Are you feeling well?" A powerful, authoritative, delicate voice questioned.


"Y-yes, Chief," Link quickly respond, "Excuse me," The legendary hero quickly began to exit to the right of the throne room.


Quickly, trying to regain his composure, Link checks himself. His hair, face and body are all the same, it seemed that the armour had adjusted to your form rather than your form adjusting to fit it.

"Buliara? Buliara?" Riju's voice echos down the corridor towards Link... Beginning to realizing the extent of his crime: the abandonment of 'his' duties and leaving the chief vulnerable, Link began to search for a way out of this impossible scenario...
115332222222122122222212.title: Life Swap: The Awkward Awakens

11533222222212212222222.content: [AN: Three branches were cut off prematurely due to confusion over which branch of the story this took place on ("100 Years Ago" vs "After the game?"). It was believed that those characters did not exist yet, due to the story taking place 100 years before the events of the game, however, the chapters were on the branch for the story taking place after the events of the game. Those characters available to choose here. If you do not wish for Link to choose to swap with either of these three characters, choose More Choices]
11533222222212212222222.title: More Choices

115332222222122122222221.content: Who does Link choose to swap with?
115332222222122122222221.title: Paya/Riju/Buliara

1153322222221221222222211.content:
Link ultimately decided to swap not with Zelda, but with Paya, the granddaughter of the Sheikah Elder Impa. While he had gotten to know Zelda quite well, even after his memories had been erased by the Shrine of Resurrection, he didn't really know Paya all too well. She seemed incredibly shy around him, and even after Calamity Ganon had been defeated, she always seemed so busy. Perhaps this wand could help him get to know her better.

But how exactly could he do that? What could he swap that could allow him to get to know her better? He wasn't too concerned about doing something that might frighten or upset her, as the wand would make it so only he was aware of what had changed, but he wasn't sure what the wand could really do for him in this situation. Maybe he should just try a body swap? It might be a bit awkward to get used to at first, with him being a man and Paya being a woman, but he thought he might be able to learn a bit by just going through Paya's daily routine himself.
1153322222221221222222211.title: Paya

1153322222221221222222212.content:
Link ultimately decided not to swap with Zelda. She'd been through a lot, and it didn't feel right to do this to her without her knowledge. However, thinking about swapping with her, and potentially becoming a girl because of it, reminded him of the time he'd had to dress up as a girl to get into Gerudo town. He'd had to walk around in fear of his manhood being discovered, and being thrown out. He was already considering swapping with a girl, so it might be nice to see what it was like to walk around Gerudo Town without having to dress up as something he wasn't.

Who should he swap with, though? The first person to stick out in his mind was Riju, the chief of the Gerudo. She had helped him calm the Divine Beast Vah Naboris, so he remembered her clearly. Obviously the chief of the Gerudo would have no issues getting around Gerudo Town, right? Of course, while Hyrule had been devastated by Calamity Ganon, Gerudo Town had not, and was still flourishing to this day. Swapping with Riju, depending on what exactly he decided to swap, could mean taking on her responsibility as chief. Perhaps it would be better to swap with someone else.

Trying to think of who else he could remember from the Gerudo, Link remembered Riju's personal guard, Buliara. She had been rather suspicious of Link from the get go, and remained as such even after Naboris had been calmed. Maybe he could get back at her using the wand. Of course, Buliara had her duties as well, namely guarding Riju. However, guarding one ruler probably wasn't too different from guarding another, and Link had already guarded Zelda for quite a while now. Maybe she would be a good candidate?

Try as he might, Link struggled to recall anyone else from Gerudo town. Sure, he could be just as easily accepted there by swapping with a girl and then heading there, but by swapping with someone who already lived there, he'd not only save himself the trip over there, but he'd also get to be treated like a local. Since he couldn't think of anyone else, Link decided to just choose between these two options, and ultimately decided to swap with...
1153322222221221222222212.title: Riju/Buliara

115332222222122122222222.content:
As he considered who to try out the swap wand on, Link came across a peculiar thought; did he actually need to choose a specific person to swap with? Perhaps he could be a bit more vague about it, choosing a random person in a given area, of near a given place. Would the wand allow that? There was only really one way to find out; to try it, and he had the perfect idea in mind.

He and Zelda had gotten fairly close over their time together after Ganon had fallen, but he couldn't help but wonder what Zelda really thought of him, the kind of stuff she wouldn't say to his face. If he approached her as someone else, he might be able to find that out. All he'd really have to do was try swapping with someone near Zelda, and speak to her.

It seemed like an alright plan, but Link wasn't sure if he wanted this to be the first test of the wand. For one thing, he didn't even know if not specifying an individual as a target would work. Perhaps it would be wiser to first try swapping with someone specific, and leave this idea for another time. There was still a lot of fun that could probably be had from swapping with other people, after all.
115332222222122122222222.title: More Choices

1153322222221221222222221.content:
Link decided that regardless of his doubts, he was going to try to swap without naming a specific individual. It seemed like an interesting test, and if he got to better learn what Zelda thought of him, all the better. Since he wanted to actually be the person he was swapping with, so that Zelda would be more inclined to speak about things she wouldn't speak about with him, swapping bodies seemed like the most logical thing to do. He was admittedly a little anxious, preparing to hop into an unfamiliar body without even any idea of whose body he'd be jumping into, but regardless, Link held up the wand, and waved it, thinking about swapping bodies with "someone near Zelda".

The next thing he knew, he was...
1153322222221221222222221.title: Swap with "Someone near Zelda"

choices: Stay as Zelda's horse for now
11533222222212212222222212.content:
After waving the wand, Link suddenly found himself whisked away from Hyrule Castle, and instead looking at an empty road that seemed vaguely familiar, but didn't have any distinguishing features that would allow him to place it in his mental map. Of course, the road wasn't exactly what Link was focusing on right now. Rather, he was focused on what had happened to his body.

His body felt larger, and more muscular, and hunched over to stand on all fours. He had a long, white muzzle extending out from the front of his face, and pale yellow hair fell down in front of his eyes. Something protruded from his rear, and his fingers and toes felt like they'd all been merged into one solid block on the end of each arm or leg. It was clear he was no longer human anymore, and judging by the weight he could feel on his bad, he had a feeling he knew what he'd become.

Link suddenly felt a pair of boots digging into his sides, causing him to let out a whinnying sound. A voice came from behind him. "Come now, we'll never get home if you stop for no reason like this." Link recognised the voice as Zelda's, solidifying his idea about what he'd become. Zelda had apparently been out on the road when he tried swapping, meaning that the only "person" near her was her horse, which Link had now become.

This was certainly not ideal. There was no way he could find out anything from Zelda like this. He couldn't even speak to her. And regardless of his plans, being a horse didn't exactly seem like a fun experience when he could use the wand to become anyone he wanted to be. Speaking of which, since he no longer had any hands to hold the wand it, it was now grasped in his mouth, held firmly between his teeth. It was not the most ideal situation, but he supposed it was better than simply losing the wand altogether.

A whip from the reins tied to his head reminded him that Zelda was still waiting for her horse to move. So as not to anger her while making his decision, Link began to walk forwards, a little uneasy of four legs. Zelda didn't seem to mind the slow pace, however, as he heard no further complaints from his rider. The reins did make things a bit awkward, though. The only way he could use the wand to swap back, or into someone else's body, was to swing his head about, as the wand was in his mouth. However, with Zelda holding the reins, she might try to steady him if he suddenly started moving his head around too much, thereby getting in the way of him waving the wand. Perhaps it would be wise to just ride it out for now, so to speak, and just stay as Zelda's horse until she finally dismounted.
11533222222212212222222212.title: Looking at an empty road

choices: Link ends up back in his own body
Link ends up in someone else's body
Zelda touches the wand before Link can swap
115332222222122122222222122.content:
As much as being a horse didn't seem like a fun idea, especially one that was forced to carry Zelda around, Link decided it would be best to remain as he was for the time being. With Zelda holding his reins, and the wand in his mouth, he wasn't exactly in a good position to swing the wand and thus activate a swap. Instead, he simply kept trotting down the road, with Zelda bobbing along on his back.

The more time he spent in this horse's body, the easier it became for him to handle walking on all fours. Odd as it had been at first, walking around as a horse was beginning to feel strangely natural. Perhaps this was part of the remote's powers. After all, it'd be pretty useless if could give him any body in the world, but he couldn't figure out how to use it. He'd just be stuck floundering around until he managed to swap back or someone else took the wand from him. Instead, the wand seemed to be making is current horse body feel as natural as his own, though he had a feeling he'd never completely get used to it.

Before long, the trees began to part as Zelda guided him along the road, and a town began to make itself visible in the distance. Link recognised it, of course, seeing as it was Hateno Village, where he currently lived. Seeing as the castle was currently still in ruins, Zelda had been living with him for the time being, and must have been returning home after whatever she was doing today. Link began to grow a little nervous, as more people around meant more of a chance of someone noticing the wand, and he also irrationally worried about someone realising it was him inside this horse's body, even though they had no way of figuring it out. However, barely anyone even payed attention to him, instead directing their attention towards his rider, greeting Zelda as she passed.

Before long, they reached Link's house, and Zelda rubbed her hand along Link's equine neck. "Good girl," she said to him, as she got off his back. It was only now that Link realised he was missing a part of his anatomy that he'd had when he was a Hylian. Being turned into a horse had been so overwhelming at first that he hadn't even noticed. That didn't matter now, however. What mattered was that Zelda was off of him, and no longer pulling on his reins. That meant he was free to swing away with the wand, and swap him out of this horse's body.

Unfortunately, before he could do so, another complication presented itself. "Hm? What that you've got there?" Zelda asked, looking curiously at what Link had grasped in his mouth. She'd been tying him to a post so he wouldn't run off when she happened to notice the Swap Wand. Link had to act fast. He wasn't sure how Zelda would perceive the wand suddenly disappearing from her horse's mouth, but she wasn't about to let her take it from him and leave him trapped as her horse. Right now, it mattered little what body he ended up in, he just needed to be someone other than this horse, to make sure Zelda couldn't take it. And so, as Zelda reached out towards his mouth, Link quickly swung his head around, hoping that was enough to activate the swap.
115332222222122122222222122.title: Stay as Zelda's horse for now

choices: Link manages to pull away and swap
Link manages to swap, but with Zelda still holding the wand
Zelda manages to pull the wand out of Link's mouth
1153322222221221222222221223.content: Unfortunately for Link, he was simply not fast enough. As he drew his head back, ready to swing it around and swap his way out of here, Zelda's hand managed to latch onto the end of the wand. Her eyes widened as her mind was filled with the same knowledge he'd obtained upon finding the wand himself. Link knew she'd probably be going mental about finding some magical artefact in her horse's mouth when he got home, and it'd probably be a little more difficult for him to hide it now, seeing as Zelda would probably want to search for it, but he didn't care about that right now. He needed to get out of here. He clenched his teeth harder in an attempt to stop Zelda from taking the wand, and tried to wrench it from her grasp and swing it, not caring who's body he ended up in, as long as it wasn't her horse.
1153322222221221222222221223.title: Zelda touches the wand before Link can swap

choices: More Choices for who to swap with
1153322222221221222222222.content:
For the time being, Link put the idea of a more vague swap out of his mind, deciding that perhaps it would be safer to be more specific with such a powerful magical item. However, he was still curious about testing its limitations. While there were many people he'd met over his journey through Hyrule that he could have chosen to swap with, he couldn't help but wonder whether it worked on those who had already departed.

His mind, of course, immediately jumped to his fallen comrades from 100 years ago, the champions. Revali, the Rito, Daruk, the Goron, Mipha, the Zora, and Urbosa, the Gerudo. They had been his loyal companions and friends, and even after their passing, they's spirits had guided him through the Divine Beasts, and granted him their power to aid in his quest. They were gone now, but perhaps the wand could still reach down into wherever their spirits lay, and swap with them as it could any amongst the living.

Of course, there were four champions to choose from, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, and each very different to Link himself. He'd need to choose one to swap with if he wanted to go through with this, or else decide on a new course of action.
1153322222221221222222222.title: More Choices

11533222222212212222222221.content: Which of the two does Link decide to swap with?
11533222222212212222222221.title: Swap with Revali or Daruk

115332222222122122222222211.content:
Although he had acted somewhat arrogant towards him, Link still thought of Revali as a friend. However, he also thought that the prideful bird-man could do with being taught a lesson; something he could now do with the Swap Wand. But what should he swap with him?

The obvious first choice was to swap bodies, but although Link was interested in becoming a Rito, there were certain things that could go wrong.

For one thing; Rivali was still just a spirit right now, so there was a possibility that Link would end up as an incorporeal ghost, while that arrogant avian would be walking around in his body! And, being a spirit, Link would be unable to use the Wand again to swap back, which would make the change permanent!

Then again, it could be that it would only swap 'physical' bodies, which would give Link the Rito's physical body and leave Revali as a spirit-version of him!

Of course he could also accomplish the latter by swapping species with Revali, but it might not be quite as much fun.

What did Link choose to swap with Revali?
115332222222122122222222211.title: Revali, the Rito

1153322222222.content: How about the Philips CD-i version of Link, as seen in Link: The Faces of Evil and Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon?
1153322222222.title: CD-i?

11533222222221.content:
And so, CD-i Link was in the Hyrule Castle, smiling like an idiot as he does. "Gee, it sure is boring around here!" he moans, because that is the only thought that is in his diminutive mind.

Suddenly, Gwonam, the "Squadalah!" guy, rides on his magic carpet and lands on the castle's porch. "Link," he says. "Where is King Harkinian?"

"Oh, he went to go get some dinner!" Link says, as he knows what the king always blabs about. "I'm so hungry, I could eat an Octorok!"

"Very well, then. Give him this." Gwonam hands Link a wand.

"What's that?"

"This, Link, is the Swap Wand."

"What's it do?"

Gwonam stares at the "legendary" hero of time, as if he was a complete moron. Granted, he is, but Gwonam says, "It is in the name."

"It wands?"

Gwonam places his hand on his face and begins leaving. "Good-bye." He flies away on his carpet, upset at Link's idiocy.

"Geez, what's his problem?" Link asks himself, completely unaware of his stupidity. He zaps himself with the wand while thinking about...
11533222222221.title: Hell yes!

115332222222211.content: While holding onto the wind, Link has romantic thoughts about Princess Zelda. As he continues reminiscing about her beauty, his "Master Sword" expands in size. He shudders right before he accidentally zaps himself with the Swap Wand. But Link is too distracted to notice that the wand is swapping him with Zelda. In fact, he is so slow that it takes him what feels like an eternity to realize that he...
115332222222211.title: Zelda

Zelda's female head on his male body
