12.content: Which Toon Link shall it be?
12.title: Toon Link

121.content:
It had been 4 days since Link and the pirates set out to find the new Hyrule. Early in the morning, Tetra saw something in the waters a couple meters out.

"Hey Link go check that out!" Tetra called pointing at the object.

Link nodded and got on the King of Red Lions and headed over to the object. Reaching it, he pulled it up with the boat's hook. Coming up was a large chest, which took half of the boat's space.

"What could be that big?" Link thought.

Curiously, Link opened up the chest expecting some bombs or rupees. Instead, he saw a white stick at the bottom of it.

"Another Wind Waker?" He questioned.

Reaching in and picking it up, Link learned a burst of knowledge on the wand. He knew what it was and how it worked. Smiling, he pocketed it and started heading back to the ship. Climbing onto the deck, he saw Tetra waiting there with her arms crossed.

"What did you find?" she asked.

"Just some empty chest." Link lied.

Before Tetra could respond, Link quickly went down into he ship and into his room. Pulling the wand out, he thought of what could do.

What does he do?
121.title: Wind Waker

13.content: Some more characters to find the wand
13.title: More Choices

131.content: Was she in her original Zelda form or was she in the form of the pirate girl Tetra
131.title: Toon Zelda

choices: Tetra uses the wand on herself
Tetra uses the wand on Link
1312.content:
Tetra lifted a chest onto the table in her cabin after getting it from her latest pirate raid.

"They were pretty protective of whatever was in this," Tetra muttered to herself as she opened the chest.

Inside was a small wand that looked like something a child would play with it.. When she picked it up to examine it, however, she felt a sudden influx of knowledge of what she had uncovered: the Swap Wand, a magical item that could bend the very fabric of reality.

"Whoa! I just hit the motherload!!" Tetra exclaimed as she realized she held the Swap Wand in her hand. "I can literally get anything I want! Now, what to use it for."
1312.title: Tetra gets the Swap Wand

132.content:
It was a beautiful in the kingdom of Hyrule, and Princess Zelda was walking through the garden. As she did, she suddenly noticed something that looked like a strange stick lying on the ground. Curious about what it was doing there, she reached down to pick it up, and as she touched it, her mind was instantly filled with knowledge on what it really was. What appeared to be an ordinary stick at first, this was actually the legendary Swap Wand! With it, she could twist the very fabric of reality itself by swapping things between anyone she wanted! She smirked as she considered all the possibilities.

Now, who would her first victim be?
132.title: Zelda

choices: Swap her status as princess with Link
1321.content:
She decided that she would use it on Link first. But the question is, what would she swap?

Thinking about it, one thing she could swap with him was her status as the princess of Hyrule. She liked it, but sometimes, the life of a princess was just so suffocating. She just wanted some freedom and time away for a bit, and with the wand, she could take a break by swapping her status with someone else, and then when she was ready, swap back. Not only would it give her some time away from being princess, it might be funny to see how the swap would work, giving Link the status as Hyrule's princess.

Something else she could do was swap Link's life with someone else. It might be funny to see him act as if he were someone else. Maybe even with her, which would get her the break she might also want.
1321.title: Link

choices: Zelda decides to find someone else to use the wand on
13211.content:
Zelda made her decision, focused on the change she wanted, and waved the wand, and there was a flash of light. There, it was done. She had switched her social position with Link. Now, Link would rule over Hyrule as its princess for her, while in exchange for such a swap, Zelda would be the hero. She hadn't changed anything else, though; they both kept their original body and mind.

As the flash of light died down, Zelda swa that she was no longer in the castel's garden, but instead right outside the town. She then looked down at herself, and saw that she was now garbed in Link's usual green tunic, and his hat on her head. On her back was his shield and sword, and the rest of his possessions.

"Well, this is a surprise." she said, taking in her change of location and attire. "I guess that swap did a bit more of a change than I expected. I guess I'm the hero now."
13211.title: Swap her status as princess with Link

choices: Yes, Ruto the something other than a Princess

13211211.title: Prince Link is a Crossdresser

choices: Zelda uses the wand to give him her mannerisms and taste in clothing.
To explain, or to play innocent?
132112111.content:
"I should see how Link is doing in my place." muses Zelda. "After all, I am giving him quite the prestigious role in society." With that, she mounts her horse and rides for Hyrule castle.

The castle is bustling with activity as always and Zelda is waved through the gate after only a moments' inspection. "Hero! As always, it is good to see you!" says the gate-guard. "Perhaps you can talk some sense into our princess!"

Zelda's brow wrinkles. "Whatever do you mean, talk some sense into the princess?"

The guard looks confused right back, shrugging helplessly. "He seems struck by strange notions. I'm sure you'll hear all about it if you go anywhere near his quarters."

Curiosity piqued, Zelda stables her horse and enters the castle. Sure enough, as she approaches her old chambers the sounds of strenuous argument can be heard. Zelda decides to listen in at the door.

"But m'lady, you can't possibly be seen in such a state!"

"What are you talking about? I'm not wearing a dress and that's final!"

"But princess..."

"Stop calling me that! I'm a guy, aren't I?"

"Well, yes, of course, but what does that have to do with you being princess? Princess, where are you going?"

The door slams open and Zelda jumps back: out strides Link, wearing nothing but a bedsheet. "Zelda! There you are! Something strange has happened: everyone thinks I'm you..." His words draw to a halt as he looks at her, garbed in his clothes. "...and apparently you, me. What's going on here?"
132112111.title: Fairest and most ladylike of princes.

choices: But this is such a fine joke!
1321121112.content: Will Zelda explain herself and ask him to play along, or will she play innocent?
1321121112.title: To explain, or to play innocent?

choices: Link goes back to get dressed
13211211121.content:
With a sly smile, Zelda holds up the Swap Wand. "Well, I found this."

"What is that?" The concern clearly showed in his voice, suspecting that Zelda was the cause of this.

"This is the Swap Wand. It allows me to swap things between people with just a wave of the wand."

"So you did this?! You swap our lives or something?"

"Yep."

"Well swap us back!"

"And why would I do that? Maybe I want to see what it's like to be the hero for a while."

"I don't want to be a princess though!" Link reaches for the wand, but Zelda holds it out of his reach. Normally Link would have had no trouble trying to get it off Zelda, but one of his hands was currently occupied in keeping the bedsheet he was wearing from falling.

"Now now princess," Zelda said in a mocking tone. "I don't think you're in any position to make any demands. Right now I'm in control, and you're going to go back into your room and get dressed. If you're a good little princess, I might even let you be the hero again, eventually. Or perhaps you'd rather be my faithful steed and let Princess Epona rule for a while."

Link's eyes go wide at the thought of having to live the life of a horse, but it was clear he was thinking about whether to give up or not. He didn't want the life of a horse, but he didn't want the life of a princess either. Zelda found it amusing to see Link so powerless before her. If Link tried to grab the wand again, she wouldn't have any objections to giving Hyrule and equine princess for a while, and riding Link through the vast fields. But if he was obedient, seeing him all dressed up in your clothes should be amusing enough.
13211211121.title: Honesty is most worthy.

choices: A little more fun on the way
132112111212.content:
Link believed he had caught Zelda off-guard, and reached for the wand again. Unfortunately for him, Zelda was read for him, and with a wave of the wand, Link was whisked away to the stables, and instead, Link's horse Epona stood in front of Zelda, the bedsheet draped over her back.

"Hey Epona," Zelda said to Epona, stroking her mane to try and calm her down, as she seemed a bit agitated from suddenly appearing here. "Sorry about this. Link's been a bit disobedient, so I thought he could learn a thing or two from being treated like a horse for a while. Are you okay with being the princess of Hyrule until then?"

Epona moved her head up and down, seemingly understanding what you had said and agreeing. Zelda kind of wondered whether Epona was aware of the previous swap as well, or whether she thought Link had always been a princess, but it didn't really matter at this point. "Thanks! Now, if you go back into the room, an attendant there should help you with everything." Zelda held the door open for her, and Epona headed inside. Now that that was all sorted out, Zelda headed down to the stables to check on Link, ignoring the one-sided conversation the attendant was having with Princess Epona.
132112111212.title: Link continues to protest

choices: Zelda rides Link around Hyrule Field
1321121112121.content:
At the stables, it wasn't to hard for Zelda to find her new mount. Amongst the other horses stood Link, an unimpressed look on his face, completely naked save for a saddle strapped to his back.

"You brought this on yourself, you know," she said as she led him out of the stables.

"Right, because I was just supposed to accept being a princess," he replied, sounding rather grumpy. "I guess that'd be better than being a horse."

"Oh, so you want to be a princess now, do you?" Link just glares at her. "Well, it's a bit too late for that. If you're a good horse, maybe you'll get to be a princess again. Then you can work your way back to being the hero."

"You know, this wand has turned you into a real b-"

Link was interrupted by Zelda hopping up onto the saddle on his back. He also most balance, but managed to stay standing. "A little warning next time, please."

"Oh? And when was the last time you warned Epona before you got up on her?" Link just grumbled in response. "Now come on, we have places to go."
1321121112121.title: At the stables

13211211121212.content:
"How do you expect me to run around with you sitting on my back?" Link asked, clearly not happy with the situation.

Zelda simply slapped his side and said, "You're a horse now, figure it out yourself. Let's go!"

Link wasn't going to put up with that, and quickly rocked backwards, knocking Zelda off of his back.

"Hey!" Zelda yelled, getting up off the ground and dusting herself off. "You'd better be careful about what you do, Link. I can do more than just make people treat you like a horse."

"Oh yeah, like what?" Link asked, a bit sick of how Zelda was treating him, and not particularly caring about how he treated her anymore.

"Well, if you're having troubles carrying me around with your own body, maybe you should have a horse's body. That should make it easier for you, won't it?"

"Or maybe you should leave the carrying to actual horses instead of forcing me to do it?"

Zelda frowned. She didn't like Link's backtalking and attitude right now, seemingly oblivious of how mean she was currently being. Raising the Swap Wand once more, she decided on a suitable punishment for Link.
13211211121212.title: Link is still uncooperative

choices: Link can only make horse noises in response
Link still has his own voice
132112111212121.content:
After the swap, it was hard to tell that what stood in front of Zelda had ever been Link. From just looking at it, it appeared to be Link's horse, Epona, but Zelda knew better. She knew it was Link's mind inside the body of the horse. Smiling at her handiwork, Zelda put the wand away again.

Meanwhile, back at the castle, the now Princess Epona was caught a bit off guard as during the middle of her royal attendant helping her get dressed, her body was suddenly transformed into Link's, although the attendant didn't seem to notice anything wrong. She smiled, thinking to herself that Link must have been even more uncooperative with Zelda. Being human felt interesting, although she wasn't sure she liked being male.

Zelda approached the now equine Link, running her hand along his neck. "There, isn't that better? Now you should have no problems running around with me on your back."
132112111212121.title: Swap Link's body with Epona's

choices: Link lets Zelda ride him for now
Link continues to resist being Zelda's steed
1321121112121212.content:
Squirming awkwardly in his new equine body, Link said, "You couldn't have at least swapped me with a male horse?"

"Oh, you can still talk?" Zelda asked, a little surprised that Link still had his own voice after the swap. "Well, I suppose I'll let you keep that for now." Once again, she hopped up on Link's back, a little easier now that Link was a horse.

Link might have lost his life, and now his body, his mind was still intact, and horse or not, he wasn't about to be some submissive servant of Zelda. Of course, he didn't have the hands necessary to steal and use the wand anymore, but maybe he could at least get it away from Zelda, and maybe convince someone else to swap him back to normal. If worst came to worst, he supposed he could deal with being a talking, female horse for the rest of his life if it meant stopping Zelda's swapping spree.
1321121112121212.title: Link still has his own voice

13211211121212122.content:
Catching Zelda off guard, Link rocked back onto his hind legs, knocking Zelda off his back once more. Link noticed that during the fall, Zelda had dropped the Swap Wand and quickly made a dash for it. Or at least, he would have made a dash for it if he were more used to the horse body he currently possessed. Not being used to being a four legged animal, it made it very hard to Link to move around quickly, and Zelda was able to get the wand back before he could get to it.

"So that's how it's going to be, huh? You really don't want to be my horse," Zelda said, stating the obvious.

"There's no way I'm letting you ride me after everything you've done to me. You'd be better off switching me with Epona and riding her instead."

Zelda thought it over. She didn't want to swap Link's mind or personality. She wanted him as her steed and she wanted him to know he was her steed. Surely there was some other way to punish him for throwing her off his back.
13211211121212122.title: Link continues to resist being Zelda's steed

"Princess, what are you talking about? Is something wrong?" Zelda said, holding back a laugh.

"Zelda, what are you talking about? You're supposed to be the princess! I'm the hero!" Link replied, still very confused.

"You must not be feeling well today Princess. You should probably get some rest."

"But I'm fine! What's wrong with you!"

Perhaps Zelda now wants to make some mental changes to Link?
13211211122.title: But this is such a fine joke!

choices: Zelda can't hold in her laughter any more
132112111222.content:
"Clearly you aren't as fine as you say," Zelda says, still messing with Link and trying to hold in her laughter. "You're the princess, I'm the hero. That's how it's always been."

"But, no... that's not..." Link seemed kind of freaked out, like he was questioning whether he had actually gone crazy or not.

"Maybe you should lie down and get some rest. I should do you good." Zelda tries to put her hand on Link's shoulder, in an attempt to appear reassuring, but Link just shrugs it off.

"No! I'm not a princess, I'm not crazy, something weird is going on here!" he barks back.

"Princess..."

"Don't call me that!"

132112112.content:
"I should see how Link is doing in my place." muses Zelda. "After all, I am giving him quite the prestigious role in society." With that, she mounts her horse and rides for Hyrule castle.

The castle is bustling with activity as always and Zelda is waved through the gate after only a moments' inspection. "Hero! As always, it is good to see you!" says the gate-guard. "Perhaps you can talk some sense into our prince finally!"

Talk some sense into the prince? Zelda frowns slightly. What could they mean by that? But the question is soon answered, as Zelda finds herself greeted in the courtyard by none other than the prince of Hyrule, Link, resplendent in a gown of shimmering pink and white silk. It is all Zelda can do not to laugh.

"What's so funny?" Link asks, hands on his hips. "Is that any way to greet a princess?" His tone is teasing. "I should have them throw yo in the dungeons. I'm sure that would teach you some manners, noble hero."

Zelda dismounts from her horse and joins Link, looking him up and down. Somehow being in feminine garb seems to suit him: despite the deficiencies of his frame he occupies the role so thoroughly that everything about him just screams 'dainty' and 'refined.' "There's no need for that, err, princess. I mean you no disrespect."

Link nods, mollified. "Very well, then. It is good that you are here, hero. You see..."

132232211111332.content:
“There is one thing I’d like to discuss, though,” said the Great Fairy, using her hands to support her massive head, which was currently sitting atop Zelda’s body.

“And what might that be?” Zelda asked, sitting on her throne, which was completely covered by the Great Fairy’s massive body.

“Oh, just the fact that we both seem to have mismatched bodies,” said the Great Fairy. “And don’t bother denying anything. I could sense the power of the Swap Wand from the Fairy Fountain.”

“I see,” said Zelda. She took out the Swap Wand, which seemed so incredibly tiny in the Great Fairy’s hands. “So, you’re aware of the swaps?”

The Great Fairy laughed. “Of course I am. I’m a being of pure magic, after all.”

Zelda nodded her tiny head. “So, what exactly would you like me to do about this situation?”

“Well, the way I see it, there are a few ways to solve this,” said the Great Fairy. “You could swap our heads, so that our heads match our current bodies, or you could swap our bodies back, so that both of us are back to normal.”

“I see,” said Zelda.

“If that doesn’t appeal, you could swap our sizes,” said the Great Fairy. “Either swap the sizes of our bodies, or swap the sizes of our heads.”

Zelda nodded, then raised the Swap Wand and waved it.

What sort of swap did Zelda perform?

Zelda let out a small sigh as she waved the wand. She felt it was a shame to completely put everything back to normal so soon, but if the Great Fairy could see the swaps, it would be difficult for Zelda to deny swapping back without the Fairy causing a fuss. All she could really do was swap back, and then decide on a different target, one that wouldn't be able to see the changes.

Of course, things didn't exactly work out that way. As soon as the swap occurred, Zelda felt somewhat off-balance, as if there were a large weight strapped to her head, and looking up at the Great Fairy, it wasn't difficult to tell why. The Great Fairy's head was back on her body, but it seemed incredibly small in comparison. Reaching up to feel her face, Zelda could only feel something small touching her chin, speaking volumes of the difference in size between her head and her hand. It seemed that, just as in the first swap, the sizes of their heads had been retained. So thanks to Zelda's previous swap, which had made their heads properly sized for the bodies they were on at the time, they were now OK n the opposite situation of what they'd been in when the Great Fairy came in; now Zelda had a head too big for her body, while the Great Fairy had one that was too small. The only difference now was that despite their heads not being the right sizes, they did have the correct bodies now.

"Oh my," Zelda mumbled, her hand still feeling around her overly large face, while her other hand fiddled with the wand.

"Perhaps you shouldn't have swapped the sizes of our heads first," the Great Fairy suggested, holding up her hand to see how large her body appeared to be with her smaller head.

Zelda thought about her first use of the Swap Wand. “I want to be able to roam outside the palace, of course, but I don’t know if I would want to switch with another person. I’d be forcing that person to live a life he/she doesn’t want. If this worked on animals, like say that horse Epona…”

After the flash died down, Zelda found herself in the middle of a corral of horses. Before she could ask what happened, she got a good look at herself.

She was standing in the middle of the corral completely naked, with her hair out of its bindings and flowing freely past her shoulders. Attached to her back was a saddle that was designed so she could run on two legs.

How did Zelda react to these changes?

132311.content:
When finding out that they were standing naked in a corral of horses, most women would have started screaming and panicking.
Fortunately, Zelda was not "most woman" and had gotten proper manners drilled into her since before she could walk. Having been taught that princesses always acted calm and elegant under pressure, Zelda opted for the second alternative: panicking inside her own head.
After what felt like a hour her thoughts running a hundred miles a second, hyperventilating and internal screaming, Zelda started to calm down and think about this rationally. In hindsight it was pretty obvious what had happened, she had thought about swapping lives With Epona and the wand, taking her literally, had fulfilled her wish.
"This means that the wand really works!" Zelda cheered, all pretense of being a lady forgotten.
She sat down and twirled the wand in her hands, "though i wonder what i should do now?"
132311.title: A Lady Never Freaks out.

choices: The swap wand is still there.
1323111.content:
Well, hopefully no one is aware of the swap, Zelda thought as she continued fiddling with the wand. Perhaps it would be best if she swapped back into her own life, as there was no way a horse could perform all the duties she had to on a regular basis. But then again, considering the wand’s incredible power, it would hopefully alter things to allow Epona to do everything Zelda had to do as Princess of Hyrule. She supposed there wouldn’t be too much harm in letting Epona live Zelda’s life, at least for a short time.

“Epona! Feeding time!” a woman’s voice called out, interrupting Zelda’s train of thought.

“I’ll be right there,” Zelda tried to call out. However, a loud neigh came out of her mouth instead, and Zelda clapped her hands over her mouth and blushed in embarrassment. Once she got over her initial shock, Zelda realised that, since Epona couldn’t speak, neither could she, now that she was Epona.

Zelda quickly hid the wand amidst the bedding in the stable, then walked out towards the voice that had called her. Leaving the stable, she saw a young woman with red hair, wearing a blue dress and carrying a large bucket full of oats. Presumably, this was Malon, the woman who had raised Epona since she was a foal.

Malon was pouring the bucket of oats into a feeding trough as Zelda walked up to her.

“There you go,” said Malon as she finished emptying the bucket. “Eat up.”

Zelda wasn’t particularly interested in eating horse food, but she knew Malon would become suspicious if she didn’t eat, so she picked up a handful of food and ate it gingerly. To her great surprise, it actually tasted quite good, and Zelda began eating with much more enthusiasm. She initially tried to eat in a fashion that was appropriate for a woman of her station, before she remembered that she technically wasn’t a woman at all, and simply began shovelling more food into her mouth. Zelda was somehow able to eat all the food in the trough, which was slightly surprising. It was probably the amount of food Epona normally ate in one sitting, though, which would explain how she could eat it all.

“Good girl,” said Malon, patting Zelda’s side as she finished the last of her food. Zelda whinnied in response, and Malon smiled.

“Now, off you go,” Malon said. “I’ve got to feed the other animals now.”

Zelda whinnied again, and Malon walked off to grab another bucket full of food. Zelda walked back to the stable, and rummaged through the bedding in her stall until she found the swap wand.
1323111.title: Enjoy life as a horse for a bit.

choices: She gets the message that Link is asking for an adience.
One of her maids enters the office.
1323112.content:
For the next hour Zelda explored her freedom, running through the corral to her heart’s content. But despite all the running, there was one thing Zelda could not escape: she was bored. Since she was a teenager her life had been dominated by lessons and work, and it was there that the former princess felt most comfortable. Traveling around Hyrule
With a huff, Zelda sat down on the floor of her stable, once again twirling the wand in her hands. “As a princess, can I allow myself to be so irresponsible as to leave them in the care of a horse?” She slapped herself on the cheek. “Of course not, the people of Hyrule’s happiness must always come before my own.”
With newfound purpose Zelda rose to her feet and swung the wand, “I want to be the princess again!”
After the bright flash had died down, the woman saw to her happiness that she was back in her cozy office and her usual clothes with the familiar furniture and paperwork to keep her company.
"I think this thing better be kept somewhere safe for the time being," Zelda murmured, putting the wand in a hidden section of her desk. For the next minutes she just sat there, enjoying the feeling of normalacy and the knowledge that the wand was somewhere safe.
"But maybe it would be best not to keep it locked away, but rather use it for the good of Hyrule?" The bearer of the triforce of wisdom wondered, toying with all the idea of all the things she could do with the wand.
1323112.title: Swap back.

132312.content:
Zelda looked at herself, then at the wand in her hand. “Did this actually do something?” she thought to herself. “I could’ve sworn I wanted to switch lives with Princess Epona, so why didn’t it work?”

“Zelda!” she heard Malon, her caretaker from when she was a foal call. “Feeding time!”

“I’ll be right there!” Zelda called back, quickly heading back to the stables to hide the Swap Wand in her stall before running to meet Malon to eat her dinner of oats.

What Zelda didn’t realize was that the Swap Wand had indeed swapped her life with Epona’s, but they didn’t know anything was wrong. For all she knew, Zelda was a horse, raised by Malon and also serving from time to time as Link’s steed. She also saw Epona as the Princess of Hyrule, living in the castle she’d only visited from time to time with Link.

All those thoughts were pushed aside, however, as Zelda ate her dinner, then pooped and peed in the corral, all without feeling ashamed of her nudity. After her business was done, she walked back in the stable and grabbed the Swap Wand again. “I wonder if it only works on other people, and I can’t just alter myself.”
132312.title: Zelda's Life as a Horse

choices: The Swap Wand was still there.
1323122.content:
Zelda yawned, “It's late,” she told herself. “I can try the wand again in the morning.” She slept standing up, nude in her stall, wondering what the next day would bring.

Zelda woke up the next day, “Alright, now to see if I was right about the Swap Wand.” She looked in the Swap Wand's hiding place and-
1323122.title: Zelda waits some more

13233.content:
Zelda quickly reasserted herself. She was the princess of Hyrule, and the holder of the Triforce of Wisdom. Although it would be tempting to joke around with such a powerful item, she couldn't help but recognise the advantages she could gain from the Swap Wand as well.
Being a member of the royal family meant that much of her time was spent discussing with various politicians, both native and delegations of the other Hyrulean races. Oftentimes she felt agreements with races like the Zora or the Gorons took too long to be settled due to a lack of understanding of the mores and values in each other's culture and society. But even where her own people were concerned, Zelda often had nagging doubts. She'd lived in the palace her whole life, in the lap of luxury with servants at her every beck and call. Who was she to know what the common people valued? What they most had need of?
If she were to use the Swap Wand to place herself in another race's place, she could gain firsthand insight in how to better get along with them. Likewise, if she were to walk a mile through the shoes of a commoner, it could help her see what smaller matters she could improve on, rather than shoving them aside in favour of a more holistic view.
This wand presented the opportunity of a lifetime. She could find out what was on the mind of other people and use that knowledge to improve her reign as a princess. Surely that took precedence over any little fun she could have with the wand? (Not that said fun couldn't come afterward...)
The more she considered it, the better an idea it became. She was quickly determined to go through with it. But which could gain the most immediate insight? Becoming of another race? Or becoming a commoner of her own people?
13233.title: someone else

132332.content: Getting out of her ivory tower would be beneficial to becoming more in tune with her people's demands, and secure a better reign for her. A commoner she would become then. But would she explore this new life through the eyes of someone she knew? Or a stranger?
132332.title: commoner

1323322.content: The thought of Zelda living one of her friend's lives, even if to better her governing skills, made her uneasy. She didn't want to breach their privacy, not when she'd later be reminded of it every time they came together afterwards. Better to pick someone she had no real relation with. But who would be the lucky person then?
1323322.title: complete stranger

choices: Follow Zelda's life as a beggar.
See how the new princess holds up.
13233221.content:
Zelda tucked the Swap Wand away in a sleeve of her dress and had some soldiers escort her to Hyrule Market. As they went by the stalls, her eyes scoured over the people's faces, looking for someone fitting for this experiment. She didn't know how to be a merchant, so they were out of the question for now. And she didn't feel like ripping two lovers apart by taking one of them's place, or like taking one of the playing children's youth for herself.
Suddenly she saw her. Tucked away close by the stalls, a demure woman sat dressed in rags with a cup in front. A pauper. One of her subject's who, despite Zelda's best efforts, did not get cared enough for to live a good life. The princess felt uneasy about what she was planning to do, but who better to teach her what funds and facilities needed to be improved than a person who required them the most? Besides, she definitely deserved to get pampered for a change.
Zelda fired the Swap Wand at her with the intent to swap lives, and just like that her whole world changed in an instant.
The first thing she became aware of what that she now sat on the hard ground of the street. Next she noticed her clothes. No more was she dressed in the finest silk the crown could buy. Her new outfit was a meager thing that just served to cover her up and provided no further comfort. The fabric had holes, did not retain any warmth and it itched and chafed all over her body. Her body which, she noticed, had also changed.
For someone so accustomed to regular baths, it shocked Zelda to see how dirty she now was. Covered head to toe in dust, mud and other assorted filth. A stench emanated from her, strong enough to force her to breathe through her mouth for a few minutes. And she was unkempt. Her nail, both on hands and feet, were black with dirt and cracked in several places. Her limbs had hair growing all over it, which she'd normally shave off on a daily basis. And the hair on her head, no longer perfectly styled, now clung together in various dirty clumps. She didn't even dare consider what her face must look like, although the sudden toothache she became aware of was probably a good indication of how bad she could expect it to be.
But the biggest change was probably how small she now was. Her entire body was notably thinner, and not in a good way. She could easily wrap her hand around her upper arm now, and for some reason she felt a good head shorter than she'd been before the swap. Her stomach had also become a constant growling, as if someone had ripped a great hole within her.
She looked up at where the ex-pauper should be and saw her, dressed in her beautiful dress, with her skin completely clean and her hair expertly done. She also seemed prettier, taller and fuller than before. Zelda understood immediately, for her mind had not at all diminished: they had swapped lives, and currently Zelda was as she would have been in a life where every day was a struggle to survive.
Zelda watched as her former soldiers guided the new princess back to the castle. That was it then. Sooner or later the new princess would come back for another stroll to the market, but until then Zelda would live her hard life to better learn how to improve her situation once she sat back on the throne. She clenched her hand around the Swap Wand. At least that hadn't been exchanged, it firmly remained with her. She would guard it with her life until the time came to switch back, but for now she had other priorities. A fisherman on the otherside of the river had disappeared, replaced with a Zora emerging from the water, but he still looked liek the fishman, kind of. Which reminded Malon of the fish people one of her customers had once told her about.
It was at this time Zelda returned, still in a handmaidens outfit, and she still looked the same.
"I've finished my duties Princess Malon," Zelda said, bowing to her, "And I have laid today's eggs, is there anything else I can help with?"
Malon was stunned, "You, laid an egg?"
Zelda nodded, "Yes, I don't know why, but lay eggs like a cucco," Malon lost a shade in her face.
Zelda looked worried, "Are you feeling okay, Princess."
"I'm fine," Malon told her, "I would like to go to castle town."
"Yes, Princess," Zelda said, bowing before leaving, "I will assemble a small guard for you."
Malon was puzzled, she had been to castle town before, it wasn't dangerous, "Why?"
"I know you trained with a sword Princess, but we still need a guard, for safety," Zelda had turned back to address her princess, and turned away to do as she promised.

Malon looked around, at this time, she couldn't see anything else that had changed, and the wand was calm now, it had it's wood colour and was a cool temperature that couldn't be felt though her glove. The power could still be felt, flowing strong though the wand and in Malon's hand.
The Cucco that Malon presumed that had been accidentally swapped with Zelda waddled up to her, and Malon picked her up, and stroked it, making it cluck happily.

Zelda returned, she had three guards with her, and she herself had a sword in her arms, which she presented to Malon. The Guards were of varying heights and build, all of them bigger than Link, except one. Despite all the guards wearing the same armour, one of had been swapped. One of guards had his body swapped with the gardener, and now was a smaller body, not as muscular but was wearing a full suit of armour and heavy weaponry.
"Are you ready to go, Princess Malon?"
Malon pondered a second
1332322212121.title: Malon mixed up Hyrule

13323222121211.content:
Malon and her entourage made their way to castle town
While Malon loved having such a comfort and attention from trained guards, the heavily armed guards that were seen all around hyrule adding a layer of security and safety. But she was beginning to see why being a princess wasn't so good, she wasn't going to be alone very much which made her realise that she had made her self a target. She was now important and was wanted by her nation, a symbol of hope and leadership and now would be a target if someone wanted to attack hyrule, and all that made her appreciate it more. To Malon, it was amazing to feel so beloved and known by the entire nation.

But before they all started walk, Zelda reached out and took the cucco from Malon's arms, "Princess, an animal will dirty your dress and could damage it. It won't reflect well on you, if the people of hyrule say you in disarray."
The cucco started to panic and flapped hard, knocking it's self out of handmaiden Zelda's arms, and glided to Malon.
"I wish to keep it," Malon said trying to be assertive, as she continued to stroke the cucco.
Zelda sighed, "If that is what you want, but please be careful with your appearance," and she slightly held the cucco, and moved her to the floor.

When they got into the the town, a lot of the crowd had turned to her, and bowed, causing Malon to blush with a large smile and she started to wave back to everyone. Everyone began to resume their day, but moving out the way to give Malon and her guards, as they started to move around.
Malon had seen all these shops before, each one was unique and very welcoming, but how would they be with a surprise visit from a princess?

She saw the bombchu bowling shop, she remembered going in there once after saving up for months, and it was a blast, terrifying but exhilarating. She walked towards it, as Zelda started to protest.
She walked inside, and to the keepers astonishment, the Princess of Hyrule had entered their shop.
The sleepy owner was wide awake.
"It is an honour to have you my majesty," she said but it was little gravelly.
"Sorry, Sorry, sorry." Zelda apologised frantically as she grabbed Malon, and pulled her back, "A princess can't pay such a dangerous barbaric game."
Zelda pushed Malon though the door.
"I am terribly sorry, Ma'am," Zelda says as she leaves the shop.

Malon frowned, and moved on, walking ahead of her guard, but Zelda and the others caught up a few seconds later.
She then moved over to the Bazaar, a good place for general good.
"Wait," came a female voice from the guards,"Let me in first, I know this guy, I don't want them to disrespect you, my Highness."
He Said as Malon wathced the smaller guard walk into the building. A loud snap could be heard.
"I believe we can enter, Princess," Zelda said prompting Malon to walk in.
Malon Stepped in, the large figure of the man running the stall towered over her.
"OH, Princess Malon, It is such an Honour to have you here!" He said quite cheerly, "Is there ANY thing I can do for you?" He asked almost pleading to help.
"Princess, what is it you wanted from here? Everything here is already provided and stocked at the castle."
Malon looked around, nothing was of importance, and left.
Zelda stayed back a bit, bowed, "Thank you for your time."
"Come back whenever."

Malon walked around not feeling to happy, then reflected on the wand she was holding.
"What else happened...?" She asked her self
"It swapped two of the royal staffs bodies
My Combat training
Zelda's reproduction with a Cucco
Some shop keepers personalities
Whatelse?" She asked her self
"Whatelse what your majesty," Asked one of the bigger guards.
Malon blushed, was she speaking out loud the whole time, obviously the guards didn't hear all of it, but what about Zelda, she was closer.
"What else could we do here, I don't want to return to the castle yet."
"You Highness, we should return soon," Said the now-female guard.
Malon turned to Zelda, who seemed to be lost in thought, as she glared though the crowd towards the treasure chest shop.
13323222121211.title: Into castle town

133232221212112.content:
Malon and her entourage continued to move on while being directed by her guard home, Malon naturally defied them and tried going her own way. But in doing this, she ran into someone, directed.
Malon wasn't looking forward and walked into someone. She felt her shoulder pushing into someone, but they stood their ground and slowed Malon until she noticed and turned around. Malon had her face buried in some green clothing covering a well toned chest, and she tilted her head up to see a familiar face, her heart flew as she looked upon his face, it was Link. The young Hylian that Malon met years ago, but never forgot and developed feeling for as he visited more and more.
"Be careful where you are being Princess," He said, smiling at Malon.
Malon blushed and was lost for words "Hi Link."
Link look over to Zelda, and said warmly, "Hello Zelda,"
Zelda looked his way, "Good day, Link."
As he looks around he flinches at the Cucco by Malon's side, but after seconds of observation, calmed a little and asked, "What brings you down here, Princess Malon?"
It as this point, where Malon was only half playing attention, "I just felt like coming here." The object of her affection was right here, and the wand was in her hand.
There was an awful lots she could do. Then curiosity over came, as he eyes glanced down a little to his mid region. "It's not like he'd notice, and it would make us perfect for each other." Malon quickly flicked the wand in a circle down by her side, then in an instant, she felt something between her legs being constricted by her clothing. Malon almost giggled, she had a special piece of Link attached to her body.
"Well, it must be dangerous for a Princess to be here, so open and crowded."
"Yeah, but, I have my royal knights here, I will be fine," Malon smiled, thinking of have Link around more often, having heard of his previous feats of power and intelligence.
"You'd be a lot safer with me around," Link said warmly, adding a friendly expression, giving a light laugh setting Malon of into her own laugh.
Malon felt something stir in her nether region. her face dropped and started to feel panic, she couldn't look down but with a straining she knew she had to get out of there.
"I need to be going back to the castle now, bye Link."Malon quickly turned and sped off as her troop tried to follow after her back up to the castle.
"Princess, please slow down," Zelda called out to her as they all ran back. Malon got back to the castle first and ran to princess's room the door slammed close behind her. She walked up to a mirror, where she lifted her dress up. Nestled beneath, smothered by silk undies was a man's package, calming from it's fight for freedom. It was larger than she thought, even in a semi-hardened state. She reach to grab it, it had been an usual day, but this was easily the more surreal, and needed to test if it was happening. Upon touching it, a surge of excitement caused a recoil. A knock interrupted Malon, causng her to drop the hem, as her dress covered her once again.
A second knock came, "Who is it?" Malon asked.
"It's Zelda, Princess," Zelda said as she walked in.
"Princess Malon," She address the confused girl, "Are you feeling okay?"
"I feel fine," Malon replied, she felt great, she was now a princess from a farm girl, with the monarchy as a handmaiden, and with all the power she could want a simple hand twist away.
"You've been acting unusual all day," The former princess stated, "Your mannerisms are more relaxed and formal, and you've been nerous and acting like this is all unfamiliar and new to you."
Oh, really?" Malon asked.
"Perhaps you should rest, Princess," Zelda suggested as she took Malon's hand, and lead her to the bed.
"I can do that, sleep in the middle of the day??" Malon thought to her self, not used to being able to take a break, being a farm girl working from dawn til dusk, "Okay I will do that."
Zelda walked to a wardrobe and picked up a thinner dress, and moved back to Malon. She removed Malon's crown and other accessories and placed them into a box nearby, "Arms up," and Malon put her arms up and Zelda peeled her dress of, glancing right past her crotch bulge but fixed of her chest for a while, which was more impressive without clothes on, and gave Malon a smug, satisfied grin, seeing the effects of her swap taken place. Zelda then pulled the nightie over Malon's head and down, she then turned around and closed the think curtains keeping out the late afternoon sun and left saying "I will get you in time for dinner."
The door closed behind the "handmaiden".
Malon closed her eyes, "I could get used to this," she grinned to herself as she drifted off into a mid day dream.


(Author's note, this storyline is being written with the idea of being in the childhood timeline, just years later when they have all grown up from the point of Link going back in the ending. None of Link's adult feats are known but his feats as a child, saving the goron's from King dodongo and Zora princess from Lord Jabu Jabu and Ganondorf was stopped before he came to more power).
133232221212112.title: They run into Link

1332322212121121.content:
Malon slowly opened her eyes to an unfamiliar room, and a strange feeling between her legs. She momentarily panicked as she looked around the room, slipping a hand beneath the covers of the bed to investigate what was going on under there. As her hands reached the bulge in her panties, it all came back to her. Earlier today, she'd found the Swap Wand, and she was now the princess of Hyrule, while Zelda was her handmaiden. The "unfamiliar room" was Zelda's, now Malon's, bedroom, and the strange feeling between her legs was Link's genitals, which she'd swapped with him earlier. It was still so surreal, but she supposed the fact that she'd gone to sleep and woken up with the changes still in effect went to show it wasn't just a dream.

Seeing as the room was empty, save for Malon herself, Malon got up out of bed, and walked over to the window. Behind the curtain, she could see the sun was just setting. She hadn't slept for too long, probably since she'd tried to sleep in the middle of the day and wasn't really tired, but it probably wasn't time for dinner, as Zelda hadn't come to woke her up.

As she peered out the window, still clothed in the nightgown Zelda had dressed her in, Malon reflected on the events of the day. She'd gone from being a simple farmhand to being the princess of Hyrule, with the former princess serving as her handmaiden. She'd made Zelda attracted to women so that she wouldn't be able to steal Link away from her, a fact that still brought amusement to Malon. The strangest change of the day, from her perspective at least, had almost certainly been the swap she did with Link, however. She still wasn't entirely sure it was a good idea, giving herself a male package while giving her own privates to Link, but at the very least, she didn't want to swap back, still reveling in the oddness of the situation.

Things didn't all go smoothly, however. She had accidentally activated the wand earlier without even thinking, causing a multitude of swaps that were out of her control, ranging from personality swapping to giving Zelda the ability to lay eggs. She knew she'd have to be more careful in the future. The was also the fact that although she now inhabited the princess's life, she hadn't been acting very princess-like, which had spurred Zelda to put her to bed in the first place. Although no one would suspect the truth, that Malon hadn't always been the princess, that didn't change the fact that they would find something odd with her behaviour if she didn't act like Zelda normally would. Although she didn't want to act exactly like Zelda, Malon figured it would probably become a problem if people started thinking she'd gone crazy because of a sudden change in her personality.

Of course, under normal circumstances, Malon would never be able to mimic what Zelda had learned throughout her whole upbringing. These were not normal circumstances, however. Even though Zelda believed she was her former handmaiden, perhaps her old personality still slept somewhere in her subconscious, and Malon could pluck parts out of it that she needed. Of course, she'd want to only take enough to keep up appearances, without giving away too much of her old self. Stepping away from the window, Malon turned to the dresser she'd left the wand on, and found...
1332322212121121.title: Continue with this

1333.content: Other victims Malon can use the wand on.
1333.title: Someone else

13331.content:
As Malon considered who to use the wand on, she had a rather difficult time deciding on who. Most of her customers in town she didn't know too well, or weren't really interesting, and those she did know well were kind of important, and had a job to do. But then, who could she use it on? She looked up at the cows she was feeding, when she hit upon an idea; did the wand also work on animals? And she knew just which animal to test it on.

She ran out to the corral where the horses were being held, and found the young foal named Epona. She was probably Malon's favourite horse, and if Malon was going to try using the wand on an animal, she felt it should be Epona. Although she knew she didn't have to involve herself in the swap, Malon felt it would be appropriate to use herself, considering how much trouble she had deciding on who to swap with in the first place. Now it was just a question of what to swap with her. Maybe she could see what it was like to be a horse by swapping bodies with her.

1333322.title: Someone Else

134.content:
Medli flew around the outskirts of Dragon Roost Island. She had finished her duties for the day and was now free to do as she pleased. After being cooped up in the Earth Temple, praying to ensure that the Master Sword had the power to defeat Ganondorf, she now liked to spend as much time as she could outside. While flying close to the shore, she noticed something had washed up on the beach, and flew down to investigate.

It looked like a message in a bottle, but on closer inspection, there was no message inside. Instead, the bottle contained a strange-looking wand, kind of like the Wind Waker that Link used. She reached into the bottle to pull it out, but the second her fingers touched it, her mind was filled with the knowledge of what it was, and what it could do. A grin formed on her face as she pulled the wand out of the bottle, excited by the possibilities.

"Hm, this could be fun," she said to no one in particular, thinking about who to try it out on first.

Who would her first swap be with?
134.title: Medli

1341.content: The first person Medli thought of was Link. He did have a similar looking wand of his own, after all. Right now he was off with Tetra and her pirate crew, searching for new lands. But what to swap with him. Medli remembered that during their exploration of the Earth Temple, Link had used a song to control her body. Once Link had finished, he'd go back to his own body, and she'd wake up with no recollection of what had happened. She couldn't help but wonder what it would be like to control someone else's body. Link wouldn't mind, right? After all, she had let him use her body, it was only fair. Then again, this wand could do a lot more than that one song Link knew, maybe just swapping bodies was a waste of potential.
1341.title: Link

choices: Try to talk your way out of it
13411.content:
Deciding it was pretty good as a first thing to try out, Medli waved the wand with thoughts of swapping bodies with Link. There was a flash of light, and all of a sudden, she was no longer standing on the beach. Instead, she was sitting inside the cabin of a boat. Looking down at herself, she found that she wasn't really herself anymore. She was wearing the familiar green tunic that she recognised as being Link's. She also notice she now lacked a beak or wings. She must be in Link's body! Was Link in her body now? Did he know about the saw or did he think he'd always been Medli? It was a little difficult to find out since Medli's body was back on Dragon Roost Island, while Medli in Link's body was on a ship somewhere out in the ocean.

Medli would have explored further if not for a tanned hand being waved in front of her face. "Hello? Link? Kinda spacing out there." Turning to see the source of the hand, Medli saw Link's friend, Tetra, looking back at her. Link was probably in the middle of a conversation with her with Medli suddenly took over Link's body. That was going to take a bit of explaining. Or... Medli could feel the Swap Wand still gripped in her hand (or now more accurately, Link's hand). Maybe she could swap Tetra somehow and get out of this.
13411.title: Swap bodies with Link

134112.content:
Medli knew that Tetra was Link's friend, but to her, she was a pirate. And generally, pirates weren't the nicest of people. If Tetra caught on that Medli wasn't actually Link, things might go bad. So, doing the first thing that came to her mind, Medli quickly waved the Swap Wand, which she had been hiding behind her back, switching Tetra's mind for someone else's, like she had done to herself and Link. She didn't really care who got swapped right now, just so long it was someone she knew, one of her friends. She could probably explain all this better to them than she could to Tetra.

Who did Tetra's mind get swapped with?
134112.title: Use the wand on Tetra

choices: Medli gives Link his body back
Medli keeps Link's body for now
1341121.content:
Tetra's seemed to go blank and confused, before she spoke again.

"Huh, I'm back?" However, the second she laid eyes on Medli, who was currently still in Link's body, she let out a small scream and stepping backwards, hitting her leg on Tetra's desk. Upon hearing the voice that came out, she looked at herself and let out another scream. "Again!? What's going on!?"

"...Link?" Medli asked cautiously. Considering whoever was in Tetra's body was talking about this happening "again", Medli assumed it was Link, but she figured she should ask just to make sure.

Link, who was currently the one inside Tetra's body, nodded. "T-Tetra?" he asked in return. It was an okay assumption, that if he was in Tetra's body then Tetra would be in his, but in this case, he was wrong.

Medli shook her head, or more accurately, Link's head. "No, I'm actually Medli."

"Medli? I think I was in your body a couple seconds ago."

"Yeah... that's kind of my fault." Medli did feel a little bad about doing this to link, but she felt the need to be honest in this case.

"You...? How?"

Medli took the time to explain things to Link; finding the wand, swapping with him, and then swapping him with Tetra. The entire time, Link leaned against Tetra's desk, squirming uncomfortably in her body.

"So, it's sorta like the Command Melody?" Link asked when Medli was done.

"Well, sort of. But I can do a lot more with it. It's just that this is all I've done so far."

"So... Can I have my body back now? It's really weird, like I'm talking to myself or something"

Medli considered Link's request. On one hand, she had stolen his body without asking, and then used him to avoid an awkward situation with Tetra. But on the other hand, Link had borrowed her body several times during their trek through the Earth Temple, maybe now it was her turn to change things around. And if she did give Link his body back, that would mean either putting herself in Tetra's body, and in turn becoming the leader of Tetra's pirate crew, or putting everything back to normal, and leaving Link to explain everything to Tetra.
1341121.title: Link

Instead Medli swapping body with Link, they swap their species each other?

13533221.content:
Nabooru lifted a chest onto the table in her room after getting it from a deep dungeon. "Phew! It wasn't easy to get you, but judging from all the traps guarding you, I'll be happy I risked my life for you."

She opened the box and found what looked like a child's toy wand inside. When she picked it up to examine it, however, she felt a sudden influx of knowledge of what she had uncovered: the Swap Wand, a magical item that could bend the very fabric of reality.

"Whoa! I just hit the motherload!!" Nabooru exclaimed as she realized she held the Swap Wand in her hand. "I can literally get anything I want!"

Her thoughts then drifted towards the various people she had met in her life. The one she thought about the most was Link, the boy who she conned into helping her steal from the Spirit Temple and grew up to save her from Twinrova. "Hmm, that Link grew up nicely. He must have had a very exciting life, probably more exciting than mine."

She then thought about her first move with the legendary Swap Wand.

1353322121.content: Nabooru then thought of the possibilities Zelda presented her. "With a simple wave of my wand, I could become the princess of Hyrule. Or even better, I could give her something of mine that would make her look ridiculous; I've always wanted a smaller nose. No, wait! This is perfect. I could switch the princess with one of my Gerudo warriors! To have the princess of the entire kingdom working under me, that'd be a sight to behold!"

She responded politely (Zelda's personality is starting to take over)
135332212111.content:
Without thinking about it thoroughly, Nabooru waved the wand and then blacked out.

When she came to, she found herself in a garden of some kind, just outside a hedge maze. She rubbed her head to get rid of the dizziness she was experiencing before taking a look at herself. Gone was her Gerudo outfit that stood out from the rest. In its place was a purple and white gown with gloves reaching up to her shoulders. Although her figure was still showing with her ensemble, she could tell there was a lot more hidden. She then felt her head and was relieved to find the jewel all Gerudo possessed on their heads, but was shocked to find a tiara and felt her hair flowing down past her shoulders instead of being tied up in a ponytail.

"Princess! Princess Nabooru!!" Nabooru heard the guards yell. She turned to the direction of the sound and saw two guards running up to her. "My princess, the King told you not to wander off on your own! It's a dangerous time for even a member of the Royal Family to be left alone."

What was Nabooru's response to the situation?
135332212111.title: Princess Nabooru

choices: The Guards agree and leave her alone.
The guards insist on returning her to the castle.
1353322121111.content:
Nabooru snorted at the two guards, "What is this? Who are you to order me about?"

"We-"

Nabooru gave the order, "Kneel!"

The two guards stopped, kneeling on the grass. She smiled at their obedience.

"Forgive us," said one, "But the King's orders-"

Something flashed in Nabooru's mind. The King of Hyrule was her father now, and she now knew him all too well. As far as he was concerned, his daughter was a royal figure and thus in need of constant protection. His protective nature makes sense for someone like the original Zelda, she thought. But a proud Gerudo warrior like myself needs no such edicts. "I am safe, and I was enjoying myself before you two came along. Leave me in peace," she ordered.
1353322121111.title: She responded with an attitude (Still her own p...

choices: She uses the Swap Wand on them.
13533221211112.content:
The two guards looked at each other, then stood back up. "Forgive us, but our orders were to keep you safe. We must escort you back inside the castle," said one.

"Please come with us. We have no desire to hurt you," said the other.

Nabooru snorted, "Neither of those will be happening today."
13533221211112.title: The guards insist on returning her to the castle.

135332212111121.content:
Nabooru stood proudly against them, "Come and take me, if you dare."

The two guards looked at each other, sighed, and rushed her.

It was over before Nabooru realized it. She had the life of a princess, and the guards in front of her were now better at combat than she was. Within moments, one of the guards was holding her over his shoulder. Nabooru's fists clanged against the guard's armor in vain. "Let go of me! I order you to release me at once!"

"You'll only hurt yourself if you keep doing that, Princess Nabooru," said the guard as he began to walk away.

The other guard called out, "Hey, the Princess dropped something."

The first guard didn't turn. He just kept walking back towards the castle carrying Nabooru, "Just pick it up and bring it along."

The second guard nodded and picked up the wand. Instantly, the guard gained knowledge of the Swap Wand's reality-bending powers. "This artifact is incredible," mused the guard quietly. "I must use its power."

Once she decided to switch either Zelda's life or personality, Nabooru thought again about her choice.

If she switched Zelda's life with that of one of her warriors, then reality would change to make her believe she was always a Gerudo warrior. She would be living her days as Nabooru's loyal minion, willing to do anything for her, but the warrior would in turn be made the princess and live in the palace.

On the other hand, if she switched their personalities, Zelda would remain as princess, but still be loyal to Nabooru. She could willingly assist in robbing the royal vault or the stashes of visiting dignitaries. She would have to keep the Gerudo warrior with Zelda's personality under close watch, but this seemed like a better option for Nabooru to take.

Nabooru raised the wand and prepared to make the swap, but then she realized something. "Just who's life should I switch her with?" she asked herself.

"Perhaps I could switch her with my second-in-command. To see the Princess of Hyrule train the Gerudo and lead our raids would certainly be glorious. On the other hand, there must be someone among my tribe of little renown, one who would willingly do anything if she thought it would please me and improve her standing in my eyes. To see Princess Zelda reduced to my lowly, willing servant would certainly be grand. Not that I would ever treat one of my own in such a way, of course. But for Zelda..." Nabooru's lips curled into a smile, "I would gladly make an exception."

Having decided on what to switch, Nabooru waved the wand and watched as two beams of light flew from it, one flying towards Hyrule Castle, and the other at one of her warriors. The warrior briefly held her head as the beam hit her, then returned to her work, carrying herself in a slightly more elegant manner now. Nabooru grinned at the results.

"It seems to be a success. I wonder what else I should do with this. Or maybe it's time to visit the new and most definitely improved Princess."
13533221212212.title: A Gerudo State of Mind

135332212122122.content:
Just as Nabooru was about to think about her next move, a bird flew into the hideout and landed next to her. She noticed a note tied to the bird's leg, so she removed the note and read it.

"Lady Nabooru,

I need to speak with you immediately.
It's an emergency.
Please respond as soon as possible.

--Zelda."

Nabooru smiled and wrote back,

"Expect me and a small group to come later today.

--Nabooru."

Nabooru tied the response around the bird's leg and sent it away.

(Later that day)

Nabooru turned around and looked at the four other Gerudo warriors she would be journeying to Hyrule Castle with, including the Gerudo with Zelda's personality. She smirked as this particular Gerudo sat on her horse side-saddle while the others sat squarely on the saddle on their horses.

"Okay listen up! We're going to Hyrule Castle to meet the Princess. This is not a raid, so don't go causing trouble. Let's go!"

1353322121221222.content:
Nabooru and her entourage arrived at Hyrule castle. They left their horses at the stable, and Nabooru led them in. She looked around haughtily. The castle staff feared for their valuables, and although the guards watched them Nabooru recognized that they respected the fighting prowess of the Gerudo tribe and had no desire to fight. She could hear them whisper. They were concerned about having thieves so close to the Princess, of course, but they didn't seem surprised.

A young maid walked up to them, trembling as she curtseyed. "P-Princess Zelda has asked a private audience with the leader of the Gerudo tribe. She offers the tribe whatever food and drink we have available as they wait."

Nabooru nodded. She turned to her four warriors and noticed that the one with Zelda's personality had returned the curtsy. She held back a chuckle. "Enjoy their hospitality, but keep your wits about you."

The four Gerudo walked off, and Nabooru was led to Zelda's personal chamber. The maid opened the door, and Nabooru walked in. She looked around as the maid closed the door behind her, then ahead to Princess Zelda. No guards. Just her. If I didn't know better, I'd say this was a trap. But there is nothing to fear here. She walked forward, carrying herself as an equal to the Princess. "Princess Zelda. You sent for me?"

Princess Zelda nodded. She walked forward and Nabooru immediately noticed the litheness in her step, the posture of one ready to fight from any position. She approached Nabooru, walking a circle around her. "Yes. There is something very important I need to say to you."

Nabooru smiled, "Yes, Princess?"

Our fierceness, our skills with the blade, our... appreciation for small, uncared for objects. It is only natural that the Gerudo serve Hyrule. There is so much we could provide each other."

Nabooru froze.

Princess Zelda pulled her arm out behind her back, "Is this what you were looking for?"

Nabooru stared at the Swap Wand now in Zelda's hands.

Zelda asked, "Did you really think you could use this so easily in my presence? This really proves that it should be I who leads your tribe. Do you agree yet?"

Nabooru glared at her in silence.

Zelda twirled the baton around a bit, "Oh come now. Surely I am far more qualified to lead the Gerudo than you. Do I not look the part more than you do?"

Nabooru looked down and bit her lip. Princess Zelda may have been born to a human, but she had the body of a Gerudo with her prominent nose, tan skin, and long red hair. She was even wearing the figure-revealing outfit of a Gerudo, complete with gem. Nabooru on the other hand had the body of a Hylian, and a blond, blue-eyed, fair-skinned one at that, wearing an outfit better suited to the princess of Hyrule than to the leader of the Gerudo. I was foolish to come in these clothes. All I've done was to make clear my intentions of gaining power over Princess Zelda. She was ready from the moment I walked in.

Nabooru tried to gather her confidence, "I did not gain the leadership of my tribe from my appearance but from my training."

Princess Zelda smirked as she waved the Swap Wand around, "Training? You strike me as one who has trained their manners more than their blade."

Nabooru couldn't hide the gasp. How could Zelda have known that she not only had the look of a Hylian Princess but the training of one as well? Hers had been an upbringing centered around kindness and compassion. She had barely eked out enough time to be a passable with blades and thievery, and she alone knew how much better-trained those under her had been. Nabooru was well-loved as a leader, but surely Princess Zelda's skills- She shook her head. I did not come this far in the Gerudo by doubting myself. I won't start now.

Princess Zelda nodded, "As I was saying, I order that you pledge your loyalty to me. And I won't take no for an answer."

Nabooru thought. She could accept fealty for now; that would buy her some time to figure out a way out of this mess. On the other hand, the Swap Wand was right in front of her. If she could grab it, she could not only escape the dilemma but take all of Zelda's Gerudo qualities for herself.

What was I even thinking, jumping at one of her guards like that? she wondered. Wait. Where did the Princess go? She... she escaped and left the guard... but when did the guard. Zelda smiled as she beckoned more knights over. "Take her to the dungeons as our prisoner," she ordered. "Keep her from speaking and make sure none of the Gerudo see her." She walked over to one of the knights and gave a sly smile, "You, inform the other Gerudo that they are to be our guests while their leader and I engage in... personal negotiations. Be sure the servants ply them with whatever food and trinkets are needed to keep them comfortable."

The knight bowed, "As you wish, Princess." He walked off.

"And as for you," Princess Zelda smiled as she looked into Nabooru's eyes, "I'll see you later tonight."

Nabooru struggled helplessly as the knights led her away.

**

Deep in the dungeons of Hyrule Castle, Nabooru was locked away in a cell. Her nose was treated, but her arms were shackled to the wall. The hours passed by, torches flickering their light, with no other company than her own thoughts.

Think, Nabooru. You used the Swap Wand to give Princess Zelda a Gerudo's personality. And she got one. And she tricked me. She wracked her brains. There had to have been something that she did to me. I would never had been captured otherwise. She thought back to her life. Her mother was a Gerudo, but her father had been a Hyrulian. For some reason, Nabooru herself looked completely like a Hyrulian. As she was raised, it was feared that the true Gerudo training would be to harsh on her body, so she was trained with more delicacy, almost like a Princess of Hyrule. But by hiding this fact from the others, Nabooru had been able to rise to leader of the Gerudo through her cunning and determination. And today, when she found the Swap Wand and planned to make an ally of Princess Zelda, she had worn robes befitting a Hyrulian princess, as if to announce her intentions in pride.

Did... did Zelda change my life with the Swap Wand somehow? Nabooru shook her head, No, that is how it's always been, she told herself. I'm sure I'd know otherwise... wouldn't I?

Nabooru's thoughts were interrupted as footsteps approached. She turned as best she could.

Princess Zelda opened the doors to the cell and undid Nabooru's gag. "You may speak. No one else will hear you, and your tribe is quite asleep."

"What did you do to me?" snarled Nabooru.

Princess Zelda smiled, "Everything is as it should be. Or will be. Now smile, because I want to show you this." From behind her back, keeping it just out of Nabooru's reach, Zelda pulled out-

"And who do you belong to?" asked Zelda.

"The relic and its souls have always belonged to the Hylian Royalty," answered Nabooru, "As have the Gerudo we lead."

Princess Zelda pointed the painting to the Hylian body, "And what is that?"

"That is a creation of the Gerudo, a work of art and magic," explained Nabooru.

"Does it need food or sleep?" asked Zelda.

"No. It is a work of art and nothing more. As long as it is cleaned and maintained, it should last for years."

Princess Zelda grinned at how it seemed that her victims knew as much or more about the world with each change than she did, "And who does it belong to?"

"It belongs to the Gerudo," answered the painting, "and thus to the Hylian Royalty."

"Why thank you for your generosity," Princess Zelda replied, "Now let us go. We should-"

He noticed something glowing under the surface of the blue lake by the entrance of the Water Temple. Sheik wondered what lied at the bottom. Should he swim down and see what it is or just leave?

Sheik felt an eery presence towards the wand. The Sheikah could easily tell it held magic, but what was it capable of? Sheik was unsure what to do with his newfound treasure. Should he go to someone else to figure out its magical properties or find a wizard who might understand this peculiar wand?

1353322221.content:
Lana and her companions had just cleared another enemy base. As Link, Zelda, and the others moved on th the next mission, she stayed behind to review the loot picked up so far. The reward for capturing this particular base came in the form of a red treasure chest, usually marking an important item or weapon. Lana walked carefully over to the chest, and opened it. Inside was a peculiar item. There lay a blue wand, only a tad larger than Zelda's baton. "Lucky me!" Lana exclaimed in a cheery tone. "I wonder what this does!" Lana, being an avid magic user, was very excited to use what she thought was her new weapon. Upon grasping the wand and taking it from inside the trunk, Lana's mind was instantly filled with the knowledge of the Swap Wand, what it does, and how to use it. "So, all I have to do is hold the wand and think of what traits or attributes I want to swap and with who I want to swap them with. This is an amazing item," Lana whispered to herself.

"Lana!" Shouted Zelda from a distance. "We need you at the front lines with us! Summonses have just called in a horde of new monsters!"

"Oh, uh... Be right there!"

Lana turned away from the chest, and started for the exit of the base. As she was running, a thought appeared in her head. "I could definitely try my new wand right now!" At first, she dissregarded it. Her friends needed her help! But, after a few moments, she stopped and thought to herself for a bit. Should she join her friends and allies on the front lines, or stop and test out the Swap Wand?
1353322221.title: Lana (Hyrule Warriors)

13533222212.content:
"Hmm... My friends are pretty strong. I think they will be alright. I'm going to see what this wand has to offer!" Lana finally decided. She proceeded to sneak behind a wall to a secluded area she had found in the moments before finding the wand. It was hidden well enough so, it seemed, that even monsters and the occasional cucco wouldn't be able to disturb her. "Great! I can test this thing all I want in here," she said with glee.

Lana then leaned against the wall of the enemy-turned ally base she was behind, and examined the wand closely in her hands. It was a kind of blue wood, about the same color as the shade of her hair. The red-transparent tip was rounded; almost as if there was a mini crystal ball on the wand itself. Definitely a peculiar magic item, but Lana knew it had great potential.

"Now for the hard part," Lana thought to herself. "Who should I swap with?"

1353322221211211.content:
There was a bright flash of light, and Lana was blinded for a moment.

Despite not being able to see, she could feel that something had changed. No longer could she feel the cool breeze blow on her exposed stomach and shoulders, or the small weight of her necklace. Instead, she felt something on her that was rather odd. Her clothes now felt heavy, and she was positive very little skin was showing. It was a completely new experience for her, considering she had never worn this amount of clothing before.

When she regained her vision, Lana's predictions were right. "Wow, it actually worked!" She was now wearing Link's signature green tunic, white pants, knee-high boots, and hat. The swap had also caused her light blue hair to go from a ponytail to just straight down so she could wear Link's hat. After Lana tested the clothes out running and jumping a bit, she found the clothes a bit heavy, and annoying to walk around in. Her breasts were unsupported, and they jiggled and chafed too much every time she tried to run. She sat down on a nearby rock and contemplated what had just happened

"Wow, I'm still amazed this actually worked!" She said to herself. "Even though Link's clothes are uncomfortable and bulky, I still feel exhilarated and even little turned o-"

"AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!" Screamed a low pitched voice in the distance.

Startled, Lana stood straight up. She knew exactly who's voice that was, and she knew exactly why that person screamed. Link could tell that she swapped clothes with him. Lana was a bit nervous. Being the magic lover that she is, she didn't want to expose her new toy. What was she going to do?

"Lana! Get over here now!" Link shouted.

"C-coming!" Lana yelled back, flustered and embarrassed.

Lana ran back to where her friends were. Zelda was currently holding off an ally base under siege by some enemy monsters while Link was in the corner of the base, panicking.

"Explain yourself, Lana! Why have we swapped clothes? It must have been you that did it? Right? Tell me you did it now, Lana!" Link yelled, he sounded furious.

Lana...
